formed_review_text: It was recommended by the bartender and it did not disappoint..this upscale restaurant has a warm, welcoming feel.tuna tartar: best ever.a fun place to try!.

And tons of quirky gadgets in all the right places.sometimes it's pretty packed and hard to get a seat, but this is a great place in lincoln park.the servers brought my friends' meals to our table on cute wooden platters and they said everything was great - light but filling at the same time." clearly sensing i found this offensive, i had to ask if i could get something else instead.its a great addition to the neighborhood and i suggest you check it out!.

Maybe it's time to revamp, la scarola.) we were seated in front of a table of rowdy, drunk guys who proceeded to cheer every time they downed the multiple shots they were doing..bread was hard and dry; we got the old ends.the owner gave us a free round of drinks but that is not enough compensation for ruining my birthday night.totally full of character, nice guy working there, free shots, fun, big portions, food was tasty, an institution.the service was fantastic too.many describe this as "old school" but surmise that every popular restauranteur envies a place open as long as la scarola that people describe as their favorite.plus, it's nearly impossible for the servers to get through the restaurant themselves at times because it's so crowded.never in my life experienced anything like that.

Maybe tomorrow.very few seats so more of a take out joint or eat quickly.another great taco place with awesome negro salsa the steak tacos are tender not fatty , small place but never over crowded and the guy taking your order is always friendly.i would come back here for sure!.guacamole is really fresh and perfect smooth consistency.i ordered the steak, pork skin, and beef brain (feeling adventurous at the time.these are definitely a must try since both were delicious.one of my go to spots for authentic carne asada tacos in chicago.

Corned beef is fresh, juicy and delicious.it is.the pancakes.also, pancakes and french toast were delicious.there was a behemoth mound of corned beef in between the buns!!! it was very fresh, rich and moist.then i opened my food that turned out to be cold and lack all flavor.you can tell they really care about what they are doing.i had the turkey dinner which was deli sliced turkey tossed on the flattop.

There's burgers, polish sausage and fried shrimp on the menu.the service was really nice and the person at the register even made suggestions because this was our first time.service was jolly and friendly.awesome food.don't ever get the shrimp because they will rip you off..great service and staff! so friendly.

Some of the best donuts i have ever had.i've never had any of their chicken sandwiches, because i'm usually in this area around breakfast, but it's on my list to try one as soon as i'm here near lunch time!.the donuts did seem a bit pricey for the size, but if you are in need of breakfast or a pick me up, do-rite does right by me.once for a chicken sandwich, it was great!  and then another time for a donut, it was great as well!  we tried another shop down the street for donuts and there is no comparision.upgrade! not sure if there is an upcharge for switching from a glaze to this donut, but if there is i recommend doing this.carlos is a great professional who always makes sure you get the donuts you want.it was good but maybe a little too heavy on the shredded lettuce and a little light on the crispness of the chicken.everything is and tastes homemade fresh!!! everything is huge and delicious!  we had a bacon egg and cheese sammich, holy crap-it was huge and tasty!  i had the cbr chicken sammich, it was amazing!look for the tiny red door front across the street from the walgreens at the hospital.this place has been on my must eat here list since moving to chicago because gluten free donuts.i spent the entire ride home throwing up oil into an empty water bottle (sorry tmi) but i'm just being honest about my experience.

A nice safe meal in the loop.the cole slaw had a good flavor.a great lunch spot for those who work in the loop.salsa really flavors everything well.00.the chicken is well seasoned and always cooked perfectly.i go here 2 times a week.50 - $6.i always ask for dark meat (pardon me, white meat insisters), and the meat falls off the bone, is moist, and boasts of flavor.

Cool atmosphere and great food!! when i went into this restaurant it was packed.order a sausage pizza with mushrooms for delivery along with an italian sub.i had a great ministroni soup to start off, followed by a half regina and half potato and rosemary pizza.my wife ordered a salad, it was large enough to share for a lunch.good pizza and affordable.i highly recommend the vodka sauce..i've eaten a ton of pizza in chicago, because get real most of the restaurants downtown are either steak houses or pizza places.we ate here two times and loved it.after having waited 30 minutes, we asked the woman how much longer it would be, and she was really rude again and said 'its busy, you have to wait at least 40 minutes!' and we looked around, the restaurant was less than half full.

It's nice that they are opposite sides of tow and this one has a pick up window.everything else was amazing.we happened to be looking for a place around our neighborhood and just stumbled in and are we glad we did.this tiny place on milwaukee ave.my husband loves the chicken and we definitely tell our friends and family about this place every time they come and  visit.like there lunches, but love their breakfast.the service is bad and there's very limited seating out side , the patio is located next to a dumpster in what looks to me like the ghetto.had the mac an cheese and the fried chips for my side and they both were pretty well spot on.love stopping by this place or food truck.

First: you don't tell your customers you're out of the food you specialize in after their order has been accepted without an explanation like "but they are getting more" or "we apologize for the wait, it may be just a little longer"second: don't passive-aggressively mutter something under your breath when it was your employee who told your customer that you "ran out of chicken"all this to say - customer service was horrendous.this place is a chicken lovers paradise.and it's true!!the chicken is seasoned so perfectly and the portions are pretty large.the sauce isn't too think but not too funny, and the lemon one that i got to go with my food had a slight kick to it, but was still a perfect balance of lemon (but not too sour) and herb (but not overwhelming).the ambiance in this place is fun, casual and friendly.i always prefer the extra spicy, and dipping the chicken into the lemon-garlic sauce to get a good mixture of flavors.the staff was extremely helpful in helping the newbies order and settle in by bringing us forgotten silverware and sauces.can't wait to go back again.this place would normally have a higher rating but for the fact that i know what nandos is supposed to taste like.

We did endulge in the food before the drinks though and the chips they serve with the guac are one of a kind.the guacamole which has the correct limited ingredient of lime,chile, red onion and cilantro..anyway, the bathroom thing.service is great, so is the food.however, who i perceived to be the manager came to the door and said, "come on in - our bar is open" as he unlocked the door rather than having me stand outside the restaurant.we had a group of 10 people, and our waitress was attentive and patient, and so nice.some things have changed here.they were full too, but right away the hostess started arranging for us to get a seat..

I came here for the first time a couple nights ago.i will absolutely return to this place to eat, drink, skip rope, play backgammon, or talk horse trading.the rest of the menu is pretty basic and underwhelming, and burgers remain your best choice.no big cons.also, i didn't really like the fries.love this place! the staff is amazing! they could do a good sanding on the bar stools though.i hate when that happens.i'm giving this place 4 stars as i felt the drinks and appetizers were totally awesome!! we ordered the pork nachos which was delectable with the perfect amount of cheesy meat and tangy sauce.so i decided to try it with some friends on a nice sunny day since they have a rough top.regards,best friend's friend.

Must try, the tiger cry! i'm not sure why this dish is called what it is.couldn't say it's great, or the best in chicago, but it wasn't disappointing certainly.please note the food did arrive hot and was fresh.now dessert absolutely blew my mind.all in all super disappointed in this place with the slow customer service and mediocre food.red curry sweet potato chicken coconut was awesome.great decor inside, friendly services, and very delicious menu items!have been here on multiple occasions and have also ordered carry out from here as well and they have never failed me whenever i have cravings for thai food and flavors! some of my favorites are the khao soy with chicken, the papaya salad, and their seasonal mango with thai sticky rice.get the peanut sauce lovers.were they to engage more, this would be the best restaurant in south loop but they simply aren't set-up for that.

My love for cuban coffee brought me here.friendly service.instead of swinging by starbucks for your coffee needs, try out this place.whoops, i selected the wrong location.does it beat a rick bayless sandwich? no.i'm usually not a big fan of sandwiches but their sandwich is small, simple, and delicious! don't be scared off by their long line, they move really fast with their orders and the sandwich comes out in no time! i got the cubano(their #1 sandwich) and palomilla(steak sandwich) and both were beyond my expectation! if you are a sandwich lover, you would die for this place.waayy better than the usual loop stuff like corner bakery, etc.

Impeccable service.consistently amazing, foodie destination with top notch service.unfortunately for me at times it felt like my server forgot that i was seated there.sympathetic eyes back at the hostess were not met, we found a semi-open concrete corner by the stairs where we could breathe a little bit.mmmmmmm.very attentive, friendly and knowledgeable.for dessert we opted to share the chocolate namelaka.- negi toro: fatty tuna belly sushi rolls.dining was very nice, loved the setup.

The lobster roll is not bad either.lobster rolls are super yummy.can't wait to go back.good with friends and share.let me tell you shells were flying everywhere in a blaze of glory!no room for dessert because the portions are hearty.i have now been there twice and they don't disappoint.the clam chowder was also really good, better than any of the stuff i had in new england! the place is big and the decor is great.i got the po boy which was good.80s music and plastic bibs.the upstairs has a cool atmosphere and they are starting to serve brunch but for $35 all you can eat without drink seems high.

The service is the only thing better than the food is the service.best cup of coffee an easy walk from work in the west loop - & they're all about the neighborhood.good sandwiches at a very reasonable price.made to order, not microwave wonders.free wifi is nice for doing work or studying, and it's small enough that you can quietly get your stuff done if you are looking for a change of scenery.this cafe is adorable.
It takes about 15-20 minutes for your food order, but when you walk in see them hand pressing the gordita shells you know you are in for a special treat.

They have as a free taco to try.i love this place! i know good mexican food and this gentleman is no joke.but if i don't have time or $$$ to go to wasabi instead (ultimate ramen house across the street), i will definitely hit up turbo tacos again!.50!.all in a friendly manner with a smile on his face.

Great place for two people to hang out or come here with a group of friends and watch the night disappear in this "perfect for conversation and relaxation" mecca.mainly young professionals--naturally, given the neighborhood-- but there was a good mix of girls' night out, happy hour round 3, and semi-uncomfortable first dates.skip this joint.

Pizza is one of my favorite meals and at roberts pizza company they do it wright.overall, we would not return -- it's too bad robert is not a chef and can run back of house and have someone competent run front of house.conversation we had.i was giving them a second chance and was hoping they would redeem themselves in my book, but it is nothing to rave about.not just good food but an amazing variety in tastes.we came for 2 days to chicago.and robert is not playing around.as she says: "sometimes the crust is just a delivery device, but at robert's, the crust is part of the experience!".this is probably the best salad and pizza i have ever eaten.prosciutto and arugula pizza: 5 stars.

My daughter and i stayed the weekend at hotel lincoln and stumbled across nookies while exploring the neighborhood.i'm from out of state and found this place on yelp and loved it.you will not be pleasantly surprised at nookies.staff here has been around for a while & do a great job!  perfect spot for brunch,  lunch or even dinner.the crowd tends to be younger (20's-30's).i'll be back next time i visit chicago.he took the orders, dropped off the food and that was it.corned beef ruben, side of fries with a coffee and soup, made a pretty great and tasty lunch for $10.huge omelettes, killer eggs benedict, great burger, and tasty caesar wrap.so glad we stopped.

There is a lot of memorabilia in the restaurant.i've only had delivery, so cannot comment on dining in.this is ridiculous, the food is good , we pay their prices , but the delivery is aweful! i sure hope something gets done , this is the third time its happened.treat your customers better ricobene's!.therefore, a fork wasn't really need in my case.i can honestly say i've been coming to this place all my life.waited 21 min for a steak sandwich that i never got..best sandwich in chicago and probalbly the us.overall a great experience!.

I felt this place was generally over priced.you'll be hard pressed to get me to say someone else's are better, but el milagro does make a better rajas tamale as far as i'm concerned.they embody everything she misses about food in chicago.first, i have to say holy crap these tacos are huge.can't wait to go back!.i usually get the tacos or the burrito.now i have half a burrito for lunch tomorrow.also there is a special on chicken taco with mole! looks new to the menu since its on a separate board.i prefer that on the side.

Would definitely come back - excellent service and menu!.be careful with the crab bites, and expect to pay for everything even if its uneatable.when spending over $200, i expect to be happy when i leave.pass.we had to wait about 15 minutes past our reservation time, which was frustrating because there was a table for 2 open the entire time we waited.we will definitely be coming back and i strongly recommend this restaurant.would definitely come back for the oysters." (i believe they do have ice cream as well but who's keeping track)also our waiter was very helpful and attentive.make sure you make your reservation early because they are often booked.

The service: 4.as i recall, we opted for a corbieres from languedoc-roussillon, which was a perfect match with the rustic, flavorful dishes.the drinks are excellent - we extensively sampled that menu and we were never disappointed.this place was amazing.went there last saturday for a friends bday party and i thought that the place was good overall.admittedly, i'm anti small portions and pretentious plating so this isn't a place i would normally choose to dine at (but it was a friend's birthday).they also gave us a nice chocolate dessert for my sisters birthday! on the house!.

Oh, they also have beer and brunch.i recommend the buffalo chicken wrap.great little atmosphere and delish vegan choices at affordable prices.the food was great.been going since it opened.fresh, healthy delicious.we both went for the grilled chicken and avocado sandwich so we decided to just share that and get the mahi fish tacos and the roasted brussels and squash.there are a lot of different menus that cater to different dietary restrictions (vegan, gluten free, etc), which can give you a lot of options for whatever you may plan to eat.i drank a mango slushie which to was tasty and fresh.

I devoured it rather quickly and found myself wishing i would have savored it.however, a few hours later i was not so happy that i had brunch here as i got very sick to my stomach..coffee is good but you can taste the magic in the freshly squeezed on (a must have).i thought the food was pretty good.been here twice for breakfast.be prepared to be overwhelmed by the menu, there's a lot to choose from.the hash browns are not well done here so not the crispy style.i got the chicken fried steak skillet which was yummy.it's just, why do it this way? why not let people write their tip on the payment slip like everywhere else? it just feels off-color to force diners to say the tip out loud.

Pretty healthy meal and a good price.staff was very sociable and the burger was delicious!.they are quite tasty and very filling which justifies the price perfectly.i am not happy with the customer service.i still thumb up and 5*.they didn't have the rice balls so we opted to try the chicken empanada.i am so happy they've opened up near me ! this place does everything well, especially the acai bowl and empanadas.

We order separately but they don't do check split.too many people in line so we did take-out and walked home.what a bull***t.for a restaurant manager (or anyone in the hospitality industry, for that matter!) to give so little consideration to customer experience (for a bill that was considerably less than $100) is outrageous.we got 2lb of mussels with raging spice maniac sauce and 6 corn, and a calamari.be prepared to get messy so keep that in mind.not even close to the broiler and crawfish on dempster.enough food for two people.first visit maniac spice level 3, tasty garlic, heat not apparent.i wish we had a location in michigan!.

Only down side is that the wifi is horrible here.this is a great little cafe to duck into and have some quiet work time, even though outside is a major noisy intersection, i love that clean and sleek decor of the place.the drinks are high quality and every food item i've had is delicious.if you're super tired and want the satisfaction you get from the first sip of a delicious pick me up then you probably won't get it here.can't argue with that!.the mood is pretty chill.highly recommend coming here!full disclosure: i bring my laptop and work out of here a lot.

It's delicious and clean, and the staff is friendly.the food is so good and the staff is so friendly.although we had to remind them about our naan and lassi, the service was friendly and attentive with refilling our water every time it got low.it is so good to have some indian foods in the loop chicago.great service with even better quality food.all he food was spectacularly flavored; the chicken momo (ginger/coriander-spiced dumplings) were an amazing start.when i firs.trust me one of best food we have in usa.i had the chicken samosas, the chicken tikka masala and garlic naan.the food here is very good, i ordered lamb, i like the sweet sauce, my friend ordered biryanis, we shared the food, it is also great.

It was awesome.that is not a "usual" preparation and should have been forecast on either the menu or by the waiter.fantastic addition to the fulton market neighborhood.oh the chicken, was the definition of moist and crispiness.the only disappointment for me was my cocktail which i found overly boozy and not well-balanced.i got the duck and it was so rubbery i ended up not eating it and ate some of my husbands pork chops instead, which were okay.

I ordered the shrimp sandwich and it took more than 30 mins to get my meal to go.one thing i really liked about this place was the portion size was prefect.i am vietnamese so i suppose i have high expectations but let me say that these are not authentic vietnamese sandwiches.i highly recommend the shrimp sandwich and i personally like adding the rice paper wrap so i get all of the flavor without all of the bread.super flavorful.right next to billy goat!?inside:same menu (plus zenfries, which i did not get) .

When i arrived at the the convention center and opened my meal it was not curry shrimp i found.food was good but a little pricey for the portion.i was all "did they have to go to the market, buy a live chicken, kill it, pluck it then roast it? what's taking so long?" then they finally called my number.i had their chicken curry over pilaf special (5.the cheesecake was good, making for a nice dessert once i returned to the hotel.best hole in the wall spot in the south loop.i didn't realize there are two restaurants with different menus within the same space.chicken and rice amazing.i only had the fried chicken.

I want their pies to sit on my face! i'll gladly pay for it.i will not be returning.i have taken a six and one and a half year old here on a busy night, and we had a blast..the sweet heat, brickhouse and ditka za were enjoyed by everyone in our group.i thought the place was a cozy, casual place! i loved the setting and the brick walls!i got the creole shrimp pizza, and it was amazing! there was so much flavor to it! it did cost a dollar extra compared to the other pizzas, but so worth it!customer service was regular, nothing special.i ate in once and enjoyed my meal but this was way over priced and not good.you can't go wrong.excellent pizza, great atmosphere below street level.good beer selection.

Thats why i ordered it again this time.they get you in and out like pros.i've been twice and haven't enjoyed it as much as other italian restaurants in little italy.still good but i had talked up the place to her before a bulls game.the food was great!  we have the cavatappi ala rosebud and the stuffed mushrooms.eggplant appetizer was very good.oh, almost forgot to mention the warm italian bread and greek evo w parm cheese.will definitely come back! :).really?  went in for pickup.
The food was delicious.

Overalla nice addition to the taco scene in logan square with solid choices.aye papas i done saw them mexicanos in that kitchen prolly all chuckling at the lack of heat in them salsas.we sat near the kitchen and watched them make and roll fresh tacos.especially the brisket.i started researching, and i read great things about the general.my date got a taco that was a take on a po' boy and he really dug that and we both shared a pork belly mac n cheese.good beer list with a lot of local choices..i'll definitely be back, probably sooner rather than later!.i liked it so much and was still hungry after the two tacos that i ordered my own mac and cheese.

Headed over to riccardo enoteca to enjoy the summer weather..it's a truly italian enoteca with a giant selection of small plate foods.i haven't tried the others, but now i want to!.wow - excellent pizza, salads, pasta and service.as for other reviews citing poor service and long waits: it's not a big place, so yes you may wait a bit, but the waiter was friendly and the atmosphere was enjoyable.all of the food we tried was good, but nothing was memorable.the food was fantastic, it was affordable and so so romantic!! it really is a gem in this neighborhood.went to riccardo for a casual monday evening meal with a friend.

They wanted to know what was wrong - so sent someone to pick up the food, examine it, and make sure it did not happen again.love the shrimp fried rice, lamb cumin, tofu mapo and chili chicken!.waste of 20 bucks..randomly stopped in after my weekly hair appointment at stranded because i noticed all the asian customers.when i talked with a mean-looking face waitress, she refused to admit that there are something wrong with the soup and just contemptibly said:" oh, if you do not like the soup, we can cancel the order.i probably would order the spicy boiled fish again, but everything else was just toooo salty.both are really tasty.i only wish i knew what to order better.

Not overcooked and well seasoned (i..great cocktails and an interesting menu.we were both very happy with our orders.the bar itself looks like a historical building with decorative, interesting taxidermy in various places.brilliant.thank for the great night.hotdog wasn't my favorite but it was good..i just really want you to order the duck blt.

The service can be poor, very often disorganized.but when we have a group we get the garbage deep dish and it's great!  garbage burger is also delicious!.coffee was excellent and croissant was heavenly.i'd return!.i ordered the moz- ingredients seemed fresh, but the sandwich was absolutely flavorless.sure, the pizza was good.it was closed when i just went, so i need to go back soon to check it out!and food wise, the menu has too many great options i had to have my server choose between a big salad covered in bacon and cheese and such, and the tuna steak sandwich served with this ginger mayo sauce.deep wood tables and trim with brick walls don't feel so heavy with the high ceiling dining room..cappuccino and mexicana shake are good.

We were greeted at the door by the owner himself, who welcomed us to sit.we ordered the half kilo of steak and i ordered the half chicken.amazing place with great service.there was a mariachi band for a private party upstairs there once  and it was  deafening.more on that to come)we started with the guac and chips and i was thrilled to find that it was the same as nuevo leon's, chips and all :)i went for the carne asada which came with the tasty, yet spicy frijoles charros, a large plate that i probably could have shared, which brings me to the only real criticism of this place,  my grams is a tiny thing and when she ordered the the brochetas  (kabobs/skewers) i wish the waiter would have mentioned how much food it was going to be, it was enough for three people and also came with beans..i have to say that it's a great place to have dinner or even brunch with your significant other, the food is absolutely amazing.don't get me wrong i can't wait for nuevo to reopen but you can't get a better breakfast than this.lucky me! i had the skewers and they were amazing! the salsa was perfect and the flour tortillas were homemade legit! great, attentive service, too!.

Have been going here for almost five years.i understand that american tacos have all that extra stuff, but honey, you came to a place called taco el jalisciense - not taco el americano.the prices were very reasonable and i enjoyed the small and friendly atmosphere.our taco dinner (3 tacos for $9.i can't say enough! i'm in shock.my one wish: that their chicken for tacos was shredded.i ain't mexican but i sure love the authenticity of his food and i appreciate the fact none of his dishes have been americanized.my husband ordered a steak tostada and taco dinner.well anyways i ordered one and he brought it to me slightly frozen..

The staff was very attentive.luckily, this place is close to home and offered seating for two in under 15 minutes.when the food arrives, i will slowly, purposely devour whatever is front of me.my sister and i both got skillets and shared the bread pudding french toast  so good!!i clearly have a problem i've been to this place more times than i can count.we will be back for sure.our meals were delicious a repeat for sure.love everything about this place.bottomless coffee cups.staff was very friendly and the food came out fast!  coffee was good.

I ordered the parmburger which very unique and delicious.we ordered the loaded jojos as an appetizer and they were delicious.i saw an earlier review that complained that the calzone was awful.their dough recipe is just awful.the food taste so fresh and delicious, especially the pasta is cooked just the way we remembered from italy! the parmburger and also the potato wedges are also my fav! the owner anna and her son are so friendly, we cannot get enough of this place, go visit as soon as you can :).the ameritalia was delicious! the bread was perfectly baked, soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside.four stars because the atmosphere leaves a bit to be desired, but this place is definitely worth a visit.cute place.honestly, the only thing that made it worth eating was the super flavorful tomato sauce (although there wasn't enough of it) that they provide for dipping.ameritalia is exactly what you want in a local restaurant and i highly recommend it to all south loop locals and visitors.

They told me i could come back to the restaurant to pick it up.really good! too good.the service was very nice, very happy and upbeat.it might be the combination of a hot brazilian meal coupled with a rich dessert that really completes the day.so after placing an order from here for delivery and waiting an hour and forty five mins, after being told it would be delivered in 45 mins i have to say, i'll never order from here again.fast and good food.their variety and combination of food makes it worth it to comeback.it was always ready in a timely fashion, the service is always quick and pleasant as it gets.he asked me if i wanted to order something healthier.

It's always a good choice as the food is good and the beer and wine list will satisfy anyone in your crowd!most recently we had a large group get together for some "daytime drinking" which is always a fun time.very few people throughout the place.good oyster happy hour but $1 bacon was kind of embarrassing - literally 1 strip of bacon is served, nothing special about it.never got refills for our drinks, took forever to leave.oh the mussels! i love this place.i still love her as much today as i did on that cold wintery night, when i first discovered her.then, when ordering, the waitress said "what kind of fries would you like?" i assumed then that this meant they were included so i ordered them, only to find out that yes, they still added extra cost.i too miss the rueben, but $8.the bartenders are friendly and funny as well as the regulars.didn't try food or drink, sorry.

I've only had their gelato, but it is always excellent.i'll go back.staff is great food is great.just opened, but a nice vibe.i ordered a meatball sub and was very happy to have that perfect combination of crisp bread and soft meatball.can't wait to try the salads!.i'll stop here any time i can!five stars arent enough!i love this place!!!.

Such a hidden gem! :).wow!  what a nice surprise!  authentic, delicious, mexican food in an adorable setting, with a charming and talented chef/owner.simple food, complex mole sauces.whoops, guess that's my tell.all in all my experience was very mixed, and i would be hesitant to recommend this restaurant or to return to this restaurant.can't wait to go back!!!.family owned restaurant where everything is great starting with the homemade chips and salsa.i love the attention, very polite servers.

The food isn't bad, but do not order from here if you're doing delivery.never will go here again.i just don't understand why you think someone is willing to pay $6.straight out of the can corn (with water in the cup), a heart attached size amount of mayo, cheese, and chili powder.i waited nearly 20 minutes for a to-go order placed at the counter, a burrito should not take that long.i come here as little as possible due to this issue.spot on.i just had a churro, but it was the best churro i ever had!  defitnitely the best one you can get downtown.i think the chicken and pastor were the best.the food is superb and amazing, just a bad restaurant location.

Wow!i will definitely return.delicious!!!!!!!!!!!!!p.great food! come starving because the food is home-cooked deliciousness.this is truly a dining experience,  from when you pull into the parking lot of this brownstone and welcomed into the living as family friend with the other guest.you just got to try!.went for the sunday brunch buffet and had a good time.it was a moment of food synergy--the ingredients combined to establish a harmonious sum far greater than its parts.the only drawback was the tight seating area.lots of character and charm.she explained all the dishes that she prepared.

Ya know, like i could totally see my gramps hanging out here, scratching off lottery tickets and digging into a pastrami on rye.the space is really small with a few stools at a counter to eat but really i enjoyed every bite of my sandwich.

Pretty affordable and yummy.had the salad with greens, salmon, cous-cous, tomato/cucumber, feta, pita chips, olives, and vinaigrette.chicken was delicious and the bread made by themselves was extremely great.i went to lunch with my in laws and they suggested this place.you can get all of the fillings on a pita, wrap or just on a plate.i have a major pet peeve when it comes to falafel: huge, glaring pieces of chickpeas.try the grilled vegetables and tomato-cucumber salad to even out the taste palette of plate.
5, even though i was shy to give it the full 5 star rating.95) - 3/5 - the flavors were good but it could have a more generous toppings-to-fries ratio, especially for being $10.

White truffle pasta was the best, calamari and carpaccio appetizers are a must.at the end of our meal, the waiter came by with some limoncello to welcome us to the neighborhood.great place to go if you have a dog and want to enjoy some outdoor seating.mr.we started with calamari fritti, fresh and good.homemade pasta is amazing.superb service.when the bill arrived, they charged my mother $30 for cutting the cake, and they were not being flexible.the octopus and calamari were cooked perfectly (so tender) and had a lot of flavor.

Really good sausages here, pretty much hot dogs.i would recommend sticking to the butter and jam.i sat for 5 minutes at the bar (one other person was seated at the bar) and i was never served.bravo.on to food: we started with fries, which were nothing special.i loved the spaetzle - it was perfectly buttery with crispy garlic chips on top.sausages were some of the best we've had.nice roomy place great for groups.very casual spot; nothing fancy at all, but a fun place to hang out.that made me really happy! by fourth course i was already filled to the max with all they fed us.

The spinach fondue is sinfully decadent, and comes with a buttery flatbread for dipping.the wild mushroom risotto that my colleague had was a hit and the wild boar bolognese blew me away.salads here are excellent--perfectly dressed and seasoned, with a interesting balance of contrasting flavors.the food service can do better by being a little friendly.many other options within inches of this place.went there on sunday and it was wide open.hot rum winter cocktail - strong, but sweet.we had a friendly server with an awesome mustache (didn't get his name) who gave us good suggestions.and for dinner it took a very long time (i estimate 20-30 minutes) just to get our appetizers (bruschetta, nothing complicated) with no acknowledgement from our server.the only down sines for us were that it's a bit pricy and the place is also a bit noisy.

Prices are affordable - approx $10 +/- per person.hope it lasts longer than the last couple of places that have occupied that spot.let's clarify on the gogi bowl.plenty of pay to park parking all down the street.i had there taco with korean steak, korean salad mix, green onion, seoul sauce, crushed sesame seeds and a wedge of lime.fusion food and doesn't cost an arm and a leg.the chips were crisp and a little greasy, just the way i like them.their tacos are awesome too.absolutely delicious! the spicy pork burrito is my favorite.super boring.

The food and coffee is super fresh! the place may be small but it's a comfortable place to be.they are filling and delicious (french bread, black beans, pico de gallo, cheese).i will be back for a taste of the menu and variety of coffee.tiny space, but the food is amazing! every single time i've come in here and tried something new, i've enjoyed it to the fullest.i come here early in the mornings, about 7:15, and always get the turkey sandwich on focaccia and an iced mocha coffee.the coffees and sandwhiches hit the spot, especially the tuna melt! it can be cramped at times and there may be a wait on weekends.i'd get it again!  in the winter months, the mexican hot chocolate is a must try if you are looking for something cozy.maybe it's more of a coffee shop on a weekday?  price we paid was $23 after tip.i miss going there so much that after i left my job, i have gone back a couple of times.

We decided to try this place out when we first got to the navy pier.never before have i had such substantial and delicious pizza.came here to try chicago deep dish pizza and we were not disappointed.late check-in/review.the deep dish crust was great though.we felt a little left out near the end of our visit as our server got overload with other customers so we didn't see her for 10+ minutes at a time.i don't see what the hype is all about..huge pizzas!tip: the pizzas are huge! take a look around!.

They had me at "french toast flights".our server was the best! nice black man who told everyone little riddles during breakfast (forgot his name my bad).service:  hostesses were neutral - 2.delivered over 45 minutes after original eta (could track driver's location and she was waiting at the restaurant for 30 minutes for the order to be finished).drooling to go back!.the lemon came in at a close second, but all of them had a superficial flavor.

The burger is hands down better than au chevals and it's literally a half a block away from it.the skewers and drinks were the definite highlights.the cocktails were tasty and summery.took us a little while to get seated, and drinks took a while.

Imagine a piece of that on the crust."as good as it gets.and definitely throw out your expectations of getting a nutritious, healthy meal if you're coming here.i get anxiety just thinking about how hard it must be to manage those wait times/tables etc.the pizza definitely tainted my opinion of this place.but that is to be expected from one of the best deep dish places in chicago (so stop complaining, people).first of all, if you are relying on public transportation, be willing to go on a mini hike across the lepaul campus to get to this little gem.
I cant wait to go back there again.i highly recommend this over lawrence fisheries or goose island shrimp none of those to compare to this place.

The staff was warm and welcoming, recognized us as newbies and gave us the run down.will definitely be coming back!.really happy to have this addition to the neighborhood, and i will definitely be back again and again.the fish is fresh, the options are plenty, and fresh and it is so delicious.although it was good, the pictures on uber eats and some on here  are very misleading.throw in some delectable spicy tuna and a plethora of toppings (seaweed salad, jalapenos, tempura crunch sprinkles, among others!) and you've got a real winner of a dinner (or lunch, or let's be real -- i'd eat it for breakfast).

Food was good and service was friendly..food was pretty good, but kind of expensive.love it.i recommend!.the space is a bit cavernous.it's byob and fresh orange and peach juice were provided for mimosas, which was a nice addition.it's the little things.i wanted to love this place.as mentioned, you can byot and it's better than most margs.

You come here for the hot chocolate and you stay here for the hot chocolate.lots of warm toned hues, which, appropriately, reminded me of chocolate lol.very busy, i suggest making reservations early.overall a great experience!.the homemade marshmallows are tasty!when i asked our waitress how much a bag of hot chocolate mix cost, she said $30, which i just think is too much money.i would definitely go back there another time.i just recently went for brunch for the first time and it was outstanding! my girlfriend and i only had to wait 10 mins at around noon and got a table by the open door/window.great place for a date or dinner with friends .

We are now home with my boyfriend in severe pain from food poisoning!!!  i'm so angry this was an awful start to the weekend.good casual ambiance for an after-work catch-up dinner.he was not personable.the so-called 4stars hotel's restaurant is absolutely a fraud..really nice restaurant for al fresco dining on the patio.the sliders were a little dry.a roasted chicken dish was good but small for the price.don't miss this place if your in the area.

On sundays they have $20 champagne bottles- perfect for mimosas!.this was the theme of the night- constantly having to stop the waitress to ask for things.and if you like cheap drinks, the mimosas and bloodies are on sale during brunch which is perfect for the clientele.doesn't get much better than that.it would have been better with more cheesy macaroni noodles though! the fries though- i did not like them at all.once we finished eating, she even brought a round of some sort of locally distilled liquor as a way to say "welcome to chicago.overall a great addition to old town and yes you're probably going to hear a boner joke or too if you come here.i'm still in awe of how she acted.

Oh, and the thai iced tea with boba (you have to ask for it) is delicious.my boyfriend swears by the fried tofu.byob, if you're into that.simply labeling the menu properly can avoid situations like this.amazing food!.wow! awesome service! brought a bottle of wine for dinner and as we sat down they brought out a bucket of ice water for the wine! i never had an empty glass of water the entire meal.the staff are always kind and attentive, making you feel right at home.to mix up your noodle game, try the sweet and savory golden (egg) noodles or the wide clear noodles in the pad khee mao.great thai spot.i suppose that means the experiences were not traumatic.

My brother and i ended up sharing the pulled pork poutine and a burger that had prime rib on it (sorry, not sure of the name!).my sister in-law and her boyfriend were in town visiting and we found ourselves downtown without a dinner reservation.jeff did an amazing job planning this event.-incorrect orders..we were completely disappointed.i love this place! i feel so cozy here, the food is amazing and what a great place for drinks! it is a great location and the food was really good.the waitress was super friendly and definitely willing to share her knowledge of the everything the sidedoor had to offer.and clearly it wasn't a winning strategy.thanks for a great final night in chicago! :).

When we were finally seated, we were greeted by a distracted waiter who we barely ever saw again.k.my colleague and i are on a business trip in chicago and we decided to check out this place yesterday based on the amazing yelp reviews.wowwy wow wow.but its not.bone marrow/steak tartare was tasty, and the roasted duck leg was delicious! pork schnitzel reminded my husband and i of pork katsu haha all in all bohemian house did not disappoint and met my expectations.i highly recommend giving this place a try!.

Three aces is a solid go to place.the duck fat chips was disgusting, i wouldn't recommend it to anyone.picture it: a super laidback punk-rock bar, staffed by friendly tattooed and pierced waitstaff.but i've been spoiled by my past experience with the lamb burger).great place with nice patio for a birthday celebration.we don't need you here.the hot sauce that comes with the popcorn was so good we got some to go.oh and easy parking on taylor st.dark ambiance sets the mood but hides dirty silverwear.i think this place would be better for dinner, but i'm not a fan of the ambiance.

An employee did confront the woman and told her that she cannot ask the customers for anything.they do a great breakfast as well as traditional mexican lunch and dinner..the enchiladas come with spanish rice, refried beans and a small green salad.also the huevos ranchera are great but ask for mole sauce on the side.went for a late lunch a few days ago and had good service and pretty decent food and great pricing.my cousin, friend and i came into angel's for the brunch buffet, and it was delicious.the hubby went with a taco flight while i went with the molcajete.

First, hoping this is a flattering comment, but this place's burgers reminded me of the freshness of an in-n-out burger.i work in the food industry myself, so i understand that this happens - however, it is a little bit of a mood killer.the place looks amazing with local flair and a clean setup.if you're watching your figure but your girlfriend is craving a deuce of double cheeseburgers, bob's salad makes a great option.

Between today and tomorrow i think i will slide back through and get a much simpler version.we searched yelp and stumbled upon this restaurant.thise wings however are pretty big and tasty w the housemade dipping sauce or the lemon pepper.food is decent but they're soooo slow.nothing compared to au cheval.and it's open til 4am! i got the mikkey's classic with a ad on of turkey bacon and added cheese to the fries and i made it a combo meal.the promotion was better than the food and service.this aint it.

? everyone has their own opinion but that doesn't mean you should explode it to everyone else.but the sauce is so so good ! and it goes so well with the fries !.-prices are still higher than nyc but as the owner has stated multiple times, he has overhead costs to pay for.so good thing we were eating in the store.so i was really excited to try this place when it came to chicago!the place is set up for you to order, get your food and leave.however, since i am pushing over 30, i would not want to have too frequently- you can tell it clogs your arteries and it not meant to be eaten for freshness or flavor nuance.i've had a few sandwiches that have had dry falafel balls.everyone raved on his big the portions are.you get the best bang for your buck if you pick the regular rice plate with a combination of chicken and lamb.i'm convinced the phone is permanently off the hook and there's no actual phone number for the business.

On a friday night around 8, we were seated with no wait.we also had the veggie empanadas and the yuca with the chimichurri.all were so flavorful.so juicy and tender..the food here was absolutely delicious! however, it was nearly 3 hours from our arrival until getting our food so we likely won't be going back.i'd definitely recommend that if you have a group of people and want to try a little of everything!.very,  very good, though i felt the beans might have been missing a pinch of salt.it was busier than i expected but there was no wait even though the place is pretty small.

I will be back again to check out the wine bar in the basement - fingers crossed it will be open this time!.a delicious dish of sautéed shrimp,scallops, clams, garlic and olive oil in a spicy tomato sauce.wine: we chose a middle-of-the-road red wine.the dinner came out in a few minutes and i was immediately impressed by the fact that the pasta was real, homemade pasta freshly made in house.the sangiovese wine was a better choice, which i ordered next.if you go are dare you to try and be disappointed.and the entree pasta dish i got was amazing.i didn't get a chance to try the tiramisu or chicken but the rest of the group did and enjoyed it.right outside the hotel, the sign says disotto enoteca but once we were inside, we were at francesca's.good wine list also.

Won't be coming back.those are the only reasons i am giving it 4 instead of 5 stars.what else could you ask for in fried chicken? odd enough, the fried fish seemed to be the favorite though.the first time i had one of their margaritas,  i assumed it would be average.my friends had wanted to come here for the campari slushy, but i opted for the dark and stormy slushy.the steak tartare i also had on my most recent visit was seriously lacking in the flavor department (i know what you are thinking, what kind of jerk orders steak at a place that has chicken & fish in it's name).spicy fried chicken and frozen negronis, i couldn't imagine a more heavenly pairing.great place to hang out with friends.i'm going to have to try the regular fried chicken and grilled chicken next time, but the atmosphere is good enough to come back and give the rest of the menu a chance.i was bummed i couldn't get the chicken and waffles.

This place is a hidden treasure on 18th, it has great food at a reasonable price! so far we have only been here for brunch, but  i'm sure it's great for lunch too!the chef personally gives recommendations at your table, there has never been a wait.you can really tell they care about the food they create..this is my favorite place in pilsen.so iyelp.

It fills up quickly.my friend ordered the fried catfish which came with fries and it looks fantastically done.fyi.but obviously, you come to half shell for the seafood, so let me break it down for you: ah-maxing.i've also ordered the jumbo shrimp which were great as well.and the price was hard to beat!!!! this is going to become a monthly spot for me!.i had the crab cakes they were really good.left and went to nando's right next door and the food was fantastic and the service was magnificent.definitely going back soon.oh yeah, ca$h only!.

A ton of vegetarian options.i don't own a microwave and am too hungry to heat it in the oven so i'm just wishing i hadn't spent 23 dollars after lasagna, salad and tip.best gluten free pizza! the spicy chicken pizza is to die for.however, when they told me how much it was going to cost, after doing some quick math, i realized that they still added the extra fee..one of my favorite neighborhood spots.when i arrived at 9:47pm, the kitchen is already closed.i recommend the mista salad or wrap.we ordered the cheese lasagna and the chicken pizza.no alcohol served but they have outdoor seating where i noticed others bringing their own.
I went back and got the chocolate4 donut and it too was very good.lattes here are hit and miss.i would highly recommend glazed and infused!!!.

I always get the nachos.i love how bike friendly this place is..we also ordered the spinach empanadas (server brought out the chicken ones), but we ended up getting the spinach ones eventually and those were nothing impressive either.a gem of a chicago bar, more personality than all the weridos that go there, including me.also, this place operates in a high crime area but it only hires one bouncer and he is primarily  check ids, so a conceal and carry is highly recommend in case you need it.interesting drinks on the cocktail list - i had a tattooed pumpkin (sailor jerry rum, pumpkin liqueur, and cream, with a graham cracker rim), followed by a vander mill totally roasted (toasted pecan and vanilla) hard cider, in a can, which is new to me.an old high school friend and my cousin wanted to catch up over a meal, so i suggested simone's.good food with a nice variety.coming here, i felt at home.

The new menus do not carry the luster they did in their old format (the ones with half v full potions).the bread was fairly dry and heavy, which is not what i think of when i think of monkey bread- adobo pork belly egg biscuit, which i thought was solid but but not as flavorful as i hoped it would be.i came by sable friday night for a drink with a few friends.sable.ordered the truffled florentine benedict for the main which was pretty good- truffled hollandaise was smooth and well seasoned, eggs properly poached with a nicely runny yolk.we opted for four dishes to share, which were then coursed out for us.food: glazed carrots was nice and light.i loved how unique the dishes were, with some creative flair to 'em!!  same for their drinks.the menu is thoughtful and creative and the chefs execute the meal offering inspired flavor combined with unique creativity.the waiter was friendly and fun from the start and paced the meal really well when we indicated we weren't in a rush.

The staff is very friendly and greet you as soon as you walk in the door.they were both delicious! i may have to take a break on buffet spots and visit here more often.they do have a specialty with their sushi.we can highly recommend this place!.we were in town for a concert and stumbled across this place.they served us a delicious cucumber+sesame seed+soy sauce salad that tasted very fresh.the rolls were excellent! the sushi rolls were fresh and tasty.for dessert i had the green tea ice cream, which i thought could be more strong but ice cream is ice cream so no complaints there.again, nothing wowed me.i would actually go back for the super crunch.

We had such an amazing dinner here.the service is great and the drinks are sweet but be sure to save some room for dessert because you you're taste buds will thank you.take it from a venezuelan: try this place, it won't disappoint.take the nostalgic venezuelans or arepas fans in your life..everything was delicious,  tasted fresh.it taste like it was originally made in venezuela only better because of its premium ingredients.i ordered the beef arepa, and it was the toughest, most chewy the beef i have ever had.i wasted almost an hour and left hungry and disappointed.do yourself a favor and stay away from this place, i was exited to try this new restaurant but i walk out regretting it.

Here's to hoping they never change anything but their kegs.i've never had one, but they looked great as they came by.it's where your parents take you on a saturday evening to eat dinner and you drink kiddie cocktails while they catch up with friends and family.you do not see many tin ceilings any longer, so look up and enjoy the view, it may be gone in the future.

Place is fantastic!!!!! the food was delicious, well prepared, and sooo tasty.thank goodness for yelp and the happy crab!got a pound of alaskan king crab for $20!my belly was happy and my husband's wallet was happier.the atmosphere is clean and tasteful but a very odd fit for the neighborhood it is in.jim is amazing.she was very nice and made conversation with people at the bar...the clam chowder was the best i ever tried and crab legs are pretty good.the bus-boy didn't speak english and then another gentleman was frantically running orders to/from the kitchen.another order of the squid fries please!!! decided to try this place out after seeing it recently open in my neighborhood.

Fluffy buttery delishness that you can pull apart layer by layer.this place is for foodies..not only this but sourcing came up in conversation with the staff and all the ingredients are sourced as locally as possible and with extreme quality in mind.the buttermilk tart was simply mediocre.1.for all the foodies out there, put it on your list.make sure you come early-ish, because they stop making and start running out of pastries in the early afternoon.the vegetables are not just local and fresh -- which is important -- but the dishes are designed to highlights the vegetables themselves.yes, $5 for tea is insane and even $3 for a small mug of coffee (although it's refillable, come on, people, it's coffee!).

My first experience after taking the seat was that it was the shortest menu i have seen.ambience welcoming, staff is friendly and food to die for.wasn't blown over by the good-but-not-great food or snail-speed service.bathrooms were disgusting- out of paper and smelly.on the downside the hostess staff is hit or miss - some great, others incompetent.#josegarces #mercatalaplanxa.mercat came through again for us.still, i gave it four stars because i found the dining experience to be enjoyable--the ambiance, the service and the food.service was excellent, food was great, and wine was delicious.

A cozy bar for winter and a stellar patio for summer.sneeze guard drink does not disappoint..drinks were also really well done..stopped in after attending the california nights event down the street.the staff is friendly, welcoming, and knowledgeable.still need to try the cocktails, which i'm looking forward to as i've only heard good things.environment is cozy and polished, but nobody was dressed up -- it was great.

Been here a couple of years ago and the food was very good.i was a little iffy on what exactly i was eating, but it was some combination of egg, chicken, chorizo, and croutons..if you are looking for a good spin on macanese fusion, eat here! note : the bakery will open soon, and so far what we've had in the restaurant.what he didn't mention was that the portions tend to be on the "ample" side.the other dishes we ordered were just greasy and/or too salty.com/p/bkj3dhlh…all deliciousness in all its glory^^instagram.

Maybe the ingredients were different as the restaurant specialized in northern chinese.i would never eat here again.but i will have to have someone with me.place is pretty clean.the taste was sensational and the spice level was at the perfect sweat and endorphin inducing level many know is the key to life and happiness.when i go, i can't help it, i have to order at least 5 things! each one is always super-delicious, and when i get full, i wish i could eat more - dangerous! the prices are good, the decor is quaint and quiet, the service is wonderful, and the street parking has always been easy.it's small and cozy, but not cramped.the other three i enjoyed thoroughly especially the boiled dumplings and the friend pancake style one.in terms of the northerner's style of chinese food, they do beat everyone else.the xiaolongbao here is good, but there are places with similar offerings with better service.

This place is a gem!!.usually, we try to find near by free residential parking, but there wasn't any.i went with the butter chicken, which was rich and nicely seasoned (although slightly salty, but if you get rice, it kind of mellows it out).omg by far one of the best restaurants u can find on taylor street!!!!!! the butter chicken so tender very flavorful n just spicy enough!!!!!i'm addicted!!!! great indian foodcome get u the lunch special for just over $6.the butter chicken is tender and juicy with just the right amount of curry.i also had pepper chicken today and it is mind blowing.definitely good casual lunch or dinner spot worth checking out!.

We had the quinoa cake and tartare for a starter, the steak and duck confit for a main and both of the offered desserts.the appetizers were thoroughly fantastic, that i honestly can't decide what i liked the best of la mer: the soft shell crab, the scallop, or the prawns.all were delicious.the theme was lamb and every dish had some lamb in it.the dessert, in contrast, was absolutely amazing and refreshingly unusual--the zucchini ice cream was an delicious combination of savory and sweet flavors, and i loved the crunch that the croutons brought to cool sweetness of the ice cream.it was delicious, the perfect amount of spiciness from the chili oil! they give you a complimentary amuse bouche and bread.i have never had a rhubarb popsicle, hibiscus lassi, black lime dust, etc.

Impressive glass case of meats in the front of house, huge wine and beverage list.i wish the beignet was a bit thicker so it could really soak up the sauce), steak tartare (really good portion), amberjack sashimi (really light.good, but chewy and not worth $48 on its own.i'd probably go 3.the ambience is ok.we all ordered the steak frites dish as well.i also enjoyed some of the a la carte items like the beef cheek ravioli.it also came with a red wine sauce that paired really well.i definitely recommend the short rib beignets as an appetizer, as well as the boeuf fat fries and pumpkin spaetzle for sides! for dinner, i had the filet mignon with bordelaise, and it was perfect! honestly, probably one of the best steaks i have ever had! my husband got the salmon special and loved it.
I walked into boka exceptionally excited.the spanish octopus was the weakest dish of the meal.my boyfriend and i for dinner.
Bartenders are very nice..it's chic, has great views, comfy furniture, and an outdoor tv.so if you're not planning to spend, i would avoid this place.really nice rooftop lounge area.

Service was fast and the al pastor taco was amazing.great food and authentic! clean space and friendly service.seriously, awesome food.glad i tried it, but i won't go back.taco's are tasty.their staff is prompt, friendly and the food is delicious.they need to open up another location in the north/west side.so far great and friendly service.the menu is posted in several places along the walls.

The family/community atmosphere in this place is contagious and everyone working there was so welcoming.fresh, quality ingredients but price can be a little high on some things.$20 saved! we will definitely go back.make sure you say that you want your burger on a bun, otherwise you're going to get your burger on a kiser roll that tastes like a luffa.george & company run a tight ship and the staff has never been anything but pleasant and smiling.there are a few water bowls on the sidewalk, the first thing they ask you is "would you like a cup of water for the pup?" (and yes, i heard them ask this to others who sat down after us) and then they tell you how adorable your dog is.they serve lavazza coffee and it is amazingly brewed.

Each pizza was delicious and full of flavor.my husband & i both loved the thin crust pizza, bruschetta & tiramisu! we highly recommend this pizza joint!.the nutella pizza was good, but it is the tiramisu that is really standout..food  was great , perfect crust , great choices for toppingsbut the service was lacking we ordered drinks they cameafter the food not with the appetizer, when we ordered second rounds of drinks we wait and waited they cam with the bill.our server here was also very knowledgeable about pizza in general and their gluten-free options.ordered two pizzas, marinara and tre carne and both were divine with a crust that you would expect from a vpn certified pizzeria.also half of it did not have cheese on it as everything seemed to   have slid to the one side of the pizza.honestly almost everything on the menu looked like it would be worth ordering.
In fulton market, cold storage is attached to one of the hottest steakhouses in town.go.the equally great standout was the kitchen.

We sat at one of the tables in the back and it was so sticky, everything just stayed right where you put it.i am always on the look out for vegan/vegetarian food and carbon fits the bill ! i got 2 veggie tacos , a side of black beans and a side of rice for around $10.we stood around awkwardly, not knowing if we should find a seat or wait for our food.i'm a fan.as if that is going to happen.great food.try the horchata if you're into it, it's very good here.chicken is also good but i preferred the steak.the stelote burrito is a dream  got my dream burrito delivered along with a mixed bag of flour and corn tortilla (great idea btw) one problem though - got the sweet pineapple salsa because i loved them when ordering in the past this time around though there was something pretty off about it.

Had to write up a review on this cute little place, which you might otherwise miss if not paying attention! i got the chicken kabob bowl and it was delicious.i would return just to give it another chance..we got to try a sample of the lentil soup and it was so delicious and comparable to the ones i've tried in lebanon.i got the lunch special but i could barely taste the meat and it was rather lacking in flavor! the entire wrap is really, really small.really loved the hummus here it was was up there with the best i've had.and they're about an inch thick at the most.one of the more memorable meals that i have had in a long time.sorry mike, you were correct, my previous review was not about your restaurant (zachi's), it was about zizi's.also the chicken was rubbery and the tomatoes smelled like mold or mildew.

The salmon was so rare it was almost raw.the service is spectacular!!!! everyone is so attentive and friendly! our server, mallory, and the manager, travis, went above and beyond to make our visit awesome! we will definitely be back! best place in old town that i've been to! i wish i could give it 100 stars.overall, this is a terrific place to meet a larger party that has a wide range of food tastes.i highly recommend the vig for a cool place to grab a drink or a solid bite to eat..let me please just tell you - this is no small order of ribs - it is a full stack of deliciousness! my guy ordered the burger and it was also fantastic.i have been to the vig many times since it opened for multiple different occasions: sit down dinners with family in town, drinks with friends, st.happy is how my tummy felt when i left.then once she finally took our cards and the bill she proceeded to talk poorly about us to another employee.

Great greek food and so much of it.awesome place!.they have an extensive menu and we were presented with specials of the day, the roasted lamb leg caught my attention immediately, however i was told that they were out of lamb legs, i tried to get something else and also told they were out of that.if you don't have it anymore, why is it on your menu?along with the saganaki we had a salad.awesome greek town restaurant and date night go to.this place is the bomb..

I love the concept of a steakhouse combined with a bar vibe.went to steakbar for happy hour and stayed for dinner.all the fav's--au cheval burger, prime rib sandwich--killer chicken fried steak--$5 house wine served in high end glass and a carafe--great cutie waitresses (ashley).

I love this place,chicken soup is just like grandma's.service fantastic as well! can't wait to come back!.morning and afternoon hours only.i was very happy with this!when the food got to our table we noticed that the food comes in large portions and has a very generous price.thank you for never making us feel like we needed to move it.we wouldn't go back for breakfast, but only because they didn't have oatmeal.parking:east and west side of the building.

You really can't screw up food when you just heave it onto a pan with some grease, and apply heat--so it's not inedible.great bang for your buck.i will not be back!.my coffee was like very bitter.okay, this place is not fancy and it's not brunch.my bacon egg sandwich was great and the portions are very nice for the price.

They have some crazy hard questions that require knowledge of current events, with a pretty big focus on literature and geography.a lot of people are dancing and there is live music.the sampler was huge and the ribs were on point.the coleslaw arrived to our table, cool to the touch, 4 oz coffee cup that was obviously pre made and sitting in a cooler for some time.we had the sampler for the first time and got home with delicious ribs for left overs.the dim lighting helped to set the mood.any place with vigor in it's name is worth a visit.seems like you may be rolling the dice with delivery.unfortunately, the food was a little underwhelming.the other dish we had was a triple threat of sausage brisket and pulled pork.

It starts with fresh bread and butter on the table.the place i'd definitely a dive but you won't regret it at all.(liquor store across the street if needed).got a chicken breast jibarito and it was amazing!  i would definitely  recommend this for anyone to try (the food is always good).i appreciate that if you're going to have that policy, it's clearly stated! so that was nice.preggo problems), i have finally shaken the desire for that crap and am back to desiring hot, home cooked food.if i wasn't so hungry at the time for a jibarito i would have hung up!but i digress.i had the half chicken dinner with rice and frijoles.byob.the camarones was really lackluster and had about 5 shrimp in it.

Stagg antique collection [$20]i was able to enjoy a nice pour of the 2014 buffalo trace antique collection - stagg to be exact..you could say that pork was available from beginning to end.oh my god! i just died after one bite.their drink menu is huge and spans two large pages.we have ordered meat and cheese to go and this was good.hakei've never had hake before, but i finally got the chance to try it and it was heavenly with the cream sauce, corn, and potatoes.*brunch item portions get larger as you go down the menu.

It would have been too much for me if i ordered it as an appetizer., but you can also get a giant plate of spaghetti, a salad, ribs or spanikopita!miller's definitely has that old-school chicago charm working for it; you can't go wrong with a visit at any time of day.what can i say? it's a popular watering hole with bartenders (like michael) who have been there for decades..was on business in chicago.portions were a good size.the prices are great too.had the medium and they were just about perfection.great ambiance, but fish and chips were really bad.they are like an upscale diner with lots of beers on tap and no ok menu.

Can you spot the two pathetic squids?overpriced for what it is.oggi trattoria come on! please officially add the rolls to your menu! we will gladly pay for extra! we had 6 guests tonight and received 6 rolls but all wished they had a second one!.the breaded mushrooms were good and didn't seem like the standard frozen kind.somehow the service also got worse with the same employees.the thin crust pepperoni pizza was one of the best i found in chicago.

My husband ordered brisket and it was decent and we also had good service.there's plenty of meat choices and sides to call for a return trip, and their wednesday special of burnt end sloppy joes sounds like it's calling me back in.as far as country bars go this is a really fun place.there's a wide selection of whiskeys and cocktails go for $11/ drink.it is nearly $20 for a visit during lunch.5 stars.the biscuit was pretty dry.the brussel sprouts were a pleasant surprise.i ordered the back porch tea (deep eddy sweet tea vodka, jack daniel's, and lemonade).i am usually an eggs benedict kind of bruncher, but i was craving some potatoes and ordered the beef brisket burnt ends hash browns with a fried egg.

The matcha donut didn't taste like matcha and was too dry and dense for my tastes.drinks are top notch and perfectly crafted.the pancakes were delightfully thin and crispy (more reminiscent of a crepe) and the pork shoulder, though diced, had just the right amount of sear.pricier but not unreasonable.sorry this place is a dump.seating inside is limited, there is a adjoining bar with plenty of seating along with tables & chairs outside.to me, there was nothing unique about the food.came here with a few friends and i got the maria's standard.we ordered the "special" that wasn't special at all.a unique spot to hit up for truly delicious food.

You're paying for lobster though so can't expect too much meat.5 stars.my friends had the smoked salmon.the wine menu is heavy in italian wines -but beware of their vintagesthe standouts that we had were* grilled octopus- best i ever had- tender and tasty* burratta- creamy and perfect* king crab on spicy black squid ink pasta- amazing* jumbo prawns- they were like lobster tails* classic affogatto- great gelato and espressoa bit pricey- but i would definetly come back.had all the pasta on the menu, the special was the rabbit & that was sooooo good!! the rpm steak, the chicken parm, brussels sprouts, it was on point! for desert, the chocolate ball, thats a must have!!!! we will definitely be going again!.it's not awful or anything, it's just nothing special.

Lots of options and everything was delicious.if you want to beat the rush, 9:30 am on saturday is the perfect time; the place was mostly empty.the atmosphere is incredible and the food really stands out compared to other brunch places.service was mediocre.service was phenomenal - super friendly and attentive workers, meal came out fast and tasted great!i also love the place - super high ceilings and just a very open room with lots of natural light - my idea of the perfect ambiance for brunch!we will be back!.overall, the service was good and the restaurant was very nice.we'll be back!.menu was interesting and such good options.we got water from the bus boy (shout out), but our server was mia.

The people work hard to make sure you get enough drinks as well.i guess i just now came to the conclusion that this makes a great date spot.i enjoyed my experience at this restaurant, and i am happy we tried it!.it was very good, i was actually surprised at how good it was! my friend was not a fan of his breakfast pizza.they also had a great wine deal going on for white and red house wines for $20! doesn't get better than that! the ambience made this place feel special and would definitely come back!.the decor is beautiful and very italian definitely will be back here for brunch!.i will be coming back for brunch and checking out dinner.the worst was that toward the end of the meal (keep in mind we had a 7:30 pm arrival, check came out at 8:45 pm, left the restaurant by 9:05 pm) my friend went to the bathroom and overheard our server, the bus staff and others complaining about us being in the restaurant.great deal! i ordered crab cakes benedict and it was good - eggs cooked perfectly.he spoke to the chefs and they prepared an incredible dish for me.

As far as middle eastern options go in the loop, i rank naf naf no.overall, this place has fresh, tasty food, quick service, and doesn't break the bank.i give them a generous 3 stars today, only because i can only imagine how good they are.hummus and baba ganoush are out of the world good.period.

Just ate the italian chicken salad!!! it was excellent.i really should nail them down a star for that but the sub was really good.omgawd.look forward to exploring the rest of the menu and ordering again.highly reccomended!.late day/early eve they pull out the hotdog cart and do up the dogs properly with celery salt, etc.

Now on to the real reason for the ramen season.you sit on stools - with no backs - with no place for your coat - and no hook for your purse.it had everything i wanted included, soft boiled egg and bamboo shoot, my two necessities.

Decor was really cute too.really good fish tacos had the blacked catch which was skate wing.i had the catch of the day which turned out to be blackened skate wing.amazing lobster roll.they credited my card instantly.it's a decent lunch place but pricey for the portions you get.this is an excellent place for lunch.not sure why people call the ordering process "confusing," it's really not! you get a marker, and put an x on what you want.

It's not many times you find really nice places like this in the area.the food was delicious and the service was excellent! no bar yet, but they said they should have their liquor license soon.they even had a guitar player to serenade us during dinner! halsted bus stops right in front, so even if you're scared of the south side, you can be picked up right at the door :).

That place just never gets old! their fries are amazing and i never leave without being supremely satisfied.for instance, sodas don't come with refills and you have to pay an extra 50 cents for a second pita when the gyro dinner clearly comes with enough meat for two gyros.a nice local, family friendly restaurant with quality food.wish their menu was a little more extensive and explained some of the items but my go to is a greek salad with chicken or just a regular gyro.50 up charge for feta cheese on the salad.still, i have had amazing mediterranean food, and this was not.the price is definitely right and the service is fast and friendly.if i happen to go there again, i definitely plan on getting something smaller and more manageable.

I've had a much better cheeseburger and fries for much cheaper and tastier.make sure to get the homemade biscuits and jam to start with they are amazing.omelette was a bit dry, but everything else i've had here has been great.so upon arriving to crosby's we were greeted by a host who informed us that the wait would be 30 minutes.would not go back unless i was in the neighborhood.sad that i don't live nearby any more, but i'd happily make the trek across town to have a tasty brunch or dinner.the chicken dip was delightful! my sister enjoyed the salmon.if you watched my episode you know that i tried that cornbread skillet with maple butter that is to die for.-wood roasted chicken hash:  it wasn't the kind of hash we were use to.
One of us actually ran over to marianos to get some real chips for the guac.i had the farmer's market salad which was a good portion (but a little heavy on the dressing).healthy and delicious.

Overall this restaurant is barely passable, but should be a lot better than that based in the price.the macho salad here is the best! full of flavor.i'm a huge hillstone fan and this place did not disappoint.this place was awesome.the whole serving will definitely get you full.i`d definitely come back- great place for a work lunch!.we highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a nice atmosphere and a good meal.

My roommate and i we're excited to order thai as we needed a pick me up and according to the reviews of this establishment this was the place to order from.i love their crab rangoons which has the perfect ratio of wonton skin and filling, their sweet and tangy tiger cry, and my go-to duck curry dish! i've tried majority of their menu and you just can't go wrong..will definitely be back!.wow just wow.i'll keep going back because the food is the best thai that i've had in the city..i ordered the duck curry but it wasn't presented in a very appealing way and there wasn't much to the dish - a few slices of duck sitting in coconut milk curry.i wasn't a big fan of the texture of the pad see-lew, the noodles were fairly oily and the vegetables were slightly bitter and seemed unevenly cooked.tiger cry being my fave.

I had a chicken hummus bowl and it was tasty.99 extra! i'm sorry, but i feel like hummus at a mediterranean place should be like ketchup at a burger place - complimentary in small portions.we were hungry and needed lunch..this fit the bill.
The atmosphere is inviting and the service is fantastic.definitely check it out!.
Less busy and settled comfortably in the vicinity of depaul, this umai continues to hold to the high standards that have been set by the other location.

Com..since i was by myself that fit the bill.loved it when i was a tourist, still get deep dish from time to time.the meats and more meats was just scrumptious! the crust was thick enough to hold all that lusciousness, but not too thick where thats all you can taste.main dish: the main item to talk about - deep dish.but it's just not *that* great.fortunately, we were able to get seated halfway through our first drink.i ordered the thin crust online.

Its pretty much everything you expect from a burger joint: quick service, easy on your wallet, hearty burgers and sandwiches, and a casual feel.definitely recommend the grilled chicken on pita, it's delicious.the owners are also extremely friendly.the pita bread is soft but not too soft, the meat is delicious, tender and generous, and the cold tahini sauce served on top just makes the sandwich float in your mouth.this place serves really good food, and their gyro meal is a steal.food is great - try the gyro burger! the only downside, if you're not a cash person, you'll have to spend at least $8 to use your card.
