At $7 something, it's definitely a tad pricey but each bite was seriously a mouthful..after hearing all the hype from friends, i finally had the chance to try the soft shell crab po'boy.also ordered the soft shell crab po' boy.very good food, though.the truffle fries are awesome.softshell crab sandwich was great.

The owners are very nice, good people.it is family owned and operated and they are (especially the woman behind the counter!) literally the nicest people you will ever meet.low quality - italian sandwich came with "cold cuts" that were really from some oscar mayer package, and didn't taste even ok.this is a mom-and-pop sandwich shop with great sandwiches.lady at the front is warm and very kind.very respectful.i love brankos, the owners are so nice and part of the fabric in this neighborhood.very excellent service here, and i don't know why people are so down on the fries, i loved em.my incoherant blabberings about vienna beef.only down fall they don't take credit cards :(.

Underestimating wait time by 45 minutes is pretty bad.was fresh on my mind since a new location opening up in west loop by my work..i would gladly use one of my cheat meals to eat here.they have weekend lunch burger specials too.i ordered the trio and my friend ordered the umamai burger we couldn't eat the burgers and the fries weren't even touched!horrible.burger was good however was crumbly.not saying that's a bad thing but it was much better than the umami burger.amazing experience!.our server was nikki and she was probably one of the best servers we have had in a while.

Not worth it.the owner seems to have a lot of connections with the locals, but didn't pay any attention to other tables.everything we ordered was great.the olive oil they choose to use is wonderful.however, volare just isn't what it used to be 3-4 years ago.not a big fan of clams but had to try it and it met all expectations (though i am not a clam fans)  even had enough energy to try a tiramisu appetizer.we'll come back to that.my friend ordered the daily special of spinach and cheese stuffed ravioli.

I was surprisingly impressed by their michilada.heard about this placed from a friend, a great little mexican place in the south loop..i prefer fresh salsa, but the roasted one was very good as well.it's small inside but they seat you quick and the food comes out pretty fast.the vegan enchiladas and nachos are great.i have yet to try some other dishes.so good!.my queso was hard.bistec a la tampiquena is all you need to know.

It was lovely!.it was a 50th anniversary party and sepia did an outstanding job!.overall, a decent meal that wasn't quite worth its price.we decided on sepia for a night out during chefs week.no regrets--favorite dish of the night.i did three courses for $33, and for a michelin starred restaurant that price is awesome! however, i left expecting more from the food.really, is that all there is? the stone bass was good but the pork shoulder was fatty and we left most of it on the plate.the service is impeccable and the restaurant is beautiful.went with my husband for dinner.service: outstanding.

But for different reasons, and i can't get sick of either one..the serving portion was rather large; however, they fill the vast majority of it with vegetables and rice, but very little meat.fantastic falafel.the owners seem to really know their stuff about israeli street food..

The high top table stools are sooooo bad.i know it's pizza, but still.another place trying to capitalize on this new style of "authentic pizza".i'll be back but probably not until the patio is open over the summer- that's what really makes this place special!.our waitress would only speak to one of us and not acknowledge anyone else at our table of 8, then we wouldn't see her for another 40 mins or so after we had to pull her away from talking to her friends.they employ about 1,000 people responsible for filling up your water glass and cleaning your table and they check in on you roughly every 8 seconds.the beet salad, holy wow.nice combo of burrata cheese and greens (tricks you into think you're eating healthy!) the aunt chilada's chicken pizza was good and spicy, but i didn't like it as much as the burrata.after having a cake taken away for a friends birthday, they claimed they would keep it in the refrigerator.the sgt.

Brick walls could use a few tapestries to reduce noise from exuberant guests!.great place to eat!  went there with a small group.the whole experience was awkward and disappointing.the food was delicious - great salmon spread 'snack' (appetizer) and the tuna poke was really yummy.the manager was extremely snooty with us and left us with an extremely bad taste to start the night.our server was very knowledgable and the hostess was all smiles.great beer and wine selection.i'm still dreaming about the food here!  the service was spot on and the food was some of the best i've had in a long time.the atmosphere is beautiful.needless to say, we all left quite dissapointed, so much so, we said we'd never return, not even for dinner.

Came here on the recommendations of a jamaican saying this is one of the best spot for authentic jamaican food.i am not a jerk expert, but everything was good!  seasoning on the chicken was spicy and sooo good.the mac and cheese was very strange, as if they dropped chemicals in it.at first i took this personally, and then i realized no one who entered was greeted or advised on anything.the sauce comes on the side, we ordered the mild jerk sauce, which turned out to be a bit spicy.late that evening both my boyfriend and i had terrible stomach pains.customer service should be a huge priority, especially for a new business.most importantly the food.beef patty was great too.

The brunch food was delicious and hearty.from there, we picked many plates to share, so we could try as many items as possible.i don't think i've had the mexican traditional dish chilaquiles before, but the one with braised pork at the bristol was simply amazing.brunch must! dinner reviews--- not as great so schedule brunch! immediately you are given the best service! as i was waiting for my friend (please make reservations!) i was encouraged to go to the bar and the host pulled up a bar seat and told me to sit and enjoy a drink.looking forward to a return visit!.i will take that as an outlier.can't remember what my husband had - a beer and some other cocktail, but i also can't remember how they tasted.the waitress insisted that that was not a lot of food and we should really order a 4th dish.why?  well a few things:the waiter was great (very nice/friendly) but the service was really slow.then the last guy got his drink 5 minutes after that.

Both salsas were fantastic.the tacos were really good compared to other ones i've had in small mexican joints but we're a bit too greasy.simply delicious!!!!! been a staple for more than 15 years and they have only gotten better.i'm not normally a fan of tripe, but the tripe tacos here are hands down my favorite--get them crispy, and they'll come out crunchy and flavorful.

Love en hakkore!adorable interior and amazing food.definitely want to come back and try the bibimbaps!love the korean-mexican fusion concept.the bowl is also pretty large, so i was really full by the end, but didn't want to stop eating because it all tasted so good.the sushi burritos are at their 2.5 - scored huge points with a bibimbap that was so colorful and full of fresh veggies, and also a flavorful japchae.i can't get enough of this place.+ really amazing beef, we didn't try other meat options+ loved the mild sauce, just perfect+ awesome assortment of veggies - they claim 16, i didn't count.i usually eat the greasy kind that leaves you feeling kinda heavy.

Lots of veggies and good coffee.overall the food was decent, the atmosphere was nice (save for a couple bad tables), and the service was ok.we felt like trying something new this morning, so we began looking through yelp.such a great place for brunch.the coffee had a few rich earthy notes but it was just some coffee with milk in it, no foam on it.bubbles and squeak hash was awesome.enough said.it's very rare that i give 5 stars but you make my heart skip a beat! it's seriously good if i've come here two days in a row and am sitting here trying to stop myself from heading there again for breakfast.great place to check out when the weather is nice and there is outdoor seating available; however, it can be a claustrophobics worst nightmare in the winter.the staff is kick ass.
Got 4 vouchers for breakfast for being a diamond hyatt member.

They are so dang good!i get the crab rangoons and i wish they had other appetizers that i would like but the dumplings and won tons all have shrimp in them of which i am not a fan.i usually stretch a to-go order into 2 meals.best thai food in lincoln park.but most thai is.couldn't even get our bill!.my grandma gives it a thumbs up too (and everyone knows that grandmas know best).solid low-key thai restaurant.also had the panang curry noodles - the noodles are very crispy which is really great, i just wish there was more sauce to slather on to them to make them a little less firm.a++cute outdoor patio & byob!.bottom line, great stuff.

I ordered from here a couple times.pita heaven offers convenience, and a healthier food option for those living in south loop.i'm used to more flavorful - maybe more garlicky - middle eastern food.you can take out, dine in, or even get the food delivered!they have tons of options even healthy and vegetarian options which isnt always easy to find.quick and easy.the restaurant needs to pay better attention because now i am less likely to order from them again.(since then i've been a few times, which the review will cover)  from the reviews, i figured i'd give it a try.then u get to pick a side.this place totally exceeded my expectations of a street corner gyro place!.

Nose is hoppy, with just a bit of fruitiness.i guess maybe there is beer on the floor or something.that's when we left.i've been there a half dozen times and everything worked great, even during rush hours.outdoor bar with steve.i tasted my mother's fish taco and again good but not great.i feel like there are not a lot of tourists here.was a fun place but i would want to go back with a smaller group.extensive beer list, the wait staff are friendly and ready to serve.we had ordered water with our drinks that also never arrived until we flagged down a bus boy.

Went there for lunch.we moved in next door a month ago and have both carried out and eaten in several times.love this place! my order is always ready super quick.really nothing to rave about.definitely coming back.yellow curry is supposed to be a mild curry, but here it was sweet.all the staff is super friendly and caring! we order 3 signature rolls ( we didn't realize how big they were) so our order was taking longer than usual.

We ordered a small salad, but they accidentally gave us a large and then comped it.i was prepared for a long wait, so i wasn't surprised once we got in around 7 and was told there would be about a 45 minute- 1 hour wait.if you're cool with sitting on the counter cause it's just two of ya- that's great!-don't bring kids- not enough space-order a pizza! those flavors, that spice, that sunny side up egg, perfect to share.a bit pricey, but generally worth it.small plates, big flavor! we ordered the chorizo stuffed dates (a must), the salmon with an amazing crispy skin like i've never had before, and finally the chicken.it breaks my heart to give avec 3 stars (3.one of the must-order dishes at avec is the chorizo-stuffed medjool dates.the crispy quinoa added a nice little crunch and the beets a proper amount of sweetness.we came without a reservation around 8 on tuesday night and were promptly seated, albeit right in between two parties on a long picnic bench style table.they are better than any other date dish that i have ever had.

I ended up getting the smothered burrito, which was pretty good.the restaurant is a decent size, but it did fill up quickly after we arrived.today i had the pumpkin pancakes as an appetizer..the drinks were amazing.overall nice vibe and wasn't too busy when we got there around 8 p.the hibiscus mimosa was absolutely delicious and so refreshing.

The hooks under the table, because of the size of my work bag, crossed over into the next seating area (sorry to the person sitting next to me).however, the price was very steep here for pretty average food; the ramen bowl costed $14, and the mantou bun costed $5 (for a really small bun!).two for chicken wings, one for the environment.the pork bun appetizers really hit the spot.took one bite.i feel like for the price i paid, i can probably get better ramen elsewhere.but last night when i went to there, the server accidentally spilled my soup as they placed my tonkotsu ramen (i like to get this with the chashu substituted for fried chicken) down."do you have a reservation?" "no.i love the mushrooms! nothing super stands out about the meal except it was exactly what you want after a long day walking the city.both were sooo good, but what made both dishes stand out was the chashu *smoked* pork belly! it reminded me of the pork belly from green street smoked meats!i initially thought, based on the reviews, this place would be too trendy to offer good quality ramen.

I did not immediately notice that the number of onion rings was small, but at $4.all in all, they seemed to enjoy the experience - made slightly less overwhelming by them splitting an order.quarters are close, but the staff is super neighborhood friendly and it is one of the more unique settings in all of chicago.i would definitely consider going back.don't try to eat it all in one sitting.good beer selection, good greasy spoon food and huge portions.i'll be having dreams of that sandwich until i get my hands on another!goodbye my love; until we meet again.i tried the duck club and it was average; the duck was put on the bread with a high level of dampness which caused the bread to get soggy.they have a drink menu where most drinks are $8.with a long wooden bar which seems to extend forever, and a club car from a train as the dining room, this place is vintage cool.

Of course, we also a few of their tasty brews to wash everything down.since it was fall, most of the beers were darker and hoppier.they had a variety of beers on tap that night but they all had something weird added to them.they're open for lunch! the burger looked really good.went here tonight with a few friends of mine.

We got the meat and cheese platter- needed extra bread and they gave us no hassle! that seems dumb but i feel like you never know what you're gonna get in the west loop.friendly staff, fun decor, and a menu too good for a bar (the duck was crazy delicious).our server was knowledgeable and willing to explain all of the ones we weren't familiar with.at first i thought the serving staff was deliberately ignoring my group of five on a tuesday night.my pimm's cup was refreshing and made for easy drinking - i would definitely recommend.it's a great addition to the area especially since lone wolf may be the only other good bar in the area.doesn't make much sense.

Anyhow, from there the food honestly got bland (2/5).i'm enjoying all these flavors of salsa they gave me to taste.this is  contemporary mexican takeout.very trendy space.both sandwiches come with avocado spread, definitely not enough avocado to taste.i suppose it was supposed to melt a bit more, but i ended up with a giant chunk on top.this is not your mama's torta, these are huge with a lot of meat and cheese.i only wish they had their music up a little higher to set the mood.even though there were lots of great sounding menu options, but we came for the cemitas.

A fantastic vegan restaurant in lakeview!  everything on their menu is good, but plan to go there on wednesdays and get their deep dish pizza!  the cheese that they use is delicious, i've never had such a smooth and creamy texture in a vegan deep dish.it wasn't bad, it just reminded me of hamburger helper.best place iv ever eaten at in my entire life.it is off putting to hear someone talking about politics and music loudly while i'm trying to have a quiet conversation with my party.we had a list of about 10 places we wanted to try and kitchen 17 was definitely one, although.i wouldn't take any uptight people there but every omni i have taken loves it.i'd totally give 5 stars if the actual restaurant was a cool place to eat, but you cannot beat the food!best vegan pizza ever!there's honestly nothing better..this guy is a master vegan chef! definitely go on a wednesday sometime, the deep dish pizza is amazing.walk up and order, bus your own dishes, pour your own water.

Soups are always great and the empanadas are tasty.definitely delcious puerto rican cuisine.went here for the first time with a friend for a quick dinner.our waitress helped us figure out what to order, explaining things like the difference between sweet and green plaintains when it was obvious we weren't familiar with the cuisine.both plates filled us up for about $6-7 each.

Good amount of toppings and oh la garlic! the rice that accompanied it was good too.i enjoyed my jiberito and my buddy really loves the goat stew.my wife told me that the cook makes sancocho(stew) just like her late mother.

The service: good and helpful.this upscale lounge sports very comfy victorian frame and carpet fabric chairs.would definitely go more often if it was closer to home! they have some larger seating areas if you have a group but i think it's ideally suited for smaller parties.we were grabbing a light dinner.i think they get so much traffic now that they don't care what they serve anymore.the place just felt a little cramped for our group of 7.i got about three sips out of that drink.funky name, awesome place.terrible.

Staff relaxed after they saw i had a grouponon and was not there to rob the joint.i am glad i did cause i loved the shrimpfresh made and perfectsides were average, but i will definitely be back for the shrimp.love the shrimp and the potato cakes, and have to have the slaw.way better than lawrence's fisheries!! i always order the fish chips and the shrimp.meh..this place doesn't look that great on the outside but the food was pretty good! the shrimp were clean, fresh and seasoned, so was the perch fish! i also ordered the catfish but i didn't really care for it.

I would recommend it to anyone that is looking for something different and trying to find something that falls in to this cities food culture.the fish was fresh and the dish was well-balanced.a redeeming quality of tds is the service - rather friendly (although i wouldn't be surprised if hair from one of the staff members' poofy beards ended up in the food).solid cocktails.the desert was especially disappointing..here are the highlights:pâtéchicharonestonguepolenta with baconsourbratonbest is polenta and bacon.the whitefish seemed a little on the dry side which makes me feel like it was overcooked.two thumbs way up.everything from the dishes to the appetizers to the cocktails delighted.

I loved the homemade tortillas they make right in front of you and it was so cheap!  i ordered a quesadilla in addition to my taco, along with a bottle of water for only $6.tasty al pastor with the must have slice of pineapple? yes yes yes yes!the tacos are bigger than i expected so it makes the $3 taco worth it.get a mix up of different tacos and (crispy, melty, tasty) quesadillas if you can, you remembered to bring friends, right?they're pretty big.these are the best tacos/quesadillas i've ever eaten by faaaaaar.

Fabulous place for brunch.the shop has a lot to offer as well.great!   5 stars all the way.we decided to go off script for dinner and not go totally vegan because everything was organic.we said it was our first time there and we were surprised with a plate of the house pickled veg plate.i loved that you can have dinner and get some meat/cheeses to go and also shop in the wine shop next door.variety was no better than the other higher end groceries in the area, but we decided to purchase some oyster mushrooms since we were there.this place is good! i ordered the ruben sandwich--amazing! it was a tough choice though, everything in their menu looked delightful.the owner/manager alex is incredible as well.the.

I would return for the rose, octopus and try the charcuterie plates next time.unfortunately, the food and service underwhelmed.my wife loved the trombette trapanese, and i'm a big fan of the salsiccia pizza, both of which have their fenel sausage, which is delicious.what an amazing place!!! simply great service and all the food that we tried was right on point, and we tried a lot! lol great crafted drinks and thanks ronn for the great hospitality.the atmosphere is great and the food is delicious and very reasonably priced.margarita pizza is undercooked and wet - no.also while i love how family friendly southport is, it was refreshing to have dinner at a restaurant for grown ups, without kids screaming in the background (we had a 9:15 reservations so not sure if earlier times were similar).i love gemini and gauge.the executive staff was most accommodating, our servers were engaging and attentive, and the ambiance of the room is sophisticated and welcoming.the service was great, and the food and cocktails made their way to our table in a very timely fashion.

Portion size was also too big.i had the club sandwich and it also came with a large order of fries.it looked like my burger came from a commercial shoot.lovely al fresco dining at the virgin hotel.walk up on down the road and eat here and enjoy.one of the best chicken and waffles i've had! it comes with a honey sriracha sauce that is to die for.not a bad place to grab food if you are in the area, but probably not worth going out of your way for.i am looking forward towards the next time i return to try out what else miss ricky's has to offer.we asked our server which one was better and she said "get both!" we laughed it off, but a friend and i ended up splitting both items! i also loved the decor and comfortable seating.this is a fancy diner of sorts located in the new virgin hotel.

I came in here for a birthday treat and i got a super delicious raspberry matcha cupcake.overall, i plan on coming back here and i recommend stopping in!.you must visit this place.i told him that i am going to check in, and he even made sure i checked in and he clicked "redeem" but yet, charged me for the coffee and instead of an apple pie, he charged for an apple pastry which delayed me by another 5 minutes.did try the avocado toast which was a light and tasty snack for the afternoon.the desserts were light and sweet,  the venue was bustling, the music was great,  and the staff very friendly.we also tried the lucky charms marshmallow treat and the brownies which was fabulous.preferably in the town i work in.

Spam katsu musubi- eat it! it's a deep fried, panko crusted piece of spam on top of warm sushi rice.my friend had the mini short ribs - this was marinated well, a little sweet but savory at the same time, but a little too fatty.i recommend the chicken katsu and bbq beef combo.

Crawfish was rubbery.the menu choices are about the same.since both of us grew up eating great seafood in maryland and maine, we had high hopes for this place since seafood in chicago is always hit or miss.we've also tried the snow crab.we were missing corn on the cob with one of the boils and the other was made with the completely wrong sauces!!!the price point was a dissapointment since our crab legs had barely any crab!!was so glad our fries were free since we had gotten a flyer in the mail to lure us in.you have to try this place.gave these guys an honest go on food.they weren't as flavorful as i hoped.i would equate 2 peppers to above "hot" on the wing scale.

We quickly requested beverages and he dashed off.however, we left as soon as the show was finished and took a cab back hoping to beat the rush and still waited over a 1/2 hour for the car.(although they do slightly bread it--and that isn't mentioned in the menu.superb food - steak diane, cooked to perfection, absolutely mouthwatering!!  andy's easy living drink (smirnoff honey vodka, grand marnier, ginger beer & fresh lemon) is a splendid summertime drink.on the other hand there was this paper thin, crispy, seasoned cracker bread that was absolutely addictive.the crab cakes were full of tender crab and well seasoned.not really impressed with their food, although the decor is beautiful.i went with my fiancé before going to wait wait don't tell me.

To all those from the west coast.at first this was just a refuge when i wanted a casual and reliable meal in the loop or river north.could it be? shake shack in chicago?! i was so excited when i saw this but soon found it there was no need for fanfare! i go to shake shack every time i go to nyc and i'm always so happy.both were delicious and both amazing.i once had a shroom burger (very tasty) i'd take a steak n shake any day over this.the crinkled fries look gross and soggy, but they're surpringsly delicious and crisp--- definitely get the cheesy ones--- that cheese sauce makes them 100x better.i ordered the special al burger and it was delicious..i asked what it was and she explained that she worked at this location.the burger patty was juicy and the bacon was crispy.
Can't beat that with a stick.the food, service and restaurant was great! would definitely recommend and will come back.food and drinks were delicious.

Their marinara is also delicious and way better than giordanos! i forgot which one we got but my friend chose pepperoni instead of sausage which i'll say was the wrong choice.the pizza is pretty good, but eating here takes a lot of planning and time set aside.i can't complain!.they also took forever to come.you must try if you haven't yet.in addition to our supreme deep dish pizza, we ordered two overpriced and decent appetizers (wings and sticks).bathroom horrible - dirty.go here, don't think, just go!!.i love this place!  and to all you other reviewers that left low reviews.red sauce was not as good as lou's.

We split the gnocchi as an appetizer and that was probably our favorite, so good! i had the swordfish and she had the prawns.we enjoyed everything we ordered.we visited balena as part of our quest to visit every bib gourmond restaurant in chicago.i would definitely come back to balena!.my favorite thing about their pizzas is the chilli sauce they serve on the side.the fennel sausage pizza and mushroom pizza are must tries!service - 2 starsour waitress had an attitude that made me think she was from lake forest and being forced to work here by her parents for the summer.

Everything tastes good but i swear they can't get an order right for me if their lives depended upon it.would definitely eat here again.they use extremely fresh ingredients and have excellent customer service.loving the affordable downtown lunch place! any time i can get a sandwich, drink and side for less than $10 i'm thrilled.one of my favorite lunch places in the west loop.it was super good.she said its was "her" way of spelling it because she's at least twice my age (claimed to be 47).

For $30+, i got two small strips of beef and a few asparagus.sushi:ara on chef special - the potato crisps on top is what makes this sushi roll good.as for sushi, i had the smokey eye, which is the marriage of a shrimp tempura roll and philadelphia roll.not that the others were bad.would definitely go back!.place is a little pricier than i thought, but is pretty nice and fancy.soooo yummy! i am kind of a foodie and i really enjoyed the soy paper instead of seaweed.sushi was still a solid hit.this is the place for sushi in chicago!.absolutely awesome!  spicy bbq tuna and salmon sushi was to die for.

Went with my usual order of a steak burrito platter and i realized after nearly a year's absence why i love this place so much.very good food, very spicy and tasty salsa.get the fish tacos.they get food out to you crazy fast.not sure what all the fuss is about.bland, dry and even the beans and rice weren't worth eating.nice cahiers.i haven't had a bad meal here once, day or night or very very late night.eitehr way, it was a  good experience and i'll absolutely be back again soon.

The biscuits! get the biscuits! they're soft and buttery and sure to make even good days better! in my opinion another star of the menu are the elotes! so flavorful i honestly could not get enough.the worst part of the whole meal was when we left, and went for the soft serve.had lunch during work week with friend and got there around 11:30am.i only had the drinks here, but man what a place.tip-they are dog friendly on the patio!.this is a working class meal with aristocrat ingredients and a price point that is in the middle.when we came to pick it up at the adjacent bar, saint lou's assembly, we were warmly greeted, given back the wallet, and invited in to have a drink and dinner.

I would probably have never come here if i didn't live down the street from here, but i'm glad i do.great food  ! thanks on behalf of david !!!.expect to get your order screwed up and sassed for bringing it up.turkey club is great too and fries are nice and crispy.maybe that's just their thing.pancakes and french toast were great and i blew it by not trying the hash browns.not only did they forget my food but when it came out it looked as though one of the rats in the kitchen dined on it first.i've only had breakfast here but it's all delicious.great spot with no pretension and no lines, have enjoyed breakfast here many times and may do so again today.

La palma is one of my favorite restaurants in all chicago! happened on this place when i used to live in the neighborhood, but come back just for a jibarito or the chicken stew with rice and beans as often as i can.the place is ok.from the moment we walked through the door, the women that were working that day were super helpful (also super nice/happy)! we were just looking for pasteles but we told them that was the extent of the puerto rican food we've ever eaten.this is the closest thing to hometown goodness in the chi.reminded me of my titi from back home.the best puerto rican food that i tasted so far.the plantain was fried perfectly and the meat was juicy and seasoned well.this is hands down the best puerto rican food in chicago!  the lechon is super juicy, the white rice and beans are amazing, and the jibarrito is just to die for.porkchop, cold and stiff, pincho, cold and stiff, the meat was like rocks.the food here is good for what it is-a puerto rican buffet.

The deserts were good, not amazing.yes, one that compares to au cheval.i am sad that i forgot the name of their sommelier (he was working on friday night (jan 15) - he was excellent! the gruner and chateauneuf du pape he suggested both stole my heart! he even allowed us to taste his by-the glass suggestion (which i always appreciate!)atmosphereits a grand looking plush space that screams "luxury" and therefore attracts the most beautiful people.the wine guy came over at the beginning and we never saw him again.without hesitating, she took away our single candle and replaced it with this epic candelabra.this easily could have fed 4 people, and we were stuffed afterwards.we had two shrimp appetizer.great aura and service.

Keep in mind, this is not the double fried korean fried chicken.i wouldn't recommend you to go out your way to come here because it's meant to be a neighborhood restaurant that exists for your convenience.).they have 4 wing sauces available and many other entree dinner choices.they are a good size too.i love fried chicken and i really love wings, but these are wings i couldn't even eat.

I also loved the chivo (goat stew), beef enchilada, and coconut mojito.we had a wonderful, attentive waitress and delicious food.so, i'll definitely be back.i had a ultimate mojito plain with el capitain.everything here was great with good service.

When i went i had there fries which was made with granulated espelette pepper ( a french pepper), and granulated egyptian onion, garlic, and salt.roughly $100/person i expect to be blown away by the food and this is not the place to come and be blown away.the food was equally impressive.had an amazing dinner at steadfast.my client ordered the lamb sandwich and it was supposed to come with fries but they were not included.this restaurant is heavy on the "fluff" and plate design but light on the actual food itself.check it out.the service was pretty quick and the bartenders seemed very attentive.the space is also gorgeous - set in a landmark building there are restrictions on how much you can change but the marble and original woodwork makes it feel like old chicago.

I recommend going late at night so its not so crowded and chaotic."i just want to live here and eat nothing but cheese and pizza.everything comes as it is prepared.i noticed several tables being seated immediately upon checking in, so i asked the hostess for an update.the eggplant was thoroughly cooked through, which i like, but the sauce was lacking salt and flavor, which caused the entire dish to do the same.best dish and best frutti de mare i've ever had (obviously since i went back two nights in a row).had a pizza with calamari.it is a lovely spot for any meal, any occasion.a good tapas restaurant with pleasant atmosphere and drinks.

Worst management.not great if you want to sit down for a meal.however, there own website has the wrong number.excellent taco place! prices are reasonable, and the food is delicious.what new business closes everyday from 3-5.sorry to say they were not worth it.best tacos in the hyde park area! the service and quality of the food was really good.good food, there isn't much seating.i've definitely had waaaay better tacos.meh.

Louis.this place was great! easy parking nearby, no wait inside, and super friendly staff! my friend and i split the 1/2 chicken and the chicken breast sandwich and both were delicious! we worked on our computer using the free wifi and the staff was very receptive to our hanging out for a bit.ok, i came in and ordered 12 chicken wings.the chicken is quite good actually i like it better than pretty much all fried chicken places in chicago.5/// this place is pretty cool, i was very surprised! first off, the girl at the counter was great/ explained everything to me as i had never been.the carrot cake was absolutely perfect.i got the half chicken with the chili sweet potato side.they have bottomless frozen yogurt which is probably the coolest thing!the sides were good.:-).well i gave nando's a second try and it was still a nightmare.

Crazy busy but the beer is what you come for.no less.friends had burgers and fish n chips that all looked delicious.well, thank you for the notice, but that's not really our problem (which was what my friend wanted to say)..

We had to get extra sauce because it was that good! the cuban sandwich media noche was delicious, the right amount of everything and the sweet plantain added a touch of sweetness you don't see in many sandwiches.thank you for making my day.

We ate half of them and were already adequately satisfied for dinner, but they were so good that we couldn't help but finish the rest.the fire allowed for some slow burning heat and was a good balance of sweet and spicy.at any rate, it's a completely different menu than the spot on damen so good reasons to continue to hit up both spots.i am so sad that we don't have anything like this in dallas.i loved it.just discovered that en hakkore 2 opened and also delivers thru caviar.while i did like their sushi burrito, it was nothing special and not comparable to the sushi burrito places in west coast.

I also worked not far from there in the late 80's (armitage and kolmar) so i enjoyed some awesome taco lunches there, too.most violent crimes don't happen to random people at restaurants/fast food joints.good spot to hit after a night of clubbing..the rice doesn't come with red sauce which i don't understand.

Big chunks of tasteless blah.this place is open as of july 2015 (they had to close briefly because of a fire).i thought it was very well cooked.location location location.the winchester is my neighborhood spot and i definitely lucked out.the winchester was a favorite of ours for a long time! we loved the atmosphere and the creative dishes like the eggs benedict on the waffle.my date and i had an awesome experience at the winchester for brunch last weekend.chris,  i'll still come, but only every several months (used to be every 2 weeks!).the traditional plates were quality and tasted delicious.

Around 10 dollars for a burger combo.fresh food and great eats!!!.very satisfied with our dinner and definitely will visit again.ordering was difficult as the only menu in the place is the one large-printed on the wall two feet from the register, so everyone is bottlenecked into the narrow front of store while deciding and ordering.spicy mayo that wasn't so spicy was the only downfall of this order.the burgers, on the other hand, were a bit of a disappointment.i love the chicken blt.i walked by busy burger and saw their catchy shirts and signs raving about their burger, so i raised my expectations quite a bit coming in.i went in today only because my pregnant coworker was "craving" a burger and i'm so glad that i did.my boyfriend suggested this place and it was absolutely great, the burger was freshly cook to order which is always a plus!!! the fries were also a hit.

I absolutely loved the silence of the lamb bowl with rice, lamb, korma sauce, and mint cilantro chutney.but the curry is the worst part.i work closer to the loop so i'll be at their loop location a lot more often but my oh my, this thing is gonna blow up.this place has pretty decent food for a quick lunch spot.honestly didn't expect much because it is americanized but i was wrong! this place is delicious! extremely flavorful and filling! and i love putting extra mint sauce! the hot sauce is good too unless you can't stand spicy foods.i've gotten all the sauces, and they're all great, but i like the hotness that the vindaloo provides.if you've had good indian food before then this is not the place to go.the naanwiches are a little messy, but still delicious.masala fries are delicious!!! so are the sandwiches.did not care for this place.

Awesome food, atmosphere and people!  a lot of love and dedication has gone into this restaurant.byob.in the mood for some mexican breakfast and saw reviews and excited for this.my wife and i were trying for something a bit non-traditional and you wanted a fun and festive atmosphere for our guests.incredible tacos, variety of amazing sauces & salsas.if you stop in and don't get a full meal, you're missing out.had the tacos al pastor and did not satisfy.

We had the same waitress both times (thanks ju!) and it's always been an awesome experience.ordered samurai combo, the meats were just whatever, the miso soup was bland, garlic noodle was just okay, nothing really stood out.also, check with the waitress for any special social media promotions they might have.they have early and late happy hours.the place wasn't as crowded as i expected for the day and time.

I work off of w wacker, so its a quick walk and i will definitely be visiting again!.this is downright stupidly good.the much-lauded pistachio churro was fine, but far from worth the wait or price.25 each.xoco is located downtown near some very good night life.

Like other reviewers have said, i couldn't really tell it was a coffee shop until i saw the sign when i walked up to it.the space was really clean and service was quick and the food tasty.can't beat the convenience and kindness in this ukrainian village coffee gem.dark roast is delicious and the home made mayo is tasty.three reasons to go to francesca's: 1) i like my coffee to taste like coffee, strong and dark, which is why the flavor is important.
This place is a hidden gem..
Blt was huge and great! they make their own hot sauce and it is spectacular and very flavorful.the portions are generous and the prices are reasonable.

I picked the order up to go and was salivating from the smell of the food in my car.i've ordered from this place a couple times and both times it was excellent! i got the beef and chicken shawarma combo this time.and it wouldn't have been as good.this schwarma is legit schwarma..then waited and waited and waited for about 45 minutes for our food.absolutely nothing to look at and maybe looks sketchy, but don't be fooled.would love to be able to say something quality about their food, but i can't, because their order has not arrived two hours after ordering via foodler.the food here doesn't justify the b.their chicken shwarma and chicken kebob are my favorites.

Well, the next day my stomach did not agree.the server was very generous and gave us a big cup of ice cream instead of the small ramekin it normally comes with because we were sharing the dessert (3 churros for $5).he had no problem giving us a bottle of each.value: $130 was a bit too much for it.you'll get the same tortas and other sandwiches you get at the river north and airport locations, plus great, timely service, and solid drink offerings.was not impressed.xoco was decent, but i won't be back.we felt like there wasn't too much flavor, so we layered our tortillas with beans and guac (yum).chilaquiles and torreja (with bacon crumble) are so good they are the latino french toastthe margaritas were delicious.my dish also came with little tortillas which were perfectly cooked, light and fluffy, and mopped up some of the marinade quite well.

The place is clean and the staff is friendly and helpful if you're not sure what you're looking for.plain.this place is great.it's no-frills, and you can quickly add up a bill, but it was really tasty.i left full but not weighed down.i really love this place!the food is always fresh and delicious and for all you get with a plate, i'd say it's also well priced.for a quick place to grab a bite, it's very good.for beginners who have never tried mediterranean food, omg is a great place to wet your tongue.i also recommend asking for some garlic paste on the side.staff were.

If you want good food at a very reasonable price while shopping on state street, visit this food court.it has a nice atmosphere and several food stations.this is a good change of pace now and then.it is like being transported from hell to heaven by way of department store elevator.i think i could have it every day if it was at a more affordable price and closer location.so many other better choices in the loop area! if you must go, the noodle soup bowls did look better than the salad.highly recommend frontera fresco and marc burgercon- very limited hours 11 am - 3 pm mon-sathidden deal- obtain the frequent lunch card that allows you a free meal after 8 hole punches i believe.the goat cheese salad from the salad station wasdelicious, loved it! my daughter had the southwesternchicken caesar salad which was equally delish.it was surprisingly large and filled with seaweed, corn, sprouts, fish patties, and pork.a deeeelicious pretzel roll and you've got yourself a really beautiful lunch.

Their wine and cocktail menus are very unique and extensive.the reason that i'm short on the rating scale is because on our last day, my husband headed back to the hotel before me and decided to stop in here, while i stopped in at a nearby store, before i was to meet back up with him here.everything tasted good, and the coffee kept coming.we received water glasses and then had to wait over 10 minutes for the server to come back to take our orders and we constantly had to flag him down.the atmosphere and decor are a definite 5 stars..chose table on huron so less traffic noise than on clark st side.$25 bottomless mimosa brunch!!! need i say more??! and the food is delicious, ambience is cool and eclectic, and the service is great.

The al pastor may be my new favorite, sorry l'patron.my friend took me to this place because she loved it, turns out i loved it too! this place is absolutely amazing! it's family owned and,  the staff there is very friendly, and they make you feel welcome the minute you come in.the food is tops.8x chipotle burritos to 1 el habanero one.when you walk in you get the feeling that the employees are really happy you're there.if you stick to the pambazo--the traditional sandwich served with potatoes and chorizo--you are going to leave here thinking this is the best mexican joint in chicago.street parking only, but i've never had problems at dinner time.best mexican food i've tried in years.i've been to this place about 6 times now.cash only.

I'm really glad i got to try this place since i've been having a craving for turkish/mediterranean food since coming back from turkey.the yogurt and hot sauce were my favorite part!the only complain i have is that i ordered too much food :) but i guess that balances out the price of everything.this was a weekend, so maybe they were busy, regardless, we were disappointed and i doubt i will give this place a shot again.*note:  this was from a delivery in mid may 2014*.we will definitely return.i ordered the combo.super thin crust and stuffed with lamb and cheese.the owner zizi is often working the counter and is one of the nicest people you'll ever meet.

I liked the guava margarita the best out of the three i had (pineapple jalapeño & avocado) but don't get me wrong they were all good, just small & $8,.unfortunately unlike most taquerias, the chips are not included with your meal and you have to purchase them which was kind of a bummer.great food.amazing drinks.i go here for lunch way too often for my budget.maybe i was there on an off night, but nothing i had was the "best (insert taco here) in the city".tacos al pastor and the sopa de tortilla prepared by the chef from his family recipe makes this place a real gem in front of the mexican consulate.favorites are the la gringa quesadilla (al pastor, chihuahua cheese and pineapple), shrimp tacos, and chorizo tacos.

This place gets super packed real fast so either make a reservation or be prepared to wait.pro-tip: i can't stress (and thank yelp friends!) enough, use the nowait app.the service is good and the food is just as good.big points for the freshness of berries in everything.we were here the weekend of lollapalooza so it was extra packed.first of all.my friend and i shared the red velvet french toast and it was amazing.i decided to splurge a bit and try their signature berry bliss pancakes.i actually took some of the sauce from the los altos benedict that fell off and smothered it on the hashbrowns.

This place has it all:small: yupcheap drink options: checksurly bartender: fo shogents who appear to be regulars looking at you funny because you wore a cardigan sweater: indeed that happened.tony the bartender rocks.oh, there is that guy who sits and pretends to read! i get a kick out of that! man, he can do perhaps 1 page every 10 minutes.relaxed vibe, excellent cocktails.its fucking tiny! the walk-way into the bar is no wider then 2/12 ft wide.we weren't sure if out door seating was seat yourself.the bartenders here are awesome.this was a great little surprise.

That fish was beyond delicious.i've been wanting to try it since it opened but getting a reservation is quite difficult.tortillas were excellentstriped bass-excellent! got it yucatan style that had habanero salsa.for example, i would never think that octopus is poached in water that has bacon in it :( if you have serious restrictions - talk about them with your waiter.this is a restaurant design failure.our ceviche was more avocado then fish.somewhat surprisingly even though i love coconut everything, the young coconut salad.ive been to all of rick's restaurants in chicago and this one is my least favorite.the "fire" menu is largely fish, but opting for a change, i got the shortrib and it was really good.

The wait can get pretty long however if you come on the weekends and waiting for a table could be a bit catastrophic since everyone wants a table and the space is small.i come here mostly for the small eatery inside the grocery store.i've missed this place twice because they would close early if all quantities for the day were sold out.

Sunday night lobster paella!!!  skip date night on thursday and wait it out until sunday night for the lobster paella.excellent wine service as well.and when i am at a wine(ish) bar and prepared to sit and enjoy candlelight and the people around me, i am willing to take a while for my meal.food is pretty good too!!!.food and service great.it makes you want to dress up and go on a date.if it was not for the group i was with, i would have left this place after 2 dishes.the wine list is long and we ordered a couple bottles of red.our friends had been here before and enjoyed the food, so decided to take me here for my birthday dinner.

Stopped in for local craft beer and burger.this place has some of the greatest food, and drink specials in the area.but overall very fun karaoke bar.looking forward to that! in terms of food, kelly's seasonal salad is amazing, i remember it had like walnuts cranberries kale spinach and a mango vinaigrette sauce (was the bomb)they always have pretty tasty cocktail selections and their bartenders are really cool!.i expect bars to have sticky floors at midnight.they have some great beers on tap flowing, so this is what you what you want to get here.great spot! the hostess, server (kevin) and dude that brought the food were all great! very happy and helpful.enjoyed the chicago poppers with italian sausage.the karaoke host was quite nice yes i do give him major props i've been to many many karaoke places and this host was awesome!! the waitstaff was also super nice and food was extra tasty so yes hands down this place definitely gets my vote.pass.

I was willing to look past the slow disorganized service if the food was good but just didn't do it for me.so happy to have a nice dining spot in the community!.been in buisness three months.this is a must visit.

You cant beat this place that offers great food and service.add some black pepper and salt and this becomes perfection.the fresh squeezed orange juice is also sweet and good balance.1/3 the price of the restaurants by the park, but food quality is on point.the customer service felt obligatory, and the communication between the waitress and the kitchen staff was totally off.perfect breakfast spot!  does all the 'diner' stuff well (coffee and cocoa served quickly), and continual light check ins.simple and good, very nice atmosphere.this place is hidden in an awesome building in downtown chicago.the man got a omelet with hash browns and toast ! both were made fresh !i recommend this place hangover or no hangover.went here after wildberry had an hour and a half wait.

Had suggestions for us and was very nice and professional.had the puerco rostizado and my man had the bistec de palomilla - both were great and better than the lincolnwood location and a bit less expensive.just love this place.(thats the only down fall) i have passed this place up a ton of times, seems like there is always a nice crowd.yum yum yum!.being a california native, i pulled a total amateur move.good, but not great.vaca frita was so delicious!our server was a funny guy, serving the cake was singing a little song.this is also a great place for vegans and non-vegans to dine together as there are options for everyone.

Oh and the butterball potatoes that accompanied my lovely steak? oh laaawd, amazing.they kept the wine pouring while we caught up.our first courses were good, if not spectacular: burrata cheese with toasted baguette slices, and octopus with new potatoes.we had to wait upstairs until we could get someone's attention.i was a little embarrassed that my complaint had been remembered, but it shows what great lengths they go to to remember customers and provide a great experience.i really enjoyed my experience at the boarding house on wells.i had simply requested a little more private table that we could be able to carry on conversations easily amongst our group.we were determined to get in.outstanding from a-zgreat service, beautiful decor, phenomenal food.

The burgers here are just as good and creative as at kuma's corner, and there's not any of the waiting.the metal music playing was not too loud at all, and only added to the atmosphere.i would love to come back for the tasty food but jeez, lower the prices and revamp your service!.the bechamel was thick and cheesy, the bacon added a nice smokey hint and the fresh green onions took it over the top and tied it all together.definitely echm lock down your beer order.it was different than what i was normally used to.the service is good, and the food is super amazing.lockdown will become a part of my dining out restaurant rotation!.we got the burger of the month: the "wrongfully accused" and the kitchen was stupendously generous with the goat cheese - i dipped my fries in what was essentially a separate patty of goat cheese on top of my meat patty.i think i had way too high expectations because everyone from my burger club said they had the best burger in chicago.

Great front end for rick bayliss light meals.not sure if its the change of staff or what.i assumed this place was intended to be a fast food version of frontera grill, unfortunately i was wrong.we had beef rice plate and roti chicken rice plates, sides of hummus, tomato cucumber,  stir fried mixed veg and 2 pita bread.overall, a great stop for lunch!.i would like to thank previous yelpers for pointing out that this location is on the 7th floor of macy's and that the express elevators will take you right there.i love visiting big cities and finding random little restaurants in the oddest locations.especially given the price.really loved the green salsa (?) they served with it on the side.the shrimp on the other hand is quite tasty, and fresh.

The foods are not worth the price.the food was good, i was a bit blind to what all was on the menu but the raw fish i had tasted very fresh, was a large serving and had fantastic flavor.i do not recommend the empanada, lomo saltado, cau cau, tallarín saltado, asado, aji de gallina, papa rellena.glad i don't have to venture all the way to their sister restaurant ay ay picante anymore.i had the meat empanada and that was very tasty, also with the dip even more yummy! i had the mixed seafood ceviche and this was a pretty big portion and very tasty.yes, that green sauce is merely amazing.the limo was on point as stated in the review there staff was great very attentive funny and always check on us very cool.beautiful space, good food and warm, friendly service.food was ok, bit oily.the huancainas had just the right amount of spice.

Fried triple cream brie was tasty.service was also  rather slow even for an empty restaurant early in the day.a friend and i visited joy district towards the beginning of our evening out on a sunday around 7pm.never had frozen rose before, but here you can find it in ample supply.their specialty cocktail menu was a bit limited in my opinion but offered some fun options.the manager had to come out to let us in.not too thrilled about our experience walking in, not a fan of our waiter, and kitchen forgot to send us a roll we ordered.when it came down to the dessert, we asked the waitress what she would recommend which ended up being a blueberry cake, we weren't fans.yep, not a typo, 10:30pm -- 2hrs and 15 mins after our reservation time.

The owner is super accommodating and kind to everyone.let us eat snails!i expected just a few shreds of lamb shank for the filling, but we got a whole shank!each crepe came with it's own sauce pairing.they were very good.the savory crepes had a lot of fresh ingredients and same with the sweet crepes!this place has more of a mediterranean vibe to it.everything was delicious, including the coffee! the red pepper hot sauce that comes with the savory crepes was absolutely amazing.amazing.not a fan.they have plenty of sweet and savory crepes.the crepe are light and evenly browned with nice crisp around the edge.he even gave me some tips on where to find lacoste in my size for cheap.

Fun.this place was so good, me and my girlfriend went to the one in la and loved it! so we decided to try this one close to us.here's a summary:ambiance: nice! pretty empty when we were there, but it had only opened very recently and it was a sunday evening..can't recommend this place enough!.delicious meal with an awesome and attentive server named poonam.after we ordered the food we took a few minutes to look over the drink menu and settled on lychee martinis and the beijing belini (yummmm!!)  the drinks were really good and reasonably priced for a restaurant in chicago/west loop.however, even when you follow their suggested cooking times the meats area always very very undercooked.the service here was really good and everyone was nice and polite.

6 policemen and 3 swat members came in to eat while we were there-we figured that meant it was a good place to eat!..i loved the selections avaible and was impressed with their frozen pasta selection.still, i felt as a result that i would give conte a try.overall a winner with friendly staff to boot!.

This part was kinda disappointed but the waiter noticed so when he brought it he apologized for the delay..they have chicha (a drink) and some venezuelan chocolate for sale as well!the food: we had some passion fruit juice and chicha.it said on the menu that this came with soup and an arepa.for the main dish, my family ordered the bowls that were on the menu and i was the only one who ordered something different.the byob is also nice.until, venezuelan bowl.from the moment we walked in until we left, satisfaction was exceeded.the meat was tender mixed with the beans which were juicy and adding in just a small piece of the plantain to each bite.parking is available on the street and best of all byob!!!.

So i'm not sure if groupon was a good deal or not.tried the traditional, and was disappointed.this place is "da bomb".thanks yelp!!.i don't think i need to eat for a few days.the pieces of lobster have become smaller and more scarce with each visit.isaiah will make sure you have the best meal.wow!!! we're visiting from ca and so happy we stumbled upon this place.too bad they don't have a better product to sell.

I finally got a chance to come after many attempts..thier drink menu was different from other places i've seen." super awkward.probably just for the tequila.i won't be going back, but i tried it!.the taco business has heated up in the west loop, and this is the latest addition to the list of places to hit for good mexican street food.don't know what it's like during the day, but it's so loud at night, forget conversing.our chips and guac were okhonesty, you could get better food at chiles!i would just go back at night for drinks and shots, not for the food.the shrimp ceviche was on point! the atmosphere is definitely competing with parlor which is  only a few blocks down the street however this place seems to have a more mature crowd and a bit more family friendly.

I enjoyed the meditteranean salad (eggplant hummus + olives + "saganaki" cheese sumac croutons), but it's quite filling.do you love having practically a whole cucumber on top of your burger? awesome, me neither!a nest of fried shoestring onions tops your burger and pretty much destroys any taste of bacon, hamburger, or "special sauce.it's thick pieces of baguette bread cooked in a skillet with some brown sugar, so it forms a nice caramel coating on the bottom of the bread.cocktails are $10 at happy hour.service: attentive to our large 8 person party.so overall loud!as for drinks.they give you four huge pieces of chicken, battered, seasoned, and fried to perfection.

I attended tea time one sunday winter's evening.i ordered the lean sandwich and my friend ordered the mean sandwich (both ten dollars).we'll be coming again and again.they do have a "vegetarian option" which basically involves removal of the smoked salmon, but no creative difference otherwise.during the day you can enjoy brunch and tea, while the evening brings the bar scene.it was all chopped up super fine, so delicious.of course, i'm just nitpicking at this point, overall everything was awesome!.the blackcurrant macaroon was unusual, like a mixed berry flavor.

Our server sean was very attentive and helpful! he helped us choose our drinks and food.loved the atmosphere and the "toilet" is really a must see! i ordered the premium steak pasty along with mash and gravy, and it was good.they were delicious.

Great! they made me a fresh chopped salad!the chips and guacamole were also tasty.2) i was not provided with any small plates even when i ordered an appetizer.ricardo was our bartender and he was awesome! he made the drinks nice and allowed me to call when to stop pouring the liquor which means i loved all the drinks he made for me! great place, great service.there was also a large amount of flys swarming the outdoor seating, which could be due to weather but was distracting while eating my meal.yummy yummy fresh tacos! the chicken taco was delish and different from anything i've had.food was ok but the service was so slow and honestly it was not even busy.first time here great tasty steak tacos with home made tortillas would definitely come again great customer service as well.they were also showing the blackhawks game, which was going very well, so the atmosphere was lively and fun.my first impression was "let's go to the shitty taco place!"and it lived up to that reputation.he also explained to us that the pitcher at full price is actually a "better" deal.
So only on special occasions.
Place also looks great and staff was friendly.amazing drinks,  amazing service.

We were looking for something close to where we were or a quick l ride away and we found this place on google so we decided what the heck.wings were pretty good, came with a buffalo style hot sauce..both pizzas were really crispy, light, and very well balanced regarding cheese:sauce:toppings.the margherita pizza was delicious and of course the ravirogi were just as delicious as they always are.my favorite pizza in the city! love the pizza with garlic olive oil instead of sauce.it's the standard stuff, but it also has some cool takes on standard stuff.(hopefully soon!).can assume that it would be packed during game days, especially the bears.the pizza is delicious.
I haven't had harold's chicken is quite some time.the grease was clean.

I was trying to be healthy.the staff has always been nice and very attentive.the service was top-notch, and greatly exceeded expectations for a casual place like this.i was in the mood for a bloody and thought theirs was probably one of the best i've had in the neighborhood.overall good service and great food.we'll definitely be back!.

Service was very pleasant and very efficient.good prices.white table cloths and asian music in the background made me feel like i was at a more classy restaurant.everything was great, except the egg rolls.we were looking forward to some good chinese food and saw that this place had 4 stars and some great reviews.i wasted my money.i've been to chinatown in nyc and san francisco and never had such awful chinese food.we had the crab rangoon and some sort of fried noodles, along with green tea.it's so delicious, it's criminal! it's to die for!.dare i speak of the mutant broccoli that look like the size of plums.

Great new spot with some tasty food.i recommend it.i went to black iron tavern on opening weekend.we loved the atmosphere.will be back.stopped by the cubs game and the food we had was amazing! bbq pulled pork potato skins, caprese salad & korean style wings.i'm surprised there isn't a line out the door for it like there is for the au cheval burger.we will be back.solid scene.the music was at a perfect volume for the day and time we were there, i'm sure it changes depending on the crowd.

I'm looking forward to my next visit to chicago.my favorites: i really liked the veggie & peanut crystal skin dumplings and the glass noodles with snap peas and blueberries (both were off the vegetarian menu which they don't give you unless you ask to see it!).the taiwanese fried chicken was a *very* generous serving (it was basically a standard chinese takeout box packed to the brim with crispy fried chicken, which was doubly nice considering it had been delivered, and everyone knows fried foods loose their crunch with time.wood fired duck hearts - perfectly tender, slightly charred (in a good way), with a sprinkling of sesame seeds & a schmear of a sesame aioli that imo wasn't really needed because the hearts stood out all alone.the noodles are so soft and chewy and the flavor is amazing.it wasn't the best i've had, but it was still delicious.we drive there and figure if we can't get in we will sit at the bar.maybe i need to try the main dishes to get a better grasp on it though.ambiance was adorable.the food at duck duck goat was phenomenal! a round of applause goes out to the kitchen staff because they created dishes that were not only appealing to the eye, but to the stomach as well.

This is a hidden gem brunch spot.so, if you are in a rush, just realize you can't just pop out of your car right in front for valet.overall the food was excellent & the service great.to be honest, the best part of the meal was the monkey bread, now that was delicious.if you've been to dunlay's or frasca, this menu will look familiar as it's part of the same restaurant group.service is great, the view of millennium park is pretty decent.i enjoyed the crab louie, it was satisfying in terms of portion and also was appropriately chilled on a warm day.honestly, didn't care too much about it.it was soft, yet crunchy with the almonds.from the blue cheese wedge salad to the steaks to the the almond tres leches, the food was fantastic.

My boyfriend preferred the lamb with tikka masala and i preferred chicken.the place is a long room, with the counter on the left, and about 8 two top tables lined on the right.my impression of this place is an indian chipotle.definitely not even close to authentic indian food.whenever i find myself in the area i will definitely stop  in.it was delicious.yes! a new indian lunch option has been added to the loop!naansense is currently offering a grand opening special at $5 including an entree, side, and drink.i waited 40 minutes for them to redeliver the wrong order again.please go back to your old portion sizes!  i used to promote naansense like crazy but now i always leave wanting more.

The worst part was our waiter telling us our food was on its way out when we flagged him to ask for the check.the chips, guac, and salsa were also perfect.my husband and i had 3 apps and each had an entree made to order by the chef and each dish was better than the last.the chicken in dark mole was among the best either of us has ever tasted.yup, i wanted to have sex with my chilaquiles, right there on the table.

Their taco prices are much cheaper than other restaurants but certainly adds up because you have to pay for each item.95 they are priced amazing.their kitchen is all up front, and you can see the ladies behind the counter hustling all hours that god sent their way; there's something to be said about that as it lets you know they keep a clean shop.rabbit: you're not mexican?get the tacos.i've tried most of the meats and while the asada can be a bit greasy, it's pretty standard in terms of chopped mexican steak.i felt like i was in the or of a hospital.it literally tastes like nothing.also the place is spotless!!!all of the burritos are awesome! my favorite was the bbq pork.the lengua tacos on the other hand were delicious.love how authentic it is.

The brussels sprout salad which was apparently the most ordered item on the menu was pathetic.i especially loved the crispy brussel sprouts and i don't even like them no matter how they're prepared! chicken lollipops and ropa vieja were also standouts.i checked out the new west loop hot spot for an event and really enjoyed it.fantastic addition to the west loop!had reservation at 6pm on a saturday night, the place was already packed but we got seated right away.a friendly host seated us fast.sitting outside, drinking bloody mary's while people walked pass with their dogs and baby carriage made me wish i had a dog.great atmosphere but the food lacked anything special.ordered the chicken and waffles.the waitress had attitude while "taking our drink orders" leaving us all to think similar sarcastic thoughts "how dare we ask a waitress to take our order, the nerve we have.
If you eat in, you also get a cup of delicious broth!.great grilled salmon sandwich.

Lots of wood and stuff all over the walls combined with several giant tvs for sports.probably been here a dozen times or so.$4 shot wheel, good strong drinks and a decent beer selection.if you like a mountain of jalapeños that make your poutine incredibly spicy, without it being mentioned on the menu, and waiters that don't refill your water the entire time you're there, even though the place was far from full, this is your place.it's a bar.a good, typical divey bar.in continuation of the higher alcohol content, i selected the fish and chips.its a small place so when we walked in it was hard to know if you grabbed your own table or waited, bartenders and waitresses never acknowledged us.when i travel i always try to check out bars with a lot of history behind them--this one obviously delivers.we wandered in a couple hours before catching our flight home and boy were we pleasantly surprised! we asked to purchase a t-shirt as a souvenir only to be told they didn't have any at that time but.

My only complaint is that i lack the self discipline to eat slowly.this should be all over the country as it is some of the best barbecue i have ever had.the mac n cheese sides are too small!  something that delicious needs to come in bigger portions!  my stomach demands it!  also, i don't think cornbread should be a side that you have to pay for!  that's like paying for your toast with your omelet!  stop being greedy!if you work anywhere near this place, please check it out!  but not too often or you'll get fat.chipotle potato salad so/so.but no ribs here.and you get a really good portion of meatcornbread: also pretty good.had the pulled pork platter with mac and cheese, and was not disappointed.

The jalapeño poppers are an awesome spin on the traditional kind and the shrimp tempura is crunchy, light and delicious.i enjoyed my first visit, & i look forward to visiting again.typical chinese joint making sushi.were seated right away, for a saturday night it was pretty empty.i can't tell what "good quality" is, but it tasted good to me and that's all i care about.the unfortunate thing is that it doesn't get that busy which is great for immediate seating but no so great for my hopes of seeing this place stick around a while.i get that the fish comes in frozen and that they thaw it out in a refrigerator.the edamame was fresh, the fallen angel with the sliced scallops on top was delicious and sweet, and my companion really enjoyed his uic roll.the bufflao shrimp and rock shrimp was not bad.until now.

Great environment, but sadly i can't say the same about the food.i ordered the creamy cashew with chicken, carrots, kale, and bok coy.it was surprisingly really tasty & the portion was pretty big! i don't feel guilty eating this at all and will probably come back again before i leave chicago :).during the lunch rush the line can get long, stretching easily to the door before wrapping back on itself, but no one seems to mind.but the vegetables themselves were uniformly chopped well and tender-crisp.not greasy, quickly made, and with a great flavor.the food is very flavorful.this is a classic wok restaurant, but it has brightened things up for sure.the concept is something we will be seeing a lot of: given some sauce, protein, and veggie options you can create a different stir fry every time.

As a hispanic, nothing fits better than tossing in cola champagne with it.i mean everything on their menu is.we were in the area and stopped in to try a cubano! also had a cubanito steak sandwich.i mean the place looks okay, nice floors, chairs are over doing it, they probably dumped way more money then they should have in remodeling.n the café con leche is a must.no wonder i've never seen them make the coffee, they have no expresso machines and no where to brew coffee.good prices.sooooo goooood!.steak sandwiches pretty good, i might go back with my wife to have her taste, i would have given four stars if it was solely based on the empanadas.

The flavors were nicely developed in the beef, the coconut rice was rich and heavenly, and the accoutrements were perfectly balanced.5 stars from me!., slippery slope, emporium, etc.there are only a few full on malaysian restaurants in the suburbs and that's the only way to get it, unless you find yourself at a friend's place or a merdeka day celebration.they also have amazing drunken noodles.the ingredients were fresh and the dishes were well made.for the price, i was expecting more.best asian food i've had in chicago since i moved here 2 and half years ago.serai is chicago's latest malaysian offering.

However they have huge portion of beef and relatively cheap price.95), and with the power of fomo, decided to order a fried egg to go on top of the noodles.a little on the bland side.this is by far the most authentic lanzhou noodles i had in the states.my friend got the beef rib noodle and there was like 3 ribs there and one of them was just bare bone with no meat on it.maybe their soups are better??  my son and i voted not to come back next time tho.this place really took me back to the 5 rmb bowls of ramen that i had in china back in the day.completely satisfied.

The service was excellent and very welcoming.you can't go wrong!.made last minute reservations and glad they could accommodate.the first time we went, i ordered the ravioli aragosta (lobster ravioli), which was good but not great.we shared each other's dishes because we could not decide which was better.found sofi while searching for italian food the night before the chicago marathon.they have classic italian pastas and dishes and everything was delicious! the service was also great, very nice people, very attentive.again, i will say that the service was good.a cute touch which made me smile.dress is casual, more so than we were expecting.

Overall good food.chicken meatballs are small but delicious.the other entree we ordered was the guay tiew kaeng neua (rice noodle with beef curry).staff is also very friendly and jj is also good for carryout..excellent thai food.all of the noodles are crafted amazingly, with the pork dishes being the best in my opinion.the meal and soup were very tasty however the fried chicken was definitely not chicken.
I'm for sure a big fan of their 3 diff salsas  they give you with your tortilla chips if you dine in.they have dine in and carry out and delivery.

Excellent service.it affected the texture.i don't think this was super french or anything but it was nice, and that chicken crepe was so good if you're into creamy things and large portions.i am not saying food is bad, i just don't think the flavor and taste blew me away.it didnt have much flavor at all which is what really made me not like it, but i think thats how it was supposed to be.my husband got the special stew, which was a chicken and tomato stew that he said was awesome.felt satiated but not stuffed.i am also super picky about about bread and butter at places and this bread and butter was to my satisfaction.the waitstaff was very attentive and helped pick out the perfect wine for the evening.rabbit was good so was the salmon.

I really loved the salsa.they have everything you need for a complete meal from the starters to dessert, aguas frescas (homemade flavored waters) are absolutely refreshing.the torta bread is baked to perfection and the carnitas just melts in your mouth.it was so filling and delicious.the bratwurst and brussels sprouts atop the schnitzel and kraut might initially appear to be as extraneous as the umlaut on the 'u' un haüs, but one bite convinces you that this is a winning combination.although the salsa (mild) was okay at best the main course steak bowl was great.total win.still, i'd go back because the experience overall was awesome.

Union sushi is such an expensive place with bad quality food and service, we had higher expectation, but spending $170 that night for 2 of us was way too much and just felt like robbed!!.their meat bbq options were also just ok.i've been here a handful of times.the menu is big so you have many choices and a big variety of sushi to choose from.since i was traveling alone and i wasn't familiar with the area, i thought i would play it safe and order in.50 for a 3-bite skewer of very tender/marinated beef), and shrimp tempura rolls.i ordered the chicken ramen and super white tuna for delivery.i thought it was a nice touch that they brought my friend ice cream with a candle on it and made sure we felt really special on a night planned for my friend.we didn't have a chance to try any of the drinks, but we definitely will next time.

Everything we ate here was amazing!.we sat outside on the patio and had great service.we heard that they have a small kitchen, but the table next to us got their food well before we did when they were seated a half hour after us.i just want to talk about that chili mac n cheese because it was the only thing i ate and also because i miss it so much and wish we could be together again.my wife and i make it a habit to stop by a few times a year when we are nearby.such good food and a fun atmosphere!!.there are so many good sounding things on the menu, so i am def going to be coming back very soon.i would encourage everyone to come here and try some of their dishes with open minds and you'll probably come out having more appreciation for vegetarian/vegan dishes like me!.i will definitely be back soon.bloody was fantastic so they must have dolled it up a bit.

Plus parking.we rate this restaurant an a+ and that doesn't happen oftenshrimp and fries were definitely the 2 things i recommend here.stop by here once a week and wholeheartedly agree with most reviews here.i was too full to sample anything else on the menu,  but i foresee many more trips ahead.bring cash and get a couple dogs with fries.better yet, get two and give one to me.the people working there are super nice too.plain store bun,  limp hot dog,  no celery salt,  pickle,  etc?  you've got pictures of proper hot dogs all over the place and hand me this garbage for three dollars?do yourself a favor and go anywhere else.toss in a generous bag of freshly cut french fries and a pop, and you have an excellent lunch for only $7.
