It was really hectic like we walk in no hello no hostess just awkwardly standing there the inside is really nice but the inside is closed so we have to sit outside fml the patio is really pretty but it was so hot outside not to mention its chicago so hello to the un invited flies that wont stop coming.cute establishment.cafe.delicious food.delicious, will definitely be back.flan was the final course and quite delicious especially considering i typically don't like it.very disappointed!!  went here to celebrate my birthday and drove 30 miles to specifically have there famous lechon asado.cafe by a friend so decided to have dinner there and i was not disappointed! i ordered the surf & turf and it was by far the best i ever had!!! in my line of work i get to try a lot of different restaurants both in town and out of town so this place definitely ranks among my favorites.we were all pretty hungry and it didn't help that the service was a bit slow.i kept sneaking more bites.

My friend was living a few blocks away on western and we referred to this place as "the taco place" even though he was located closer to several other taco restaurants.small establishment but real authentic mexican food they are a family business so i didn't mind waiting a little longer for my food to arrive.found my new spot for mexican.

There is no reason to reinvent the tortilla chip- stick to the classic, it's never failed.staff is nice but line formation for placing orders is rather confusing as patrons don't seem to stand in any line in front of the open register.this place was a great find and suited our needs well.lyfe has a lot of great healthy choices, although a tad pricey.the sprouts dish i've had twice and both times it was pretty good (the sprouts were amazing), but the squash hasn't been cooked quite right so it was a funky texture.the flavor-free chips and guac was the first bad sign: it was more like "old, stale crackers with squashed avocado.i'm so happy with my veggie burger and this location.this is a great healthy lunch option in the streeterville area.the art's unfried chicken & the mahi tacos are great - but i think i liked the chicken more! the brussels sprout/butternut squash side is delicious ! but the soups are also outstanding ! for someone who is dairy free, having corn chowder is such a special treat! they make it with cashew cream and it's delicious ! the seasonal squash soup was outstanding as well.

The layout is not conducive for a busy weekend night (there is a pool table the front entrance)..good music and a casual vibe make henry's a place i'll frequent more often.50.the kentucky hot brown is also something of a must to get while here.coming from the same family as dmk and fish bar, i set my expectations pretty high when coming into henry's swing club.i'll make it rain for sliders any day.

This one has by far my favorite taco ever, a slow roasted angus beef taco! best life choice you will ever make.the frozen margaritas were delicious as well - strong but tasted very well.)the place seats about 20 people or so.been to lots o taco shops across usa and this is way up there.menu was full of interesting options but those three spoke to me the most.pretty good food, but expect a wait.

Simply amazing! jasmine sooooo good!this place will become one of my favorite for sure.pros: awesome coffee, beautiful presentation of food, unique flavored cream cheese bar  cute atmosphere, nice friendly owners.couldn't help but notice the attractive mosaic floor, vertical repurposed pellet-garden and unique centerpieces on the table.can't wait to come back and try more things- warm & refreshing atmosphere- service was fantastic- owners are inviting, genuine, & very nicegreat new spot!.amazing staff, amazing and creative food, amazing vibe.they have a great choice of bagels, coffee and delicious cured fishes.

Grease was seeping through our pores after, but it was worth every bite.fun atmosphere and all around good experience.i'm not sure about the relish, it was a neon green color, almost looks like it can glow in the dark.this is a great place to get a dog or burger!  hell, even fries!!  went here tonight with my nieces on a whim to get some chicago dogs before we leave town.new found spot for lunch.i liked the interior of the place, the reasonable prices on their other menu items, and i later found out they are a small chain in the chicago area.

The food is very yummy! the cocktails are great.the craft beer selection is good and the waiter was able to recommend something perfect to pair with dinner.it's a good spot to grab drinks while waiting for deep dish :).very well done.it's very rich.

Okay so unlike most of the people i know who go on and on about pinstripes, i am happy to say i can "see see that the emperor has no clothes".we said okay, because the fireworks did not start until 10:15.great combination!  however, not so much.looking for a cool place to lounge while playing some bocce or bowling.the calamari was really good, so good a roach ran out for it.went to pinstripes with a group of 9 to celebrate a birthday on saturday night.pinstripes is great - the food is delicious, the staff are friendly and accommodating, and what makes the restaurant stand out is its proximity to navy pier.striped bass entree was decent.bad costumer service made me two terrible drinks.(and i'm really not very picky about service.

Another because one of my appetizers was pretty good.we were a little put off my the service as we didn't want everything at once, but what can we do.i ordered a wild mushroom and garlic with arugala and it was great! i would love to come back and try more dishes.our bill was right around $35 which is a bit pricey for a casual lunch but definitely a nice treat.

The jamaican jerk chicken wrap, tomato basil bisque and the jerk chicken bowl are slammin'!  i love the freshness of the veggies and the savory flavor of the food.the wrap was really good and was a perfect level of lunch-spicy..the flavor had my tongue dancing.i love this place.plus, they have a cooler of drinks in case those are not up to you speed.the smoothies are $3.but then.i wish they would expand and provide delivery or more locations.

Still find the whole situation very unprofessional, but at least it was rectified to an extent.big bricks is a great, low key neighborhood restaurant/bar in north center to grab a few beers and some pizza or bbq.the vegetarian pizza was just average though, but i have to admit i went against the recommended pizza because its name "painful" make me instinctively clutch my chest and search my bag for some rolaids.service - 5 starschili cheese fries - 5 starsbarbecue - 3 stars.sorry for the bad review, but it was that bad.really impressed with the atmosphere, service, food, and especially the beer list.i haven't had the food yet but the draft beer selection of 20 good beers is all $4! lagunitas, unibroe, weinstephaner, steigl and more are all $4..legit, good, local $4 beers.pretty empty when we went in which was surprising, but will definitely be bringing a bigger crowd with me next time.

You know what they call thursdays?  thirsty thursdays!  yep, on thursday you can get yourself a yummy horchata with rum for under 4 bucks.went here for dinner yesterday.everything is reasonably priced as well..they have $1 tacos on tuesday which in my opinion is a steal for the amount of food they give you.flaco's tacos has a special/deal every day of the week, which makes ordering something much easier (at least in my mind).but god bless them for being a mom and pop in a world of bar louie and subway.packed if you hit it at the right time though.and y'all no it's hard to mess up tacos.takeaway outside their delivery zone, so i pushed the steak to the side.

We got polenta fries (which came with pesto and tomato sauce - i guessed red and green salsa, and i was wrong and wrong), the cajun fish sandwich, and the carnitas sandwich.this place was picked for our monthly birthday lunch, and i decided to order the homage.there are big tvs all around that aren't at all overbearing and are actually quite inviting.the fries were excellent as well.one of my favorite restaurants in chicago so far! i don't normally like to eat salads at restaurants, but the california salad here is the bomb.we ordered a grilled artichoke and a lobster roll for appetizers.doc b's is a solid burger joint with an entertaining music playlist (mainstream remixes) and friendly vibe.
The woman that greeted me at the cash register was super sweet.we will definitely be back.good prices and friendly service.

I just tried the house specialty, full skirt steak breakfast.we orderedlonganiza - juicy & sweet!tocino - yum!skirt steak - done just right!really enjoyed the breakfast but not sure it's worth the wait.maybe i'll come back and try the fried milkfish & eggs.this is the first time i've had philippine food, so we thought we would try it out.steak and egg extraordinaire!big portions & big flavor all served on a bigger plate!pay attention to the menu here because uncle mike strongly suggests what to order with big pictures.every breakfast combo comes with eggs, garlic rice, and a bowl of porridge which has a hint of lemon.

Xi'an cuisine is often forgotten in favor of restaurants in the 'lao' chain or bubble tea, but i really like the street food format that this restaurant provides.everything we ate was fine, but we have been to xi'an famous foods in nyc and this pales in comparison to that.i tried the lamb with cumin and it was deliciously spiced.we went to chinatown on a sunday afternoon looking to try something new.taste good.can't wait to go back to try this.in my experience, you just can't go wrong with anything you order here.noodles were delicious and lamb was tender, put some white pepper or spicy sauce in it would be more tasty.hand pulled noodles are my favorite because they're long and thick with some chew behind them.i went to a lot of time is cash that pay cash to give a discount .
They will text you when your order is up! fun and easy.

And, byob! such a nice addition to our booming neighborhood.well seasoned and fast service.the food is authentic to home style mexican which is better to me than those modern and over priced places where the food is marginal.awaiting their patio to open.absolutely love this place.you pay inside, which prevented us from feeling rushed.fish tacos were great as well.clean and friendly staff.i leave stuffed and happy.

I recommend giving coalfire because the pizza was good and the service was great.the best pizza in chicago! perfectly chewy crust with just the right amount of char, and toppings that sound familiar but bring new life to their relationship with pizza.he was fast to tell us that we couldn't be seated until everyone in our party had arrived with the worst attitude-3 with us, 2 on the way.).currently, our top spot for thin crust pizza.

90% of locations i go to treat "with garlic" as "put some garlic in there" - this place treated it as "change the whole thing to the bucket of garlic sauce" - which is not tasty.i want to give no stars.the place is old and the dining room is old, the place looks like it run down.3 stars only, food is good, good consistency with taste, but they skipped out on the beef when i order their house fried rice; other then that good place for food.

It was really good.i will add that the menu is somewhat limited --- maybe adding a few choice appetizers would be a nice addition.we wish the food had been as good as the warm, friendly welcome we received from the lovely young woman at the counter.i was worried the cheese would overpower it, but it really blends nicely.

And it was just that!foodjake kept some of his staples (only fine-tuning them to perfection) the winners included the potato soup (may i add with white sturgeon caviar?!), duck three ways, the mind blowing sweetbread, the cheese in the class paradise, the honey cream ball and the beet macaroon which replaced one of my former favorites called "24 hour beet".you feel like you're going to a fun dinner party with a fantastic dinner host..they encourage asking questions and make it clear that they are totally fine with picture taking.just wow.this was followed by lightly crispy mussels that sat on an incredibly addictive curry sauce--the kind of aromatic sauce that you just want to keep scooping up.

Girlfriend and i decided to try this place last night.they recommend about 2 plates per person here, which i think is about right.service was superb but not "hovering".simple, high-quality ingredients cooked perfectly.it was difficult to eat such a large chunk of salty meat.since we were eating the wagyu beef plain, the sauce was a little too overpowering in certain bites.you'd have to load up each slice of bread to just finish the pot or let the bacon jam go to waste.*risotto with fried duck egg, probably the tastiest dish of them all.would be a great place for a celebratory meal with the parents.

It's very clean and the staff is friendly and helpful when it came to ordering.that said, in all honesty i probably wouldn't gravitate to this place as there are other stir-fry asian places which i prefer.after we found out going up again would be an extra $4 (which is a great deal if you already had a full meal especially because you can get it to go) she had honestly felt a little cheated.i'm really torn about how to rate this place.staff is friendly and helpful.they cook separately if you have dietary restrictions.lots of choices and loved the sauces.good food n good place for groups.amazing vegan place! nice stuff! very cheap and taste.always love the bowls i create and today i made a soup by adding the yellow stick.

Tried this place for dinner tonight and i have nothing but praise for la encantada.it's on par with tacos de jaliscense,and that's high praise.i'm also a picky eater when it comes to mexican food (nothing as good as mami's house), and this place completely meets my high yet simple standards: fresh, tasty, and free of weird frills.next time i ordered the enchiladas with mole and they were amazing!friendly service, and good food!.can't recommend it enough.service is good, food is awesome!.unfortunately, we were the only ones in the restaurant.making a chile relleno with an ancho chile is a good idea.we went on a friday night a little early and were the only customers in the restaurant.they are so so spicy, but so so flavorful.

Miso short-rib bacos are amazing, as is the pozole soup (great for the cold weather).i love the unique creativeness of the menu - makes it hard to pick something.the food was ok, but the portion size was tiny.i'll give this place another shot on a less busy day, but until then, there are plenty of other options to try.atmosphere: 8/10service: 9/10food: 9/10.this is one of those places that makes you jealous of the people who work downtown and can actually go here for lunch.they were both outstanding, and the service was great!.the staff was very friendly and educated on their menu which i always enjoy.location is more for those that work in the area as no parking unless you wanted to pay the expensive downtown parking or get lucky and find a place on the street.got the sweet potato fries and tostones to start.

Corridor brewery & provisions opened at 5pm yesterday in southport.it's one thing is you're on the ocean and have a view and charge a little bit more for so so food, but another thing when you're expensive and have to eat on the street lol.the atmosphere of the place is great.it was slammed with people cuz of the weather and cubs game.just a good solid stop for after-movie dinner and drinks.will go back for beers and dinner in the future!.i could /see/ the dressing, but it didn't taste like anything.this is where the staff looks disney hipster, the menu is way over priced, and the beer is as average as it comes.i'd have a burger here over places like kuma's or dmk any day.good beer and food.

I explained that i had to run, but would pick up the food in roughly an hour.just a little bit.i ordered the chicken shawerma sandwich (delicious) and my fiancé ordered the lamb galaya (delicious as well).just to cap off the experience.nice deco.the wait staff is really friends.this place has almost 400 reviews for a reason.then did not know what to choose for my entree many things looked good in the menu; so went for a combo of beef kabob and chicken swarma to give me a chance to try different things.hummus -- 3 starstabouli -- 2 starsfalafel -- 4 starsfatoush salad -- 3 starsgrape leaves -- 2 starspita -- 2 starsone thing to note:  this place is byob.

I hope they expand soon! the only thing is it's tiny, so the best time to come is during the week or just with one other person.the natural light creates a great atmosphere to start your day.this is one of my favorite brunch spots in the city.i am updating this to say i'm surprised that we never received a response or apology from this restaurant.i definitely recommend checking this place out.i've had pretty much everything in the menu and it's so addicting.perfect breakfast this morning with my girls trip.

I highly recommend trying this restaurant as they have a number of unique offerings and they also brew their own beer.the exception to this was the beet beer, but not in a good way.our table agreed that the fennel apricot dessert was one of the best desserts we've had in a really long time.i love sitting at the bar here because it feels like i'm having dinner and a show.this place is an absolute gem.trust me here! great cocktail list as well as great service at the bar.no olives, nuts, or frites, nothing of the sort.the dinner menu was hard to put together.they are taken out of the shell so they may be a little deceiving since they are a little smaller than you expect but again they were amazing; make sure you get all the ingredients together.no issues with service.

These tacos have everything from coconut to figs on them.the three we got were delicious and not very spicy but had a hint of heat.anyhoo on to our side dish: three sister polenta.so, if you are looking for last minute dinner plans with no wait, this is a good option.this is outrageous and quite frankly seems intentionally (since they've clearly gotten the feedback that this is a problem via yelp reviews).v hot, a given etc.my husband and i decided to try a new place for dinner and man were we lucky to find this gem! i had their seasonal margarita (watermelon) and it was probably the best margarita i've ever had.it just ended on a poor note.i met a new friend here this evening after reading the reviews on yelp.

Overall i would go back.they have a distinct taste, a little hard to describe, but i'll try!!!  they are sweet and have an tiny bit of a underlying taste of mild curry?  did i hit it on the head? garlic lemon pepper wings are pretty classic.they were all very good, especially the fire jerk and mango jerk.the wings themselves were good sized, non-breaded and had very little fat.this location moved to 510 e 75th.wish we wouldn't have gotten stuck in traffic because i'm sure our wings would have been more crisp.then, my lips started to puff up and i could actually feel them pulsating as if they each had their own heartbeat.the woman at the register was friendly and they do let you try the sauces.officially and currently my favorite wing place in chicago.

The food was amazing.my wife had shrimp scampi over pasta.wouldn't recommend coming back except for drinks.the service was a little slow but i think its because they had to bring the food from downstairs?? it did the job of feeding us before the movie, but was not so memorable that i would return for the food.for my entrée i just went with a burger and my friend had the fish tacos.we came in for brunch on a sunday because the place we had planned to go to was way to long of a wait.as a whole, it's not bad at all yet not outstanding.thou shall not eat as it is very dry that ketchup could not even save.the bed of kale salad was tasty, yet the portion seemed rather large.

Loved the ambiance and decor of the place.huge portions!  get the fat elvis waffles.the more casual version of its older sister, little goat brings classic american diner food to the trendy scene with more gourmet offerings.

This is a great byob that doesn't hurt the pocketbook.very good service.try this if you already have lot of sichuan style chinese food.i've never had a dish that i don't like.i had the cumin lamb and it was wonderful! very tender, spicy, served on the bone, but very easy to eat.these are some decent dumplings because some places the pork isn't flavorful enough or the soup is dried up, but at homestyle the flavor and the cook on the dumplings were perfect.i was let down.i will definitely be back again when i am in chicago!.

Cool atmosphere and pleasantly crowded.really 3.we went there last week for my birthday.we went to sip for a birthday brunch at about 11am on a saturday morning! there was (surprisingly) no wait time, and we were able to eat outside in the beautiful patio.the food:i had the perch which was served without any tartar sauce or dressing whatsoever which i thought was interesting until i tried it..make sure you make a reservation because the place is crowded!.oh my god.i wish the food selection was a little better for brunch.

It is located on the corner, however every single window is blocked off and the entrance is on the side.last time we ordered the garganzolla pasta, chicken tighs, and we had to order the fries with truffle aioli sauce.we'll be back!.great list of cocktails, especially several unusual "old fashioned" style drinks: gin old fashioned, mezcal old fashioned.bar service was really slow.the outside is so dark, they have black out curtains on the windows so you can't see inside, we almost passed this place up! the entrance is around the corner on washtenaw rather than chicago.*cheese gnocchi was to die for.

Bajia eggs are good as well as steak and egg enchiladas!  the chocolate cappuccino is to die for!! service is quick and good.starter:old school frontera trio - 2 each of mexico city style corn masa quesadilas (love the corn and the cheese was so creamy on the inside), chicken taquitos (cripsy and on a mound of super fresh guac), and albacore tuna ceviche (nice and zesty).appetizersceviche was great.the cocktails were wonderful too!.their guacamole here is very good, but similar to my brunch option the portion was a little small.i highly recommend trying frontera for brunch! there is an excellent assortment of great mexican breakfast/bruch dishes that don't carry the high price point of the dinner menu.so many great flavours, such a good vibe - i'd love to get back here soon to enjoy their full menu or maybe a tasty dinner - i will be back as arnie said!for $25 for a full belly and a mocktail it was great value too.00 for a few slices of meat or a few shrimp the least they can do is serve it warm!portions are very small and if you cannot have a lot is of spice there is really no point in dining here.this place is very average, i would say it did not meet my expectations.eventually she just walked away and let me do whatever i wanted.

The food is very tasty, & the prices are extremely reasonable.this place is a little piece of heaven on earth.the dining area is clean and relaxing.great service.my husband loves spicy food and really likes this chicken! he often reminds me to get one if i haven't picked one up in a while!i also love the veggie breakfast burrito, which can also be ordered with added chicken (if you want that added protein boost.green cafe has so many options! the staff is so sweet.

Went to order and was told that the 50 cent wings were done.smells funny in there..i i don't eat chicken but they have colossal  shrimp with the ginger barbecue sauce that's fire!! i'm  a yelp person and they had rave reviews so i brought my daughter here.incredible savory flavors paired with incredibly tender wings.love the shrimp haven't tried chicken wings yet!.best wings on the planet! get the garlic parmesan, cheesy buffalo, and jerk barbecue and you'll get a vast myriad of memorable flavors.maybe better! loved the lemon pepper, cheesy buffalo and the banging ranch.it's about an eight minute walk so i decided to walk my dog i arrived at the location to find that the computer was down so i went back outside to check on my dog who is sitting outside and once i came back in the computer still was not working..

First time trying the restaurant and was thoroughly impressed with the food.i definitely recommend this placebetter than din tai fung in my opinion.i understand this is a chinese establishment and service is (generally speaking) lacking (not trying to be racist here, just the way i feel about chinese restaurants, even the somewhat nicer ones; i am a chinese myself), but lately i've been there a few times where the waiters/waitresses wouldn't even seat me, and furthermore i wasn't asked to order and i had to hail one of the waiters to take my order.i also tried a noodle soup bowl, which i was told they are known for.the sushi there is good and their dumplings as well, the only thing that i don't like is when the ladies making the dumplings in the front, eat in front of everyone! other than that this place is great.hing kee is a pretty small restaurant, so it may be challenging to get a table on the weekend during prime dinner hours.what?!.we will not be returning.this is one of our favorite beef noodle soup places.xiao long bao is good but my favorite is the the spicy lamb soup.

Outstanding.delicious food and drink.chips are made in house too.all burger meat comes from local farms (in indiana, i believe), and you can taste the freshness! clark loved the burger that had mushrooms on it.and, i can't even name 183 veggies.for my main, i had the chicken club, with a side of kale and it was great! the portion size was not overly large, which i appreciated.

You will get towed!.their steak tacos are amazing and the lengua are also tasty, but my favorite thing about this place is the barbacoa.just tried pacos taco with coworkers, i started out with the carne asada tacos, the amount of meat they put in these tacos is unreal, it is enough meat for four tacos and they are only $2.i am still in search for a better taco de lengua.yum!.decent (overall pricing).the place is medium sized with all bar stool seating.i would go back every week if i had the chance.take care and enjoy!!!.prices are decent and service is fast!.

Portions are large, and me and my friends always leave stuffed.oy!.shared a red velvet cake that was good.great food, great service, and great ambiance.have tried numerous menu items and loved them all.we asked for one last item on the menu & the wait for it seemed too long.i was in heaven as a chocolate lover.truly the family "dining room".the rye didn't hold up to everything on top of it and needed more toasting or grilling.i went on a monday afternoon and decided i was in the mood for pancakes! it was very busy, so i was seated at the bar area which i didn't prefer, but it would have been a long wait since i was alone.

Service is excellent.being so thin, the pizza was also very light and didn't leave you feeling overly stuffed.though maybe with a bit more lead time.to die for!the food looks amazing, we will be back soon to try it.sono wood fired has very, very delicious pizza.tremendous.

Burger royale is quite tasty and very rich.food is delicious, service attentive.sister two ordered the hash with two eggs over easy that were served over hard.if you get to sit outside its fun in the sun ! we ordered the royale burger and the ham benedict !! it's just perfect ! love the taste ! to add more to our belly we ordered the caramel banana waffle.definitely a top tier restaurant you will not be disappointed.for 8 grilled oysters.the reds by the glass could use a couple more mid priced options but i was happy with what i had.it's somewhere you definitely want to try while in the city! hope you find this helpful and try this place soon! god bless!.

I definitely coming back and will bring friends and family.friendly staff.(at least i had leftovers for another meal.went for the roast pig sunday and it was delicious.this place was delicious.the food was delicious  and served in very large portions.delicious food! beet salad and goulash a must.fantastic euro fare, warm and genuine service punctuated by an engaging owner, there is nothing not to like here.the eggplant dip was amazing! very light and fresh! also has the saganaki, which was lit right in front of me! great atmosphere and food.

While it had been too long, it was great to walk to the back and order a 9" meatball sub this week.most of their grocery are on the expensive side.i love their italian and turkey sub, the bread is hard but quality hearty italian bread.get the italian.this place gets wicked busy for lunch, with a line from the deli counter to the door.prices are solid here as well.5lbs of meatball stuffed in that bread topped with provolone & mariana.i usually end up sitting on the curb outside and making a mess of myself.i used to live in hoboken and became rather spoiled by the italian delis.gross!  this guy kills pet bunnies in his basement and sells the meat in his store.

I have since gone to a number of their pop-up nights and have never been disappointed.a full indonesian meal sounded good, so i called expecting something like takeout, but decided to have the chef on site option for a dinner for 11.now they're doing prix fixe dinner and gamelan for.

It's in the middle of a residential neighborhood, not touristy at all, just "regular people" sort of place.one of my favorite things about bridgeport.about 25 mins for us to be seated.i had homemade baked cavatelli with mozzarella, marinara, and ricotta.homemade baked cavatelli - my guy ate most of it, but i just sampled a little and didn't really care for it.the dish was perfectly tasty and spicy but i was a little disappointed as the pasta was noticeably overcooked.told us everything that was on the menu and they also have about 8 other specials on the chalk board as well.i will definitely be back soon.i wish there were more peas but all in all it was very good, spinach was tender, and dressing was perfect and not overwhelming.i had the meat ravioli.

Beautiful neighborhood shop with excellent handcrafted sandwiches and salads.this is how i could only give andorkas sandwich shop five stars.they even feature matt andorka's famous bagels on the weekend, and you can order any of the sandwiches bagel-style (do it).

Fried cauliflower w/hot sauce instead of aoili was super good.the chicken dish was equally great in its own way, still salty, but chicken cooked to perfection.she and i were walk-ins saturday night early - around 5:25 p.super tender! smoky, flavorful, light, melted in my mouth:)almond cake desert - very good.yes, they're greens, but these cruciferous veggies add substance, and the tropea onions they're cooked with make the dish even heartier..she genuinely cared that the party was perfect and did everything in her power to make sure of it.that dish won me over, but my friends enjoyed their dishes as well.

Our waitress proceeded to open the bottle promptly (no cork fee, no fuss whatsoever.service was top notch all night.asap.we had to ask for an ice bucket for our champagne.there's probably in total seating for up to 40 people inside.very good!the service was excellent.a quick summary of what i had:- "tuna sandwich" amuse-bouche: completely bland and the texture of the bread was between stale and toasted.i first found this place on check please.the professional reviews praise han 202 and its chef.

From the beginning, the staff were very friendly.bang! what a fun meal.pros:- fresh and inexpensive crab and other shellfish- super sweet waitress- fun, bustling atmosphere- byob- homemade popsiclesconstructive criticism:- put salt, pepper, and paper towel on the table - ready to go- give a crab cracker and sheller to each person at the table; we only got one sheller to share and had to ask for a cracker and only got one at the end of the meal- hand lotion in the restrooms - you'll be washing your hands intensely at the end of your meal.the crab pad was delicious! we love to get our cajun seafood fix in and this is definitely the best place to go in the chicago-land area.love.i tried my friend's food too.love that it's byob! they even played all of the cubs games during the post season.

Make sure to put the rice down first, so the oil and salt soak into the rice.we found this place from a new york times article and come often.)  we asked for soup bowls but never got them.visiting from san francisco and found this place after reading about it in the ny times.second time to be here, really love this place! one of my friends is from chongqing, and she said the food is seriously authentic and delicious! just like those you could get on the streets in chongqing or chemgdu.highly recommended, give it a try and check out some of the unique things offered on the menu.but it is completely normal after eating spicy food lol.i lived in china for two and a half years, so i have some idea, and i love this place.the real zigong food is very salty and very spicy.

It was so good, i literally licked the plate clean and wanted more.they do take credit cards.properly cooked, plated with a heavy hand, and a fun adventure to find, oasis shines as part of my weekend in chicago.inexpensive, quick and relatively healthy food including vegetarian offerings for about $7-9 a meal (excluding beverages) and seating is available.76$ with tax and that's a steal deal.the food was amazing, my friend was amazed.the.check it off your list, then try something new.

Definitely will not return.lol wasn't hot enough for steam..ideal if staying at the hilton.if you are willing to wait a long time to be served then go for this, the burger and the beet salad were also good.the oreo mint pie is also great if you're into chocolate/mint dessert.the tortilla soup was tasty as reported by two other folks with me and i feel the same.the food was absolutely delicious!  the thanksgiving dinner consisted of 3 entries for a fix price..the local chicago was perfect; the ambience, the great service from our waitress cooper, and most importantly, the food and drinks.

First time, last time."food trucks in the loop are generally overpriced and overrated.the empanada shrimp are serious business.the steak jibarito sandwich with queso chihuahua is the best, the shrimp empanadas and the platano maduro.the food was good but i hate to say the plantain was soggy and not crunchy, the meat was good with overflowing juices, the rice was ok i've had better.if you have never had puerto rican food then i highly recommend going to the jibarito stop!!!!i love having my lunch from this truck! my fave is the chicken stew "pollo guisado"!i feel i'm in my grandmother kitchen.great food! the steak jibarito is amazing! staff is always friendly and food comes out hot and fast! a great addition to 18th street eateries..acapudia was less greased then other spots which is a plus.and after i said yes and asked him if he know of a good place, he recommended this spot.

Not only was the food divine, the restaurant was clean and cozy.the staff is great and friendly too!!! my favorite place to eat, honestly.we also had a smoothie which was tasty.awesome food!!! really good portion sizes and fair prices! also, the juices are fantastic!!!! i got basmati rice with shrimp and chicken.this place confuses me.a healthy choice for fast food.a guy ordered a crepe and again i didn't see her wash her hands.food came out slower than expected.the best secret that everyone should know about!!this place is one of my favorite places to eat, especially if you want great quality food for a fantastic price! my favorite is the salmon plate and washing it down with a delicious choco-nana peanut butter shake.our group tried several and we liked them all, the sweet ones may be a little better than the salty ones though.

You must dip it in the chili sauce to give it an extra kick.overall, i like the food, and while dumplings are generally not that expensive, these are a bit on the pricier side.my favorite dumpling is pork and cabbage and make sure you get the lamb skewers as well.they're not like the ones my mom makes, that's for sure.i hope to come back here again.i would definitely return and try the other fillings..thank you qing xiang yuan dumplings for a tasty lunch, plus two more.

This place is one of my favorite in chicago.yep, i'm going back.the space is small so i felt bad taking up so much room but it didn't seem to get overly crowded at all.nothing was overpowering, but everything was full of flavor.everything sounded delicious and because there were four of us i got at least a bite of most things.i've been to singapore twice and have had the all star food treatment there.my favorite restaurant in chicago.-byob with no corkage fee!-changing menu with probably about 4 entrees and 2 appetizers listed at a time.

We will get our fried chicken from the roost and from the new place opening up soon in lincoln square.while i've been able to dig their food / brunch.my boyfriend and  i found this place on accident.chicken and waffles are on point.:).edit: they brought back their brisket mac and cheese! you should eat all of it immediately.it was a sizable chunk.it's just the right amount of hot.
Since visiting austin last summer, i've been on a smoked brisket frenzy, and this place sells it by the pound.

I like the vegetarian options.the food here is decent and priced decently, but i'm not planning to go back due to the service.prosfantastic waitress!great burger & friesvery accommodatingneutralfrench toast, but then again, it was complimentary due to our 20 minute waitconstomato soup was a bit too sour20 minute wait time for a party of sixoverall:  yes!  i'd definitely recommend this to a friend.like go home instead of being at work bad) or what, but the six of us couldn't believe how poorly we were treated.the challah bread french toast was a good start and big enough to share.i enjoyed a veggie benedict - the eggs were cooked well, the sauce was yummy and the presentation was nice.went back to bite after a long time and this place as gotten *really* good.i had some great food while in chicago, but this was by far the best!we had the escargot pasta and the beef cheeks/scallops.

The food is good.most importantly, it is quiet, and conducive to reading.good coffee, good service, good wifi, good selection of baked goods.i think i may have had my chocolate quota for the year in one brownie.went here in the am to pick up any fun baked goods to bring to the office.got a panini to go on a wednesday for lunch.i came in for breakfast and had the egg and veggie sandwich which was excellent.the lunch sandwiches are halal.

The only thing i would say needs improvement is the bread that comes with pasta dishes.it is delicious and holds up very well for being delivery pasta! if you feel like a night on the couch with a delicious dish, this is the place to order from!.soooooo good!!! wandered into this place.some of their pasta sauces are a little too creamy for me, but still good.this place sucks.i was introduced to the pasta bowl by my dear friend and fellow yelper caroline t and we were both so glad to stop by for dinner! following her wonderful suggestion we both got the gnocchi aurora with 50% marinara and 50% alfredo.you would never guess how absolutely delicious their food is.i don't know why it's taken me this long to write my favorite pasta place a review.i've never had caprese that way, but it was good.i've never eaten inside the restaurant itself, so i can't speak to the service, but some of the criticism seems to be based on misplaced expectations (e.
Love it!!.that being said, fat johnnies workers need to clean their finger nails.the hotdog, bread, cucumber, and chili were delicious.

Get a cake shake,  it'll change the way you think about shakes.a wonderful tourist trap of a place where the lines are long, the food is good and the staff dont give a rat's ass that you're a tourist and probably think "damn tourists.you'll also get a good amount of food for a great price.all in all, portillo's is good, but nothing is amazing that you have to make a pit stop here.unfortunately i was too full to get a chicago style hot dog but i did get to order the cheese fries which were really good.barnelli's first opened in schaumburg and has additional locations in naperville, vernon hills, glendale heights, niles, summit, crystal lake, chicago and willowbrook, il.

Know before you go that the beet salad is sized more like a side salad than an entree salad..service was poor and food was really average..my nephew a hoppy brew.the chicken hash was dominated by celery flavor.

There are so many other places that i would have rather gone but wanted to try something new.i have on way more than one occasion paid much more for this quality of food..we ordered drinks and three dishes, but i'm sure everything on the menu is jut as great :)the staff is amazing as well.then she said did you have a good brunch in a very condescending way.we were greeted warmly and seated right away.i loved the service, very friendly and professional, and their food was outstanding.instantly asked what brought me out (i was with my gf & were both from out of town.what a waste.

I really love this place: i am a seafood lover and i just can say that the food is so good.i came here to celebrate a friend's birthday on a weeknight, and our party of 6 filled a table, picnic-bench style, with brown kraft paper covering a red-checkered table cloth.i would highly recommend everything our group ordered:- salt & pepper calamari- honeybutter/jalapeno cornbread- shrimp- clams- potato/sausage sides- beignets- deep-fried oreos (yep.and make sure you get the "everything" sauce.if you need to have some southern style seafood, this is the place to go.dana served me both times, and she is absolutely amazing.definitely one of my new favorite places,  plan to come back for my birthday!.

But other than that, glad i'm around the corner from such a nice spot.la mañana was a nice light breakfast of ripe grapefruit, hard boiled egg and a soft, delicious, homemade biscuit.the taco's were amazing and the jambalaya is delicious.this place kills.i went in today and left before even attempting to place an order because of the large party that was seated at the center table (they hadn't even ordered yet), and the five people at the register who were placing to-go orders.i'll definitely be back! so excited that spaces like these are popping up in south side.

The best and 'zheng dian' chinese food i've tasted since i visited states two weeks ago.i definitely enjoyed my first dim sum experience and am already looking forward to coming back!.our waiting time was 30 minutes, not bad considering the large crowd waiting to go in.when the food came, the sauce spilled all over the bag and it was the most salty food i have ever had.we've come here a lot, and each time has been a solid, if not really good, experience.how do i sum this up.but wait.skip it.anywhere.once we ordered our food using the easy-to-use dimsum menu, our food came out quickly and hot! the dim sum items are a little more oily than other restaurants but they tasted great.

Chickens were fluffy and moist, seasoned perfectly and the sides of mac and cheese/cole slaw complemented them perfectly.today was my first experience with gus's and it was a really good one.overall i'd give it 3.the waitstaff are not in a hurry.

Here you will find a wonderful rendition of american style sushi.my boyfriend and i were out downtown shopping and needed somewhere close by to eat for dinner.regardless, wait until i leave before dismantling my table setting.they came out with mochi and a candle in it.really tasty and refreshing.their miso soup is warm and comforting, i love their spicy tuna roll (simple and delicious), their creamy spicy tuna has tempura on it, and is just what it says it is, creamy and fantasticthe delivery time always says 60 minutes online, but i've never waited more than 45, even on busy nights.we will definitely be back for round two soon -best,charlie..our dining experience consisted of miso soup, ginger salad, sushi rolls, some dumplings -- everything was pretty good.some asian beer to wash it down was also nice on this sunday evening.
Service was friendly and attentive.

Didn't even look like on tv..yum yum yum, great food, good drinks and homemade tortillas.i want to thank this establishment for doing a groupon.went here today.the rice and beans were spread thinon a big plate making it look like you were getting a lot.i thought it was hopeless when i remembered where i left it, went outside and saw it was gone.my boyfriend, wary of his order, was pleased to find that the server offered him an appetizer version of the alligator he so desperately wanted to try (and then almost was asphyxiated from because he is allergic to seafood, but that was on him), along with a few steak quesadillas.she told me leave and dont come back and honestly she dont need to tell me because her place,food and service says it for her so if i can rate it with minus stars it takes all -5 stars the radio station rates it a really good restaurant  not la casa de samuel sucks do not eat there!!!!!!.exotic choices.

Aidan was bartending and he was probably the warmest bartender i have ever come across.day.had da duck samich with the macncheese which was so good with beers but gave us very much bad gas.i don't know if its the jukebox or if they're selecting the music, but its always a great eclectic mix.service is always important, as it can make or break an evening.all and all, if you want a place to get good food and drinks and hang out on a patio with some friends, this is where you go.duck grinder was awesome and great draft beer selection.the aberdeen tap has been fawned over and lauded by so many i didn't really believe it was as awesome as they claimed.great atmosphere at this bar.

Everything fine italian dining should be.i don't even want to over discuss this because you need to go to understand the greatness.we had all finished our coffee by the time it made it to the table.it's an old converted gold coast home.definitely coming back and really close to me home!!!.

Cool rotating local artist artwork on wall for sale.they also serve gluten free bread as a toast substitute so that's a big plus.she was slow to arrive, never checked to see if we liked it or anything.food is very good, staff is always pleasant, and it's never so busy that you feel rushed or crowded out.started with a hot hot apple cider.overall, a good experience.

Behind snack planet's unassuming front, a couple and their son are cranking out crispy and aromatic dry chili chicken, perfectly fried fish filets with a spicy-sweet soy sauce, and satisfyingly chewy chili-oil marinated mushrooms.love it! first time to chinatown and they have authentic and delicious flavor of scechuan food.

I currently live in minneapolis, and one should be opening up in the mall of america soon!.that first bite of my burger was everything i imagined it could be.to tell you the truth, if shake shack and in n out did not have this so-called burger rivalry going on, i probably would have had a different perspective of shake shack.i never eat mayo, so the shacksauce is definitely an exception.after a long walk around millennium park i came across shake shack.you tried shake shack chicago, you tried.first tried this place while refectory on vacation in orlando.my partner had the strawberry shake - imagine your typical strawberry shake with the 'strawberry' flavor intensified 100x.wait staff is friendly.the smokeshack burger was delicious (really loved the bun) and the cheesy fries were awesome.

There have been times i had a small $5 salad and liked the service so much i would tip them $10 just because, you do not always get good service.the place has great ambiance.maybe if i ordered this instead, i would have given this place more stars.went here for brunch with a friend thursday morning and loved it!my friend was craving chicken and i was craving waffles, so of course we got the chicken and waffles.on a separate occasion, i ordered the cop out dirty burger ($9, portobello mushroom), which was a pleasant surprise! a friend had chicken nuggets ($8), which were unimpressive.great food and the staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating.wouldn't call it a destination place but nice place to pop into for a bite of you want to avoid long waits and nearby places.

Clean place and not too cliche as far as decor.the chicken kabob, meat platter and falafel were all delish!.all of the food i've had there is very good, but for some reason their falafel is particularly amazing.strong statement, i know! go to menu items include:- the hummus- jerusalem salad- chicken kabob platter (i always sub quinoa), which comes with the best unmentioned pleasant surprise of a ton of deliciously grilled veggies and saladbest tip for ordering: you can add a 'side kabob' to your order, which has everything in the platter version except the salad.hummus, gyro, chicken shawarma, and falafel are all great.overpriced and cheap quality.we ordered the meat combo and the vege.the falafel plate was pretty standard but i really enjoyed the lentil soup.we ordered the gyro w/spicy sauce and fries, it was very good in my opinion.

I cannot wait until i'm in chicago again.lines can be very long on weekends so plan to wait hours if you enjoy that type of torture.also incredibly delicious and extremely filling.i also learned about a nice little no wait app that helped us save a spot in line while we looked for parking! brilliant! i love how chicago is so mobile app-friendly.great breakfast on a sunday am in chicago.i will had we got they at 2:35 not knowing they close at 3.when we arrived we were waved to follow a man, the menus were tossed on the table and we got a "you can sit there" as the guy walked away.
Check this place out!.

)the venison was good; ours unfortunately ended up closer to medium than medium rare, but the preparation with the ramen risotto was comforting.well, a shared dinner is essentially a dinner format where you can choose a bunch of different menu items, and share it! no more ordering two different things on the menu to just take one bite out of it.definitely stop by, but keep the expectations in check.my husband and i went here to celebrate our anniversary and we are so glad that we did.i also had the octopus and salmon for appetizer and found it to be equally blasé.it was off the main floor so it felt like you were eating in your own private room at home.had that squid been really good, this would have been a wonderful dish.this is vegetarian, and if you had quizzed any one of the 4 carnivores at our table - none of us would have known any different.the octopus is phenominal as are the desserts and jackfruit pulled pork.upon entering, i realized that it is a very small space with limited seating, so no large parties allowed.

So don't come in expecting to toss around some plastic.it was worth it in the end.was it worth it.i honestly thought that my taste buds for pizza has reached its peaked many years ago.they were a bit difficult to eat given the texture, and all i can say is that i just don't understand the hype.the entrance was located downstairs.its nice and cozy.filled with classic pizza flavors mixed with more flavors to have a rugged taste.the oven grinders (aka sandwiches) were a bit more run of the mill.

Ate brunch here on sunday.everyone is super nice and attentive.this place is delicious.will be back again!.most breakfast items are on the rich and/or creative side (foie gras french toast!) but there are so many spots even within a few steps of this place where you can get a more conventional breakfast (stella's and the bagel, to start) that it makes sense for this new place to stake out a more creative territory.i know it's reletively new and they are just starting out.the vanilla pancakes were fluffy and i loooooved the thyme butter flavor with the orange zest.the service is awesome, and admittedly, the biscuit really is worth getting.i've come two times so far.i was impressed with their regular breakfast items- best scrambled eggs i have ever had!.

Good bacon, and in generous portions.the place offers a unique selection of food.i wish they would or could add on some type of waiting area and i would be more likely to frequent this place more often.it's a bit small, but very cozy inside, and the staff were all incredible friendly and helpful.we get extra apple sauce for kiddos too.another excellent place for breakfast foods.i had a custom omelet with great bacon on the side and my wife had the amazing cinnamon roll pancakes.

Tortillas are hand made and delicious.such amazing chiquilles! i came here for breakfast on a saturday morning and was blown away by the chiquilles.brought shrimp for my wife, she enjoy it! definitely going back there again.still, highly recommended.try it, you just might like it.
Here are a few highlights that i appreciate about this hidden gem:1.

The fries are disgusting.prices were a bit high but the burgers were well worth it.they fry them extra crispy like i like all my wings and they always withstand the car ride home when i get them to go.there was an incident that occurred here the other day.got the savage burger but swapped mayo for siracha aoli and it was a good decision.now i just need them to deliver to my neighborhood and i will be most happy!.although our wait time was lengthy and our ordering process was slightly frustrating, things started to take a turn for the better when the new owner made an appearance at our table and apologized for the wait.average is 20 mins for a burger.i've been meaning to write a review on burger point, on 19th state, but hadn't gotten around to it.but so slow it will make me not come again.

The owners were also very friendly so i definitely recommend checking this spot out!.as it stands, the food at this place is inexpensive, and it wouldn't hurt them to be a tad more costly.this place is amazing.when we walked in there on a friday night there was surprisingly a lot of families with kids present.first off, it's snugly within the west loop neighborhood a few blocks west of all the trendy restaurants in the meat packing district.it was perfect for 45 people and 10 kids.we got there at 11:15 a.we made reservations for saturday night but upon arriving, realized it's a super casual spot.i've been looking for a place like this since moving here and this is it.great salads and soups, too.

We went the sunday after christmas and only waited about 15 minutes to be seated.the wait for a party of 4 will average about 45 min to an hour on sat.fantastic breakfast with amazing service.packed with people and super busy, our waiter seemed anxious to get our order in, but there were so many options it took us forever to decide.

Our group of 5 came here for dinner monday night and to entertain our out of town friend.love this place.i had the smoked salmon tartrine which was a piece of everything toast with cream cheese smear topped with  greens and salmon in a light vinaigrette.great drinks, good food, lovely service during an early dinner.and as always the food is wonderful.however, when we got there, the waiter seemed surprised but then said the chef would just make me a vegetable plate.friend politely mentioned it to the waitstaff and they said they would take care of it and then offered no compensation or replacement beyond offering us champagne, which we declined due to it being a sunday night.it was cooked perfectly, but it just wasn't as exciting as the menu made it sound.appetizers a bit skimpy for 6, wish our waiter advised us.the salmon was done perfectly, the glaze a perfect additional taste added to the fish.

I thought once i moved to the south, i would have amazing mexican food just steps away from my front door and ultimately become the big girl i'm destined to be.this isn't a 5 star restaurant so don't get bitchy.my favorite place in the world! but as others have mentioned, it has gotten overpriced.the torta bread was light and tasty -- not like the heavy chewy stuff at some places.that really disappointed me.hands down the best al pastor tacos in all of the land!!!!have eaten at three different locations and all have been spot on.horchata is good..the food is great! i love the gorditas here.

The pizza tastes like a plain old cheese pizza.the place was quite busy, but i don't recall any horrible service that time.great beer selection!music wasn't blaring loud.pricey but really tastes like banana bread! so good!.the place was dead and it took forever for the waitress to come by and take our order.nice outdoor patio on the east side of the building.we each took half of the pizza home.had i to do over, i would have gone across the street to the fish place.we stopped here recently when we had tickets at theater wit.

I had steak with fried plantains and garlic sauce.this is where you go for good cuban food.always fresh and hot food accompanied by outstanding service and awesome prices.senor paaaaan! so happy we found this place.my only complaint is that they ran out of 2 signature cuban dishes that we wanted to try (ropa vieja and congri)..

The service was great.the egg rolls were terrible, filled with some sort of disgusting slop.place is clean, service was quick and pleasant.thai food is not authentic.the food is very good despite the central location near michigan ave.we will definitely be back again when visiting chicago.

Went here twice while in chicago and loved it.limited al fresco dining.the atmosphere was chill and welcoming, good wine list.i told the waiter at the end of the meal and he said we should have told him earlier.great food is a must for me when dining out but service & atmosphere make the experience that much better..the hostess seemed a bit flustered and informed us it would take 20 minutes.with a special work project in the south loop this past weekend, i thought it was an opportunity to meet with my handsome son (who works at a river north supper club) for dinner before both of us had to go to work.then my order's were wrong.overall, this place is solid and consistent!.

She was friendly and very helpful.it's much better if you let them toss it rather than take dressing on the side.great chicago style (deep dish) pizza, great salads!.i was never really a fan until my friend took me here.a little while after getting done with the bruchetta, there it was, the moment of truth, our deep dish pizza finally arrived.equally as good cold as it was warm the night before).i recommend this place to everyone staying at the nearby hotels.horrible.now, i am wondering if i will be the victim of credit fraud.

The portions smaller.came for a late lunch.why does this place have any stars? food is a disaster and service is non existent!.we finished off with the chocolate pistachio cake, which was tasty but it was really hard (frozen), wish maybe that could have been slightly more warmer..all in all, a terrible experience.in fact, it wasn't memorable at all.comfortable interior environment, come too early only get breakfast menu.the space is cozy and casual, yet good for a date or dinner with friends.our prosciutto and arugula pizza was filling but more doughy than expected for an italian pizza.

I never eat vegan and this place is wonderful.hands down the best breakfast sandwich you will find in all of chicago.stoked to try out more menu items!.just had the banh mi sandwich with avocado and a side of brussels sprouts.oh, and the brussels sprouts side turned my wife into a lover, not a hater, of that much maligned vegetable.however, because there is such limited seating, we'll likely take out (and take out a lot!).i frequently buy upton's meat substitute products at the grocery store, but had yet to be to the breakroom.

Both are equally delicious.the noodles are on point here not to mention the broth, you can add extra toppings just to make you ramen even more delicious, i personally recommend the half spice ramen along with tasty  drink they call " the pain killer" if you have any doubts go check this place out, but be careful though  , you may fall in love with this place.the place only sits around 15, so of course there was a wait.for a basement ramen shop underneath the green house smoked meats, the soup base was surprisingly more flavorful than i anticipated.nyc where you at?the ramen was amazing and i washed it down with whiskey.i don't get it.the wait time can be long, but the key is to go on a weeknight, and pass the time with a drink upstairs at green st meats.it's one of the darkest broths i've seen and it was on the saltier side, which i actually preferred.thanks for the great service.the food came out fast and the service was good.

Stick with the chicken.people travel from different states just to try the jtm.the messed up several customers orders and even bumped a girl a head of me because a worker wanted her number.the wait is very long.i went between 11:30-12 on a friday and the wait wasn't long.so of course i visited jerk taco man on word of mouth.the flavors of the seasoning mixed with the sauce it's cooked with & cilantro locks in incredible flavor.perfect locale though, it's core customer base values quantity over quality.the steak is delicious and the jerk sauce is so tasty and definitely has some kick to it.here us the chicken taco with less cheese and an extra shell.

I tried their grapefruit negroni and some kind of tequila/lime cocktail, both were fantastic.the funky chicken was more balanced for me.it will not disppoint.their food menu is small, but the taro taco and the short rib bao are quite tasty.when we walked in, we were pleasantly surprised.wait staff was pleasant, knowledgeable, quick, etcc!would recommend this to anyone!!.

It's my new favorite place for dim sum in the city.we ordered the mango tenderloin, string beans and hot n sour soup! the portions are really big so be sure to come prepared to share! the small soups are really big (enough for two) and the main dishes are easily shared by 2-3 people.i like that they add oranges and other citrus fruits to the sauce.the sauce was not i expected.the room was pretty small for 12 people, but we still managed.the great thing about this place is that they close late! i work 10 minutes away from here and sometimes i leave work pretty late.service pretty bad.

They have a new menu, new prices, and new attitude.very good upscale bar food, friendly bartenders and a good location right near the racine blue line stop.my type of amazingness.this is not a traditional fried crab cake." not my bag of lipton; so i probably won't come after patio season is finished.love this place!!make sure vanessa is bar tending she makes the best mixed drinks, i love the wise owl had 3 wise owl's & was only going to have 2.went here for lunch and had a great experience.food- this is my opinion is where there is still some improving to do- but they have come a long way.then we had the chipotle bbq wings.it wasn't too crowded given it was a playoff game for the cubs, which was nice.

Super friendly staff.work is only 5 mins from here- looks like i found my new favorite lunch spot!.i waited.the food is great, feels like authentic cuban.i been here several time and almost every time i've come here i have to wait an extreme long time to get my food even if it's take out.ordered takeout.the food is very good and reasonable priced..for an entree we got bistec de palomilla which comes with white rice and beans and cooked plaintains, a typical cuban dinner.my bistec sandwich was super greasy.

We went to eduardo's for the first time since it has opened and we were quite pleased.i would really recommend the brussels sprout salad and the squid ink pasta (always yummy).my friend ordered the spicy italian sausage pizza and i ordered the black ink linguini.and they feature a seasonal menu.i understand they are a small place, i know i'm going to wait, but she was so rude about telling me this i almost left.the shrimp caesar salad was absolutely fantastic! definitely will be returning.good food, good service, good atmosphere.reviewing for sunday brunch:very intimate little spot in gold coast - indoors could probably seat 25-30 people so i wouldn't recommend this spot for large groups.

We'll definitely go back, and i hope to be adding stars.service can be a little bit hit or miss sometimes, but that's part of it all.we will definitely dine again.i then went and got some very good chicken dish that was amazing (i don't say that often).great natural ginger with kick to it.good sauces but such overcooked meat! our favorite by far was the maffa (peanut butter stew with lamb), with sides of djolof rice and plantains.the yassa fish, the yassa fish, my goodness the yassa fish! i got the red snapper which was wonderfully seasoned and prepared to perfection --crispy skin on the outside and moist and flaky on the inside! the djollof rice, plantain, and salmon patties were great accompaniments.the people i were with had the chicken and the shrimp and said both were phenomenal as well.there is free parking in the back.oh but it was about to get worse.

This was a great blend worthy of being featured as an entree, no doubt.the guacamole was average, very creamy but not memorable.oh, and this is part of what i've been calling the "walk western" path - starting down at challengers comics (or coming off of the 606), hitting margie's or gbd for something sweet, hunting to get a piece of your childhood back at toy de jour, looking for oddities at sideshow gallery, getting dinner at estrella negra before ending up at logan arcade.go to logan arcade for a few hours then cross the street for some of the best mexican food you'll ever have.tamales had delicious masa, pork was okay, spinach and artichoke was also just okay.they run a clean and professional place with some cool paintings on the wall.i ordered the coconut crusted avocado and empanadas sampler they were amazing with very unique flavors.i must say though the location is not the best.small place but have had some excellent empanadas, steak, burritos and more here.they have great food! split the el sol empanadas with a friend and try the la escalera mango salsa enchiladas entree.

From the first tasting, all the way through the final plate was cleared, nick's team was professional and nothing but the best.but this is for me a great location for takeout with easy in-and-out parking.they change their menu weekly, but you can check it on their website.it was nice to relax at home and not have to go out into the cold until the next day.points for flavor, freshness, & house made sauce.i've walked by this place 100 times and finally tried it.we had a turkey sandwich, jambalaya, and the carrot salad.i like the idea of this place -- gourmet food to go that you heat up yourself.not satisfying in the least.

Their quesadillas are huge and absolutely delicious.husbands tacos were great, and i loved my chicken taco salad.bonus was the hottest salsa (green?) was decently hot.al pastor is good.the banana empanadas was delicious.everything else was fantastic..this made me believe that i wouldn't like the nutella version.my favorites are the al pastor tacos and horchata.chilango has taken the win for my new favorite place for mexican food in this area.

The small salad was still huge.i had a very nice salad at beezzee today.great place , a pleasant surprise..if you like fresh juice this is a cheaper route than many other locations.stopped in here for a quick lunch before the cubs game.

My food was cool to warm.don't argue with me just apologize and be more careful next time.when you first sit down you get chips and salsa and soup for free.weekends have love music.so, this is my third or fourth time eating here and i have to say that this place is a bit over hyped.it was a big one 2 and everyone freaked out.the carne asada is always superb.it was opened 50 years ago.

I really like this place! their tacos are excellent and their wait staff and bartender are amazing! i do wish they keep having some specials for tacos, like some new items i mean! i have tried all their tacos and want to keep going back to try some new ones.i note that they progressively got smaller.the flavor of them are incredible.overpriced, limited options, mediocre food.i loved the variety of chips, not typical tortilla fare.the overall bill was kinda pricey but it is definitely a fun place to go on a double date.whatever chips they serve with this starter.the place was empty upon arrival yet it look literally 5-7 minutes to get seated.we had a great time and this experience was the complete opposite of what i had previously experienced.while at dinner here the other night, i kept trying to understand this place's "thing".

We're lifelong loyal customers of epic burger now, and it doesn't hurt that their food is so good!.the burgers here were much better than i expected.their fries were different but good.awesome burgers.great customer service, but just don't want to be pressured into writing a sugar-coated review.they bring the food to your table.i do appreciate the concept, but find epic burger overrated (and overpriced) for a burger..the only thing that keeps it from a 10, is the price in comparison to fatburger (you get a bigger burger for a cheaper price at fatburger.i only eat turkey burgers.

Good beer selection.the corn bread was a joke.believe it or not this is a local haunt of people who like to go out and they live on the streeterville/river north/gold coast area borders.both platters were so awesome - we left feeling stuffed and happy.if there is any question, just ask the bartenders who are really knowledgeable and want to help find the right drink for you.they do however give an insane amount of fries which took me awhile to finish.nothing tops off texan bbq but this place rocked my world tonight! the barbecue is nice and smoked to perfection! as i forked it, the meat was so tender, juicy and the barbecue sauce is very tasty.there are much better options in this city.just went randomly to this place after i realized that the giordano's nearby way too crowded.

Even some salt and pepper couldn't salvage the lack of flavor.there was a large chunk of oily fat on the pork.for a drink i ordered the chenin blanc from south africa (obviously because i'm partial to south african wines.they bring the dish to the table and carve it in front of you.service is great, drink menu is great, food is out of this world.thank you for our night out in chicago, we will definitely come back and hope to be able to enjoy the city view.we started off with the trio of toasts, which has a toast with avocado, one with bacon foie gras and another one (can't remember now)! i've never had foie gras that i didn't like, but my favorite was the avocado and i still wasn't overly impressed.it was absolutely divine.

Had the rib tips for lunch a few days ago and was thoroughly impressed.wish that i could have gotten more fries, but who cares when you've got leon's rib tips.loved this place and their hot links.the fries didn't seem that crispy but when lathered with the bbq sauce from the ribs, i didn't really give a damn.unfortunately, the original owner sold his product for unknown reasons but he had a gold mine!!!  the sauce is the best and should be marketed.both came with fries that were just as tasty.

Podhalanka is like sitting down in somebody's polish kitchen and having dinner.i grew up eating and cooking polish food but my colleague did not.they do not serve liqour but feel free to bring your own.09/15 - this place is awesome.i felt like my aunt agnieszka was cooking--just for me!.the guy behind the counter was super pushy and tried to serve me and my friend things we hadn't ordered even after i ordered.it's not a fancy place, but the food is inexpensive, plentiful, and homestyle, served by little polish women.i think this place is kid-friendly and it was a fun meal.don't let them pick the food for you! expensive and not worth getting.you can see the employees (who i am assuming are also the owners) take pride in their restaurant.

It is a nice, small restaurant with killer doner ( you probably know it as gyro).com.i gave it a chance since i was hungry and by the area.i stopped in and tried their combination plate.thank you for wasting our time.will definitely be one of our regular go to spots.they're not the best i've ever had, but they do the trick for $8! the portions are huge, so you really do get a good value for your money.good super sweet dessert.

I accidentally forgot to ask if my soup was shellfish-free.we agree the soft shell crab roll as appetizer.joy yee seems to be really popular.(3) some of their appetizers are pretty good- i'm a fan of the fried shrimp shumai.the bubble drink is 5 stars, i love the bubble durian avocado so much though honey dew green tea is good toothe food taste mediocre for asian food  that is why i gave 3 stars only.joyee's drinks are fresh, tasty, and fairly quickly made.not only that, but they have a vast array of helpful suggestions on what you might like to order that includes pictures! definitely helpful for the indecisive or bubble tea newbie.love the drinks! triple berry freeze with leechy popping boba is my fave.it's located inside chicago's chinatown square mall and the business is supposedly the first to sell bubble tea in the midwest.i used to like them because their quality was great but its gone down hill lately.

My advice - skip the meal, order dessert, and hang out at the bar for a pick me up atmosphere on a drizzly day.since my first review 2 years ago, i've been back to summer house many, many times.had the steak frites the last time i was there - it was a great choice!.but it is just awful.the french fries also are made mcdonald's style (thin, crispy, and salty) which was a plus!nice ambiance, prices were reasonable, no complaints on service.the service is generally very efficient and that's how i would describe this place efficiently run.the space is beautiful and bright --i have been to santa monica and i really did feel like this place captured that vibe.the quality was fine but it wasn't like the greatest thing i've ever eaten before.as for the food, it tastes relatively healthy.

Love the drinks and the cool unique tiki glass you get the cocktails in.quintessential tiki.holy crap my drink was strong! i ordered the signature "three dots and a dash" drink, girlfriend ordered the painkiller no347d.)it is a little difficult to find if you don't know what you're looking for.

Great late night service, excellent food & super fast turnaround from ordering to food delivery..maybe you have to dine in for a better experience? on the positive side, the delivery guy was really nice.was up late and hungry and this was the only spot opened in bridgeport.i love all the noodle dishes they have and my all time favorite dish from here would be the kbbq short ribs.right when i walked in i was skeptical already.compare it to the previous pictures and you ll see that they barely put any cheese any more..must try the kim chi fries or get combo c!.

This is one of the one places that i will continually revisit in the city.will definitely go back next time we are in the neighborhood.hummus was ok..baklava was very good too.i consider myself a falafel fanatic and let me say this is one of the best places for it!every time i've been in the staff has been exceptionally kind to me.his aversion to smiling is bearable when he's surrounded by such warm and friendly people, not to mention he's nice to look at.definitely stopping by again.great falafel! and the spinach pie had a nice light dough that wasn't super heavy.

Truffle parmesan fries are the real deal.the burger was dipped with buffalo sauce and had a few surprises on it! the food is amazing!.we waited maybe 10 minutes for our food.a little too dark inside and music was so loud that we weren't able to hear our waitress.it was basically a total waste, as they were soggy and gross.i only order sweet potato fries here because no other place compares.great beer and burger combinations that made me feel like i was back home in southern california.dmk burger is definitely in my top 10 burger joints.you'll likely use the spoon for most of it, but it was tasty down to the bottom.this turkey burger right here make me want to go steal all the turkeys everywhere and bring them to dmk because they know how to make'em!dreamsicle shake and sweet potatoe fries are equally delicious!sorry you beef lovers, i love turkey!.

The other thing you should know about this place is that it's worth the wait.whether you're hungry for a hearty meal or ordering a bottle of wine for the night, the artisan cellar is the place to turn!.i was a little disappointed that there weren't any poultry panini.how on earth will i even be able to pass by artisan on the way upstairs? i have absolutely no idea whatsoever!i'm just so very happy about this new discovery.if you're in the merchandise mart looking for coffee definitely skip past starbucks and argo tea and hit this spot up.this is the best place you can find in merch mart!be sure to order their daily salad special and their paninis!also, the wine selection is stellar.plus, they acknowledged the wait and apologized which left me with the impression that this isn't the usual deal.however, i blame artisan for the fact that when i want a warm soup for lunch, i have to go to crappy au bon pain to get a bowl of  "step above campbells" glop.a selection of well-prepared paninis made-to-order served on a fine thick bread.tip: wine tasting every friday starting at 4pm.

This was paired with pacifico beer (a very light amber ale which was the recommendation but of course you are allowed to pair it with whatever you please) and my chilled bourbon.absolutely blown away! the service was the fastest and most polite i've ever had.all were great.i think the food is amazing as well.the food is a little more expensive, but it is organic, grass fed, and vegetarian.i was in heaven! could not highly recommend this place anymore!..
Might have a new favorite 'falafel' place in chicago!the combo box (chicken, steak and falafel + rice/salad + whatever veggies you want) clocks in at $10.

Why didn't i discover this place sooner? we tried the crispy shrimp and spicy ahi tuna tacos.the side order of beans were a surprise hit, too.overall: 2/5.the avocado tacos weren't for me but the others were just as delicious as i remembered.solid place.all of the tacos looked amazing but tasted average with the exception of the cod taco, that one was delicious!.i really liked the tuna.so, i ordered the mahi mahi bowl and the blueberry margarita.
