This is one of my husband and mines' favorite place to eat.there is this special sauce that comes with their   complimentary bread that is delicious and their table olive oil is fruity and amazing.my ossobuco fell off the bone.went for the first time this weekend and definitely will go back.just tired of mediocre lunches.yuckover $70 completely wasted.i called when the order was 30 min late - terrible customer service.they also served fresh sesame  bread which was baked to perfection! it had a crisp outer layer and a very soft center.where i knew the dining experience was going to be top was with the diver sea scallops served with lettuce leaves shaped to hold mini tomato salads and situated atop dollops of creamed avocado wasabi.we decided to go for a walk since it was one of the first, beautiful days of the year in chicago.

That's not saying this place is expensive by any means.my cousin and i shared the duck in a jar and the beef tartare, both of which were utterly delicious.pretty stellar.hoping for more vegetarian and approachable options when i go for dinner.the sum of all years was delicious, with the jalapeno giving it a bit of a kick.i wanted to try one of their house cocktails"young at heart" but they didn't have enough ingredient to make it so i had to try something else.we stopped here today and had brunch and it was fantastic.great menu and i love any place that has the balls to put spam on the menu!!service was a 5 star experiencemenu was a 5 star ratingfood was a 5 star execution.not that anyone made it awkward, i just felt a little weird bcs i stuck out like a true tourist.

I've been to many pho places in chicago, hands down this is the best one!the online ordering was super easy.the concept mimics chipotle, you go down the line adding whatever you wanted to your initial noodle and meat selection.the place was very clean, and i liked the modern decor, but the food was not on point.simple.i'm usually out to eat if i am in a rush, this is pretty much the chipotle of vietmanese but way better.i was also full after the meal, which is always a plus.can't really compare to pho restaurants.my first pho! i loved that they had so many broth and topping options.i am very impressed with their beef broth- more flavorful than a few authentic vietnamese restaurants i've been to.bless these brothers for providing hot noodle soup on a cold windy chicago day.

I plan to return and hang out here at night too to feel out the vibe.honestly it is everything i want in a coffee shop- roomy, chill, and not that expensive.check it out,  nice ambience, maybe you'll like it,  a lot of people do for some reason.loved this space as i used to leave nearby and would go there to work.the staff was nice and never gave us weird looks for bringing in the strollers and kids.because i am a frequent customer, i can speak to the consistently delicious food and drink.so i will be back and often!.i had the bagel with lox.

Turns out that was a mistake because the waffle was pretty filling and the honey toast was too sweet.i am very impress with this place.they took one bite and said it was too spicy even though it doesn't say it on the menu.i greatly enjoyed the atmosphere and decor.i would rather get my coffee from starbucks for that price.great atmosphere and their green tea vanilla panna cotta is to die for.this place was only ok to me, the crepes were good same with the desserts but the tiramisu in the lil jars were pricey, i can probably get more at a italitan restaurant, but you're probably paying for how cute it looks, and it definitely looks cute.the cafe was not crowded and had great music playing in the background.there're more things to try.how come it happened?! how long was all those pudding stay there?! never back!.

Bf absolutely love this place.probably wouldn't visit this establishment again.my fault since i built it, right ;)the guys here are super nice and i'd definitely order again.will be back soon!.not the case here.but this is amazing.great food, great service, a little pricey, but they are mostly organic and free range so the higher price point is forgivable for healthy fare.i love that!! chicago's a big city & with that they must be hiring city people at this location so i understand why i don't feel the same homey/ suburban warm vibe as the des plaines, but i do hope they catch on and put more heart into this city location!.i actually give them 1 star, but i realize that by showing five stars more people are inclined to read this.

Very busy place, but good food!  i just hate the intersection (63rd and cottage grove)--not the safest part of town.this place has the best french toast and fried chicken wings omg!!!itand they offer flavored creamers with your coffee.it has consistently great food;  the soup is more than great.food was excellent, i had the chicken and waffles.the woman who served me was so nice, i really liked it.it was scrumptious.87.what i wanted to eat i had seenon the way in.the biscuits are large & fluffy & yummy!keep up the great work.

It also provides takeout, which we will be taking full advantage of when we need to get our pizza on, but want something lighter than the heavy chicago-styles.we ordered a salad but they forgot the chicken even though we paid extra.this is some of the best pizza and ice cream i have had in the city.
You have to try the fries.

I had their old fashioned which was expertly balanced and exactly what i was looking for.just stopped in for a few beers.delicious vegan friendly cauliflower steak everyone should try! amazing service in a relaxed atmosphere.it's good food and drink, without any of the pretense.one of my favorite bars in the city.love this place! great cocktails at amazing prices (for chicago).very laid back place with tons of quality liquor to choose from and lots of different foods to try.the wait is not long and the place is never too packed.we ate at the bar and had wonderful service and the food was delicious and served quickly so we could make our movie time.

Our server checked in on us often, making sure that we had everything that we needed and that our drinks were replenished.our server, tom, was very attentive to our group, and the burgers, salads and drinks were high quality and reasonably priced.i got the eggs benedict and it was pretty awesome.no matter what you order, everything is good.great ambience outside by the river.it is great place to people watch and watch the boats in the river.

Also, the bathrooms are tiny, but clean.they sold me a plate of the absolute worst risotto i have ever had.the food here is excellent.my entire party talked about coming back soon and we hadn't even paid the check yet! highly recommend!.veal parm, baked claims, meatballs it's all good.such amazing and authentic italian food!  this is probably the best and most authentic italian restaurant that i've tried in the city.i go here a lot this is truly my secound family.i loved the caprese salad and the garlic shrimp! so delicious! huge portions and good service from the busboys to the waiters.or, great to go with a group.that's really the only negative i can give to bacchanalia as this classic, old neighborhood italian eatery, that i would be willing to bet most members of the chicago mob likely have come to at least once, really delivers old and new world recipes at a reasonable price.

I especially like the gobi manchurian for an appetizer.i'm a big fan of chicken 65 and their version here is fantastic.i went with my sister recently and we both loved what we had.i primarily only go out to eat my indian food on devon avenue- glad to have a closer excellent option - we had a big group and everyone thought the place was top notch.i love spicy food, and this place satisfies my love for hot tantalizing dishes.i had the food delivered by caviar and the prices were reasonable.if you like spicy and hot, then this should be your go to indian restaurant.it's been an hour and a half and when we try calling no answer.the food is delicious and the decor is gorgeous.great conversation, great food and since it's byob the bill comes and you are just shocked and thrilled at how inexpensive it is! we got about 12-16 diff dishes for 8 people and shared it all and it was a perfect amount! we will for sure be back!.

The ladies were super nice also--my phone wa running out of battery and they totally pointed me out a a spot with outlets (from experience, i'm sure.talk about cold weather hardcore! after seeing someone get a chicago-style hot dog i ordered that (although you can also go all boring and plain if you want) and i was happy to see they also had a few candy bars.awesome hot dog stand!! we walked all over the city and couldn't find one.i came here for a quick tuesday lunch while wandering between the aquarium and the field museum.we loved how easy it was to find outside the aquarium & most importantly that they had veg options!!!! we enjoyed our dogs by the lake.5 stars.poppy seed bun, mustard, onions, tomato, hot pepper, pickle and celery salt.great deal!  so happy we did this!.i never thought a "chicago dog" would be any good  - the toppings didn't look like they made any sense together.easy to find, next to the field museum.

Terrible customer service.i love the fact that the kitchen is right there.i wanted a chile relleno but wasn't sure how that would settle for the rest of the afternoon sitting in the jury room (boring).absolutely loved the food there!..vegans, lactose-intolerants, and cholesterol-watchers may want to note that one of the flour tortillas has butter in it, so read those labels.both were delicious, will definitely make it a point to stop in next time i'm in the area!.i love the el milagro on blue island ave.even after moving to the suburbs we have lovingly returned over and over again.the slight trek makes it more special.

Service is usually very quick (less than 10 minutes).a great find! the 4.very rich and decadent, but not overly sweet (kind of had that dark chocolate bitterness helping control the sweetness).the prosciutto is strictly italian which, you can taste when it melts in your mouth -!i drove in rush hour traffic downtown to pick one up and bring it home to my (very appreciative) husband!-their iced coffees are also ridiculous!*forgot, i've had their fruit and granola bowl as well, pic attached! a piece of art!the owner of this place adds even more charm to an already incredibly charming place!highly recommend this little spot!.excellent presentation and the food is high quality.always get the daily special, especially the lasagna.had the tomato cream soup [of the day] and it was hella good! also ordered the strawberry crepe, good but a little too dry.quality food at a great price.the oatmeal was good, served with strawberries and blueberries also.

I got the crab rangoon (delicious!) and the pad thai.love kate's kitchen and keep coming back for more!.all dishes are excellent.they have done a good job recreating the space, with lots of reclaimed wood and a nice sitting area in the front.service was quick, and the atmosphere welcoming.i'm not a connoisseur on thai food but i think this place is good cheap and tasty.

Co/beleafdtake 20% off your next order before may 19,,transaction amount$5.such amazing fresh salads! i tried it out with a groupon and i have continued to go back.the fiesta fresca mexican salad was really fresh and tasty- highly recommend if you want a made to order salad.can't wait to try the squash the beet!.while i did have a few good salads from there, it's just not worth the risk of going again and having to throw out a $9 lunch.wish there were as many of these as there are starbucks.very disappointed, i think the high ratings must come from the fun salad topper choices.always fresh and good.the customer service sucks.so it was with great hope that i tried out be leaf.

Absolutely loved this place!! the jerk chicken is heaven, had no idea how they seasoned the chicken, but the spiciness has infiltrated to the bone, too tasty it is beyond word, you have to try to believe!no wonder it is the number 1 carribean place in chicago.this cusine is just downright delicious! i had the stewed chicken and the stewed beans and rice with steamed cabbage.this is truly a family owned very friendly and inviting restaurant.jerk chicken.i would highly recommend this place.aside from the fact that i don't eat dark meat, their meat has not been well seasoned either time i had their food.sweet potato cake and butter cake with dulce de leche.the server even memorized our order and it was 6 of us, with very different meals.

The burger, on the other hand, was excellent.date night with the wife was finger licking good! some restaurants have great service, others with great food and others you rave about the space.sure we walked in with great expectations knowing this is one of the better restaurants in chicago.we both opted for the smaller 5 course and it was plenty of food.)we had a groupon for the summer menu, but were treated like royalty.not so american but very european in scope; eat to enjoy not to burst!outstanding service, worked with dietary restrictions, great drinks, too.

Their food is delicious.we're not big eaters either and we were not satisfy there.we started with the assorted artisanal breads, which was a nice starter with the wine.came here for my mom and my boyfriends mom birthday, made reservations and staff were wonderful.we were celebrating a friends birthday inside and had to resist the temptation to crash some special event happening on the patio that beautiful summer day.i would've come back to bin 36, but i just can't get behind the mean customer service.the blue bay mussels and rohan duck are unbelievable.) have an attention to detail that you just don't see in a lot of restaurants these days.will be back!.

-pricey, but worth it.its a great date spot and i think would impress in an understated less flashy way.bavette's i wanted to like you so badly.excellent service from our waiter.friendly and warm atmosphere upon arrival.i'm glad i did.to finish off our meal, benjamin gave us a complimentary chocolate cream pie in lieu of our anniversary.the booths have the absolute comfiest seats.in terms of sides, we tried the broccoli, brussels sprouts, mashed potatoes (also like the ones at gilt and maudes.dim lighting, soft music and lots of wood furniture with chandeliers make you think you're in a rat pack movie.

In a vegetarian's perspective some might not think there are very many options but that's ok because the grilled cheese is on point.it was priced well too.don't miss out on truffle fries either! these guys got a real sandwich master on board.the fries have been less consistent, but when they are "on" they are really great.everything tastes fresh and was like it had just come off the food truck, and now i know i can order a sandwich or two for later if i want..the spicy sesame fries are a great side too.although doesn't have any meat in it, the flavors are astounding and is probably one of the best grilled cheese's i've had.

Not a 3 people dish.the standouts were the tempura avocado, and the 1/2 lb skewered shrimp.they recommend sharing and the plates are on the larger side of tapas portions, so you can try a number of things.by far one of the better, well observed menus i've seen in chicago.ceviche ($14): best ceviche i have had in a long while and as good as tantas ceviche..the place is small, well designed, warm and inviting.the ensemble of belgian endive matchsticks, radicchio, quince segments, blue cheese and a showering of chopped pistachios is fantastic, but you have to enjoy bitter flavors to like this salad.been wanting to eat here for over a year and finally made it! small, intimate and cozy space.overall, i liked mfk.

Stopped in right at closing and they sat us for dinner.could not ask for anything more and would certainly say 312 is on the top of my "go to" list! perfect evening.i would love to go back.would i return? probably not.it was awesome.i was tempted by the bellinis but had been drinking enough the previous few days that i decide to give the liver a rest and went for a cup of hot chocolate instead.eric was so pleasant and took our order right away.i was really looking forward to my dinner, but i threw it out.if you ever call and get jasmine, hang up and call back.awesome food, great restaurant.

Whaaat this place is so good.being  ukrainian, i always go for the crepes, which never disappoint.i got the potato pierogi with onions and bacon (these additions are a must do, trust me).i don't remember exactly but that was somewhere in the $12 range; their menu ranged from $8 sandwiches (which looked great! and came with a couple of sides) if you want to spend less money to far more expensive duck dishes if you want to go all out.highly recommended for anyone who wants to try some traditional, authentic ukrainian food!.finally, i found the place where i can eat great food.they have just the right proportion of rice and meat, and are served with a subtle, yet flavorful tomato sauce that is just perfect.order something off the daily specials list.nice place to visit without anything to aspect.

I started with the nachos before and they are definitely for sharing.their eggs benedict is very nice, and i'm a stickler for eggs benedict.i was disappointed to see that they took the seafood salad off their menu.my server, albeit a nice polite guy, wasn't observant to the situation.the best place to eat in chicago!  we have been in town for 4 days and we wished we had found this place sooner!  the sushi was to die for!  and it was half price from 3pm-6pm.1.we held my son's wedding rehearsal dinner at "sub 51" recently, and allie and heather were absolutely marvelous in all the help they provided.paired with bloody mary's and grey goose greyhounds, we left very satisfied.

We ordered fried rice and it seemed like we were having rice cooked in sugar syrup.good place for a casual lunch.it must be the sauce they use, but it is soooooo good!!! plus u get a free fried rice if u check in on yelp.they certainly sound appetizing, but i'll be sure to eat before i arrive.i just had some of mak's food catered to my workplace.i can most certainly say that i will never be returning to eat at this restaurant again.really fatty, not spicy at all even drenched in hot sauce.curious about the place, we came here on a friday and tried some dishes.i could buy at least a pound of (organic) veggies with four dollars.

Will.absolutely great place a bit off the beaten trail of logan square's hipster district.this place is sure to hold down the pr cuisine representation in logan square for years to come.this is a great place to bring vegetarians, as they have lots of veg options on the menu.also, the flan is flantasticthe service here is great, and chef yari is the best!.go eat there! i'm going back for their brunch as soon as i can!.so affordable and delicious.

Eat it with chipotle mayo.this is definitely not the best seafood restaurant in chicago.i'd definitely come back here.good price and great service.otherwise, one star all the way.my favorite dish is la charolada and the camarones la palapa.we went on a saturday and to our surprise we were treated to a mariachi band.maybe we tried it on a bad day.his bank's fraud department is now involved.it won't be much fun.

Everything tasted great.with great service, sweet location, and best chinese food ever this is a must while in chicago!  my top choices are the egg drop soup, orange chicken, & bok choy and all get a 10 of 10.decor is better since the remodel.we ordered the chicken skewers(very dry no sauce),  broccoli chicken in white sauce which was pretty good and of course the special lobster, yum yum but very messy to eat!! the service was quick, waitstaff polite.given the good reviews and single dollar sign on yelp, we decided to get dinner here after surveying the plethora of options in chinatown.fried baby octopus and crab ragoons are just a few of the many great dishes they serve:).it was quick and yummy; i'd go again =)my 3 stars comes to play b/c they didn't have enough cans of pop to serve my table.i will be back for dinner!.if youre driving through china town one day, whether youre alone or with a group of people, and just flat out hungry, come give this place a visit.and pea sprouts are my favorite veggie, which they sauteed with garlic to perfection.

I was delighted to find this new spot just blocks from my house.i absolutely love this place.mediocre, nothing bad to say besides you have to pay for rice.hands down best thai food the east side of pilsen ever did see!!!it's a small corner joint perfect for take out with a couple tables out front.carry out portions are generous which is a plus, and food is ready to go shortly after you order.all the entrees were excellent with the perfect combo of sweet and spicy.the panang curry and pad kee mao deserve special mention.i will definitely make the trip to taylor street over this joint next time.not a sit down place so i pick up but even then the staff finds a way to be super nice.

I had the lake superior whitefish.on the bright side the jazz trio in the bar atrium is a must enjoy moment much preferred to the noisy dining room, even if it is for a simple glass of wine.sheila was fantastic.desert was good, i was expecting hot melting hazelnut but it was solid.

Phenomenal waffles and chilaquiles! this place is so quaint and accommodating.great food and great service! it is a small restaurant and the outside is a bit deceiving but it's worth the try! our server was super duper cool, the food didn't drag to come out the kitchen and i even saw the chef interact with some guests.the food is beyond delicious.overall good experience and i will be back again! this place is also byob!!.i will definitely go back.as soon as we walked in, we felt at home.keep up the good work.i give them 5 stars.you have to try the milkshakes and smoothies!.

After the game was over the had some nice music playing.great sports bar.service and atmosphere were great, our waitress had her hands full and still took really good care of us.we split the french onion burger and the nachos both were just great, but the french onion burger was just decadent.drink specials were less than special, and the girls working there seemed to be upset with us for reasons we couldn't figure out.if you are not a regular then you kind of feel like an outsider..trivia night on tuesdays are the best! but really i go for the $2 tacos.we had three different sliders and a grilled chicken pita sandwich: the sliders were described by my girlfriend as 'gross' and we spotted a small spot of mold on one of the buns (which they of course replaced) and the ingredients in my chicken pita tasted stale in addition to the sandwich as a whole being quite boring.good chill spot to have beer watch the game and listen to hip hop.
I highly recommend the carne asada tacos and orange salsa.if you are going to have a restaurant feel - fuggedaboutit.

Food looked and tasted so good.i've been here twice second time was for my best friends birthday great food !  the short rib & squash are my favorite.inside atmosphere is laid back and cool.they brought out the one tamal and four orders of churros and we enjoyed the desserts.we have eaten here several times, most recently last friday..w o wafter hearing from a co-worker that service was good, i decided to go back and give it another try.i loved the tacos!  the tortillas were hand-made, the ingredients tasted fresh, and the flavors were delicious.my boyfriend had the braised short rib rice bowl which he couldn't stop raving about.awesome environment the best part that they are byobeverything was delicious i had the sopes they were ok i think the meat can use more seasoning.

The owner is awesome and the staff rocks.the food was great, however, i ordered gluten free pasta (which was good), however, i was not informed that there was an additional charge for it, nor was it noted online or in their carry-out menu.we managed but it would have been nice if there was a bit more room to spread about.he insisted we try the meatball salad and ordered one for us on the house.meatballs make the world a better place.the cheesecake with chocolate ganache on top was the best i have ever had..good thing for the servers, but bad for customers is that they don't allow separate checks and only allow 1 bill per table.they start out with roasted sweet peppers on the table, they almost tasted like the sweet peppers you would have on an italian beef sandwich.we came in two days in a row.

Don't bother ordering anything from the "house specialties" section of the menu.also, it's basically a sports bar with plenty of tv's to catch up sports, as well as having a fireplace to stay warm in the winter.if you want a beer and a game, this is a solid place to go, but if you don't, walk up to halstead for greek or randolf for more foodie delights.the only reason i'm giving it a 2 is because we never even got to order, we had to call to order, and the guy was kinda rude and the place was so loud they couldn't hear our order and hung up.service was very good.coat hooks: yesalso, one of the best bartenders i've met in a good long while.i hade a beer blend called the apple berry, and i loved it, being a person that doesn't like the taste of beer it was perfect for me.cheers!.i wanted to get some vegetables in so i ordered the hummus with vegetables and pita.terrible service, and thats irrespective of wether you dine in or if you are unfortunate enough to spend 2-3 minutes of your life over the phone with one of the employees.

To start, we ordered the house-made focaccia which sounds fantastic.i ordered the belgium waffle.this restaurant, situated in the middle of boystown, is great for a special occasion or for when you just want to pamper yourself with some tasty, original and interesting food paired with a great selection of alcoholic beverages.you can't go wrong with wood! plus the servers were nice enough to charge my phone and bring it back to me (i need my phone to communicate with clients so it was my bad for forgetting my external charger!).it was 20 below today (wind chill) and the sausage gravy sounded like it would hit the spot.my only regard is for the price.best mixology in lakeview - and the food is great.these dishes marked the turning point in our opinion of the restaurant.the breading was flavorful and the chicken was expertly prepared - crunchy on the outside and juicy on the inside! i will definitely be returning to wood!.it was loaded with flavor, and just an outstanding winter dish.

It was a bright blue sky winter afternoon with zero degree temps.great food and service at a very reasonable price.literally managed by a bench of kids with no idea how to deal with costumers! after 40 minutes waiting to be seated i gave up.since then service has improved tremendously and if you haven't had nando's then definitely check it out - the smashed peas are quite tasty and although they've dumbed down the spice for the american market, definitely order your choice of chicken pieces and dip your toe in the peri peri chicken pool.i had the nandoca's choice with medium sauce (i'll go with hot or super hot next time) and the peri chips with perinaise.hats off to these guys.that's like if i make fudge brownies and when you eat them they taste like strawberries.

Terribly slow service even if you order something that shouldn't take time to prep (such as granola and yogurt).both were good.while it's on the whole a welcome addition to the neighborhood the sad fact is that plein air does not know how to make coffee.don't come here unless it's like 3 pm and your parents are paying and you want to talk about hillary or eugenics.so if you want to kill half an hour ordering a great cup of coffee, go for it!.i was disappointed in the two baked goods i've had so far.would love to try everything on the menu! next to the u of chi seminary bookstore and     adjacent the historic robie house.the coffee and espresso drinks are not bad, the treats are generally very good - blueberry danishes, various poundcakes, delicious biscuits with butter and jam.overall, great space and great food!.if it's nice, though, try to get a table outside- it's really peaceful and you have a great view of the side of the robie house.

It's the front-of-house that needs improvement.the burger was good, the scallop entré gave you 3 scallops with nothing else.it's tiny, but well spaced.didn't love the vegetable fritter so would probably pass on that.very cute restaurant with an awesome waitstaff! we sat in the upstairs dining room with a homey feel to it.i'm glad to have this in the neighborhood, so i'd come back to try other dishes.the glass cups for water were cute with a design that reads "au mineral".it also tasted very grassy to most of our family.the cleanliness is the most important thing to a restaurant, i cannot believe what i experienced today, it's the worst thing i ever had in all my dinning experiences.

Until then, i have to un-bookmark this place, and find a new go-to place for my green curry chicken.okay.the smoothies were good as always though.they have an abundance of beverage choices.i'm craving some now just writing about it haha.i would never eat here again, but the smoothies and bubble tea is pretty redeeming.my table ordered the basil tofu chow fun and the mongolian beef.the main attraction always for me is the mango fruit freeze with tapioca balls.good portions overall for the price.

The best thing about this place is the people, there are customers that have been regular for many many years and the workers are so nice and funny, even if they are sooo crazy busy.all are truly fantastic.breakfast - i love the breakfast quesadilla..i recently tried the catfish my bf ordered and it was breaded and seasoned to perfection.joyous breakfast for dinner.service and food are both very good.i was treated like dirt and asked to stand in the corner by the bar, only the.i love this place and i sincerely hope that all of you support local business that have the same type of integrity and pride about their product as stella's does.in true breakfast-for-dinner fashion, i also ordered a salted caramel pretzel shake for dessert.

But they close so early on weeknights, make sure you call to see if they are open.my wife and i are downtown renewing my passport and getting one for our son.said burger finally came.server hard to find and not attentive.

The penne vodka was pretty good, though.labriola disappointed.the omelette was decent- i do wish they had avocado as a topping.just great.we look forward to trying them again.we asked on the phone if it was to bring a baby and we were greeted with "absolutely!".great food and service.they forgot about our side dish, did not know all the vegetarian dishes, and some of the prices were unreasonable.it's a cafe in one part and a full service restaurant in another.he is down to earth and is passionate with his brand.

It was okay.the ciopinno was way more than i could handle so my hubby helped me finish  it.he is a gem!!! i recommend the arctic char - 10 out of 10!.it was fish.being big seafood fans, we struggled choosing one dish each.pricing is still pretty high for a restaurant without table cloths.wish we lived closer!.we split the bill and my boyfriend and my meals (with alcoholic beverages) was $100..a quick bath and a teaspoon of baking soda helped.

I decided to have brunch here.sweet potato fries were fantastic.i took my friends here for lunch on new year's eve.the menu was sort of confusing, because they have breakfast scrambles and burgers all named 'number one,' 'number two,' and 'number three.i want it to be a 25 degrees burger.
If you like cajun food, you don't have to go far as this is a great neighborhood gem.the people are nice but the food is simply not good.i went to this place off of rating and it lives up to it.

Quite a wait, yet it's made to order so worth it.i don't care that it's noon.she took my feedback to heart and is using it to revamp their processes to ensure that what happened to me doesn't happen again.get rid of your third party car service..i will be back, for breakfast too!..i've gone back 3 or 4 times since then because everyone was very sweet and understanding about the situation, and the food speaks for itself! summer at the front counter is so nice, very efficient, and excellent at her job!.

The prices are reasonable.don't think i would go back to try something different.i am barely able to eat two tacos - and end up being stuffed!yes, it's a very unassuming hole in the wall, but who cares? the food is outstanding - unlike some very mediocre, highly overpriced "go there to be seen" tacos places in bucktown/wicker park.nice little place.

We were in and out in 45 min to an hour.we got a pound each of shrimp, mussels, and king crab legs.although, they were nice enough to give us a bucket of ice.maybe we got a bad batch but we were hungry so we kept eating.this is a review for pick up- we had good experience until recently.a very fun experience worth doing.we were once out of the raspberry tea and were waiting for the re-fills to come by.byob is nice too.two hour waiting in the line and the place is tiny.all of these are heavily drenched in the sauces, which the sauces really stand out with their flavors.

This works for me.the dining room isn't particularly fancy but it's nice for a quick dinner and staff seemed friendly and attentive but not all up in my face every ten minutes.and i assume this place has more pick-up business than dine in since during our visit we were the only table but lots of people came in and picked up food.comes with dipping sauce.you will have to convince them that you really do want it spicy if you want it spicy, though.we did carry out and ordered panang curry and the basil fried rice.still solid, good, fresh food.so this was once my spot for nice thai, great thai iced coffee and just really great pad thai.however, the food has far too much sodium.so.

These are the entrees/veg and their prices:blue fish / 21shrimp butter, anson mills gritsnice flavor with a seared crust on the outside, but the fish was extremely overcooked.service was slow.it doesn't really matter, though, because the food is out of this world.nothing but a great a experience.our meals were plated beautifully and the flavors were unique and amazing.wow! what a cool spot! i remember when bleeding heart bakery used to be here.when the food arrived the piece of meat was so small we kinda just looked at each other, like it was a kids meal.we had an 8pm reservation and didn't eat our mains till past 9.the food was beyond amazing, coming from a foodie and tough critic.service was on point, restaurant is byob.

Such a great addition to the hood.ultimately, it wasn't a great value for what you get but i would be willing to go back and try the dumplings.this misses the mark repeatedly.both seemed to mix different asian tastes including indian curry.solid fusion asian food, with heavy thai flavor profile.overall, i would say good for a quick dinner, and i'm thinking eating there would have been better food in general.great addition to the wicker food scene.i ordered the pad thai, an iced coffee and the mini donuts.pricey but worth it.howwww does this place have more than 3 stars!! spent 27 on ramen for delivery and it was terrible!! broth was weird and tomato based, no molten egg, pork was slimy in this soy mixture.

The noise would knock it down to 4.i recommend getting their octopus! it's super fresh and they pair it with these lemon potatoes so it can be pretty filling.definitely try the cucumber margarita! we definitely will be back.forewarning: this week be long!! :-)any who!what a fantastic spot!!!! seriously!i first encountered bar takito, whilst getting off of the clinton green line stop, basically you hope off into bt's main diningroom!i made a mental note to try it, solely based on the name and sassy façade.i am going to.you've stuffed yourself silly, but you can't stop nibbling your favorite dish.the only thing we ate that wouldn't get an outstanding rating from me was the chocolate-cinnamon flan, which did not have a flan consistency and it also had an off-putting taste, which we later found out was probably nutmeg.lizzy provided great insight on the drink and food menu.that about sums up what you'll get when you dine at bar takito.and everyone was very pleased with the margaritas and tacos that were served.

This place was a life saver.all i wanted was a cold, sweet, caffeinated iced chai, and the samosas - which turned out to be all kinds of decadent - were a bonus.brand new place in logan square and it's absolutely delicious! i started with the prairie bison dumplings and they were so mind-blowingly delicious that i had to try more! the darjeeling pork dumplings were also amazing.you're a lot better off taking a trip up north to devon street to get authentic food for the same price with good service.

There are silverware and plates on the side of the machines, and little bags to carry the loot with you back to the office.some of their newer items don't have a nutrition breakdown, only a calorie count.not ideal, but i'd give it another try.at block 37 there was a representative from farmer's fridge to help explain: who, what they are and how to use the machine.i tried the shrimp & succotash, featuring romaine, grilled shrimp, asparagus, tomato, roasted, corn, edamame, and yogurt-bail dressing.the other con is that the jar is pretty tall, so it was tough to get all the goodness at the  bottom of the jar without getting my hand dirty; however, this was fixed by using the lid as makeshift plate.the portions are big and will fill you up, not to mention you'll feel great after eating it since the food is so healthy! only docked a star since it's on the pricier side.i tried the high protein salad and added chicken.it turns out, i do like salads after all! i love me some farmer's fridge when i'm trying to eat healthy.had the napa salad, yesterday, and it was remarkably fresh!  it was packed with flavor, the fruits were fresh and the dried cranberries added a nice tinge of sweetness.

Overall, a fantastic restaurant which i hope to return to in the near future.this is such a yummy dish.food was consistently good.i would say, when shopping in the area it maybe be useful to stop by and sit on a bar with a cocktail *** if you can walk in without reservation.enjoyed everything we ordered, thoroughly!she had the shrimp salad & a side of delicious mashed potatoes!i had the spring salad with this amazing ricotta dressing, surprised about how tasty it was!then i had the filet mignon, so perfectly cooked, couldn't been happier than a seal in a barrel of fish!  it was so good that i want to go back soon, like this week!had some of their signature cocktails from the raspberry mojito & the grand marnier cognac drink.i ordered the lamb chops and he asked "what sides would you like" as if they didn't already come with 2.anyhow, we still enjoyed our time and meal there.overnight i suffered abdominal pains and spasms.the event side of the business seems unorganized and under-staffed.not too girly of a place but it would for sure not be the place to take all the guys for a business dinner or lunch.
Great for trying new or high end whiskeys, or indulging in a classic! fantastic place!.the beef tartare is amazing.dark wood decor.

I came here on a sunday afternoon and it wasnt packed at all.what can go wrong with that combo?my fav is the mushroom and kraut.the flavors are there, they're not soggy, the dough has a nice chew.pierogi very average, stuffed cabbage tasteless.their pierogis are so yummy, and i love coming here.while the interior of the restaurant was basic, the pierogi and red borscht soup made up for it..yum! if you want a cheap, super filling lunch in the loop, this is the place to go.genuine pierogis from chicago, in fact.make sure you top it with sauteed onions and bacon for extra deliciousness!! i will definitely be back when i'm in the area again.

Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great food, great wine, a great atmosphere, and a great staff and crew!.perfect for a date, to celebrate, or just to indulge yourself!it can be over laud on sunday brunch, but what can we do? the food is great!the service is very attentions as well.have you ever had chicken that actually melts in your mouth?? i certainly hadn't, and it was an incredible experience.i'm watching the team work their magic seamlessly.it's a gem.a manager came by, said he understood we weren't thrilled with dinner, offered me his card and asked us to come back and give them another chance to please..we didn't clarify this with server, just trying to head home.we got to watch the whole process of cooking each, which was sooooo cool! the brussel sprouts were the best either of us had ever had.n they taste so good so flavorful not bland at all.

Larger portions that expected.yum.there is a communal table and some bar-style seating against one wall.not bad i'm not s burger person so i tried the small burger called the rookie, added avocado and changed the salsa verde to the chilly mayo.disappointing.i normally got the scoundrel and today couldn't even figure out what to add without making my sandwich -  which is the size of slider - $11+.it's pretty good but not what i was looking for.to reiterate, service is clearly something eastman takes great pride in.met one of the owners who explained the concept of the restaurant so i decided to stop by the next morning before leaving chicago.

They were accommodating and still saved our table because i had called in to tell them we wouldn't be on time.worse service! bad management! never ever again! roaches served with your empanadas!.byob and cash only.next visit i'm going to try something new each time.this place!bae and i went for date night and it was awesome.went to irazu last night and i really wish we had chose a better place.however, one thing is, if you're a cash only restaurant you should always make sure your atm is working.the caramelized sweet plantains were just like my host family used to make--delicious!! it tasted like i was back in costa rica and i really really enjoyed it!!to drink, my date had coffee with horchata and i tried the oatmeal shake--both were amazing!! my host families in costa rica used to serve me oatmeal-based drinks all the time, so turning that concept into a shake is really creative, not to mention delicious! it might sound weird but you've got to try it!overall, i enjoyed my experience at irazu.my husband went for it feeling adventurous.the tilapia (which i also tried) was okay but not amazing.

Topped with deli meat and a ton of veggies that you can barely put it all in your mouth! 10/10.i rate this place number one for the best sub sandwiches! primo italiano!need to get the sandwiches at this location, the location on jackson avenue.-authentic italian sandwiches-all kinds of sizes (from 6 inches to 3 feet)-tasty-cheap-very first and friendly service-fresh food-not much crowdedthey have awesome fresh cookies.i love this place, i am a east coast guy and these are the best subs in the city! the bread is always fresh the meats are top quality and they make the subs big! the owner is a great guy always happy and friendly the staff is always pleasant and accommodating.love this place, being right by uic it made for a great lunch.

I got the jenny's asian noodles (substituted tofu for chicken) and i couldn't believe how much flavor was in this bowl!.i got an avo-farro insalata, which was fairly good with the only exception of the spicy cholula vinaigrette, which tasted like spicy marina sauce.

I had the sweet corn gemelli which was good, my friend had the stuffed parpardelle which was incredible." really? i had made a reservation and were we not worthy of a nice table or do you have to pay someone extra for that table.as we left, the owner made sure he said thank you for my patronage.definitely will be back here before long.the pork chop was perfectly prepared and very tender.we left half the dessert remaining.then they sat a couple of annoying girls right next to us even though the entire counter was empty.delicious food! pasta was fresh and the crudo was bite full of fresh fish.however the ability of the restaurant management to manage traffic for diners and food flow is questionable and needs significant improvement.very small for the price and only 1 of the 4 was great.
You go here to get some legendary south side eating.

I haven't had any of their beers, but my half german, beer snob husband loves their beer.mashed  potatoes were cold and had to be sent back.the bbq chicken is banging.food is solid - it's not "to die for,'  but it has a bit of a southern/creole/cajun bent that keeps it interesting and a big step above your standard brewpub fare.hallllllelujah, hallelujah halleeeeeelujah!they just opened so the atmosphere was a little slow, but the chap behind the bar was very nice and made some excellent recommendations on food.both were really good, but nothing i'm rushing back for.my friend liked her beef tacos, and they had a generous portion size..

The soup was so good, dare say best i've ever had! the sourdough bread bowl was on point too! a little pricey compared to others but the few extra bucks are worth it.still tasted good!  the service was really friendly and helpful, very accommodating considering my indecisiveness.the staff is very lovely and accommodating, but the food left me unsatisfied.reasonably priced and great when you're looking for something that doesn't take a long time to prepare!#comfortfoodsogood.make sure they tell you you can taste soups and get one free topping on each soup and grilled cheese!.i love the idea of a soup shop with twelve varieties at the ready--but i'm disappointed by soupbox's execution..staff is also very friendly.delicious lobster bisque but quite pricey.place was empty i was greeted immediately.

Good food worse service!these two waitresses working the night shift, each time someone asked for something or for an order they  would roll their eyes, or talk crap about the customers..its hit or miss.i'll definitely be back!.overall, pretty good, but not the best.

We both love strong tea but tea that strong should be served sweet at this southern restaurant and with a healthy dose of lemon in my opinion.they're open for brunch until 3am because fried chicken is an all day affair!  it's pricey, but the chicken was delicious.the biscuits really are wonderful.he used the hot sauce on the table to give a nice added kick.the place is really cute and we were seated immediately.arrived at bucks and immediately could see they were both understaffed and very overwhelmed.mental note -the corncakes need some work and the eggs.grubhub called them and the manager decided they aren't going to deliver anymore.the batter was really thick.the biscuit came out hot and steamy, ready to be buttered and consumed.

On the flip, the black pepper sauce with peppers and onions had one of the most intense and incredible flavor combinations i've ever experienced.they did a nice job and it was a pleasant enough start.and if you don't like it, it is so cheap that it doesn't really matter.i was craving for some authentic chinese food and chi cafe exceed my expectation! i highly recommend the sizzling beef! this is a must when you come here.place was also pretty clean and that includes the bathroom.come in here, sit next to every drunk asian person in chicago, order salt & pepper pork, and an almond milk tea (i don't think it's actually milk tea, but they give me the same thing every time and its delicious).we did all try each other's dishes and if you still want to go there after what you read above, we all agreed that the best dishes were the orange chicken and the chicken corn and rice (not sure if that's the name).4.

Next time i'm bringing champagne to add to their delicious fresh squeezed oj!.the smores french toast are divine: the melt marshmellows between the two slices and drizzle chocolate on top, i wish i had more to eat!.great service, friendly atmosphere, friendly staff.first time eating here, and the food experience was amazing, and you can never go wrong with byob!! as soon as you walk in you are greeting by friendly staff, and the decor feels like your at home or at your best friends place, the menu choices are amazing.let's talk yummy!  great steak benny.we split the belgian chocolate waffles topped with ice cream, chocolate syrup and strawberries.as i was looking for quick bite near work, i stumbled upon this place.

My favorite is shrimp cheong fun (crepe).2-5 happy hour discount but i would totally pay the full price, not expensive at all.we had no idea that yum cha (the previous tenant here) had closed until we got a flyer from minghin in the mail.it is a lot of food for the price, but i was expecting better.this place is soooo good.the picture menu for dim sum makes it easy to pick out something that looks good.

Great service and tasty food!! i ordered the traditional breakfast and it was a huge portion.yum.yum.i'm an out of town-er but would most certainly go back!.the beets were possibly overdressed and i'm not a fan of nut clusters, but if you like texture diversity, this is the dish for you.we got 5 entrees and shared them among us.highly recommend the bruschetta which changes daily!!!.i wanted to like it but it was a bit too pretentious.

They have a wonderful staff, & a cute location to relax, enjoy the view, & east some amazing food..i'm not sure if there was a change in cooks, but zaytunes is heading south.the restaurant itself isn't very impressive but it's a nice weekday lunch/dinner spot and you don't feel the need to get dressed up or anything.one of my favorite mediterranean spots.i couldn't finish all my wrap so i brought it home and had it for dinner.the hot sauce is awesome!!!.given the area, it's the one quick fresh grab and go spot in the vicinity.sometimes short-staffed; they don't have their drinks act together sometimes (machine breaks).this place can get real busy at lunch particularly at noon.

Great spot for a quick lunch.i would describe it as a trendy sports bar and grill.we tried sweetwater for a weekday lunch.went here for lunch with a friend.i'd pass on this one and hit their sister restaurant, howell's and hood, just across the river for a much better beer selection and food that comes hot & made to order.the thing is intense.food was great, service was great.so definitely recommend trying this place! i can't wait to come back and pair some food with my amazing favorite new drink!!.overall the meal was pretty good but not good enough for the price.one con with how busy it gets is how loud it can be.

The eggs were a little well done.i had the veggie skillet it was ok, first time here so wasn't sure what to get and many things sounded good on the menu.he returned with the bill.always willing to recommend their favorite.it is a little pricey but the cuisine is really good.you can have it all at stax! the waffles were hot, fluffy, crisp, sweet, and had whole pecans in and on the waffles, lots of waffle-y goodness, with whipped cream.i got the green chilaquiles with chorizo.it's a clean, cool and really nice place to have breakfast or brunch.love this place.i've been in the pilsen neighborhood for 3 years and have wanted to come here for quite some time.

I've had the mocha, and just regular coffee and i think i prefer the regular hot coffee over the mocha.the chef was yelling in the kitchen at the service staff, leading to more frustration and disorganization of the staff.the homemade ketchup was delicious.i completely understand extenuating circumstances - but the one thing i do expect is communication.it's good - check it out - 'nuff said.the coffee here is amazing.it was excellent, eggs cooked just as i asked, bacon was perfectly crispy, and the house made jam topped off the toast.aggressively made.the weird thing was that the patties were ridiculously salty - and this is coming from someone who loves salt.

I didn't open, touch or add a thing to it.no joke, you must go!enjoy, and get messy!.the "quality control guy" was barking orders and making sure everything was perfect --- ex: "make sure you sauce both sides of the bun if there's no cheese" or "watch those buns they should be done already"..the meat was also out of this world.a pretty good burger, but definitely not the best burger in the us.

Burger was good.i agree with nithin k.i highly recommmend this place!.perfect frioles..working lunch - go!.super friendly staff and owners, best deal on fresh juice in town.if i'm going to pay for food i want to eat off a real fork.

The food was pretty good.you can't really beat a buffet for $12.the food was excellent and the atmosphere made me feel like i was at my grandmothers house, if my grandmother was a 75 year old ukrainian woman.the place is set up for people in the know.brazilian steak houses got nothing on old lviv.the restaurant is small, so i recommend you go during the week, but you won't leave disappointed.so i might be pushing it by giving this place 5 stars.i have to take a star off because nothing is labeled as to what it is and i felt awkward having to ask what nearly everything was so i wouldn't accidentally ingest liver or something non-poultry because it is very hard to tell.the server was young gentleman, very courteous and polite.

The positive yelp reviews led my husband and i here on a weeknight before a united center concert.the patio will be open soon as it gets warm and it's going to be a wonderful place to hang out before or after a bulls or hawks game or if you just want to get out on a nice day.awesome tacos and tuesday is featured for tacos.we arrived at good time and greeted and seated right away.best buffalo wings we've ever had! a must try for sure! definitely stick with beer, cocktails aren't anything special.we enjoyed ourselves.place looks awesome though, i was there when it opened so no one was in their, would like to come back in the summer and have a beer on the patio.sit inside or outside.at the time i was there, it was happy hour.best i've had.

I really respect what debbie sharpe has been able to accomplish in her lifetime..politely, i tried to inform him of my experience of the driver blatantly lying to me, and he became somewhat rude that it isn't a tip and rushed me off the phone.today, -- first time in over three years -- i forgot my wallet at home and asked if i could pay the next day for a $4.been a vegetarian for 5 years and i'm pretty sure the wicker park sandwich is best veggie sandwich i've ever had.i used to live within walking distance of  this location but make specials trips just for the red velvet cake.the "manager" russell  i spoke with was rude, dismissive and continuously interrupted me.this place is so fun, with all kinds of local products and quirky offerings.they have a lot of specialty brands that are pretty expensive.super fun store with an awesome selection of locally made goods! tried their tuscan kale salad and loved it!final verdict:if you're looking for a wide selection of unique and mostly locally made trendy coffee, candies, wines, and the like - goddess and grocer is a must stop.

The lamb shank is delicious as well as the çankaya wine!.great food and atmosphere.it's great food! i will definitely be back.have been here several times with a girlfriend and also with my sweetie and have always enjoyed the food and the service.it came out with warm turkish bread and lentil spread which were also really good.truly delicious.definitely check out troy, the food is really worth it.the kofte and rice was absolutely incredible! it was plenty large to share, service was great, and we will absolutely return.the place is pretty small and if you don't want to wait for 30-60min, a reservation is absolutely necessary..

The waitress advised her that they no longer make decaf coffee.just have to say that alex and mark took great care of us at the bar on saturday.the broccoli was not mushy :0).so instead i opted for a buffalo chicken wrap.the 70s never died.burger, cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle and mayo.rj grunts has been better days.go find out why.just make it clear you're whining because the delivery process made the food nasty, not because the restaurant doesn't have good food.our service was fast and friendly.

$7 for q shawerma that was chocked full of meat.50/person you can bring your own wine.the arabian coffee was strong and tasty.the food is fresh and tasty, but it could be better.good middle eastern food, lebanese influence.i've also been quite the fan of their lentil soup as of late.only complaint is, there wasn't enough sauce in it (which was really yummy).

Like a nice heel slipper clearance at jcpenny.the side salad was pretty good, but c'mon, who wants to hear me rave about the side salad?!? the service was great and parking was easy.overall, we had a very pleasant lunch, just a few quirks.she ordered the mushroom etouffee sandwich and i ordered the chicken salad sandwich..the house made chips were tasty and all the side sauces that came with the apps were excellent! i think we're going to have to go into the restaurant next time for the full effect and to give some other sandwiches a go.1.we definitely want to give it another try.so good! eat here! i got a reuben, grilled cheese, house-made potato crisps, side salad with an amazing house-made dressing, a couple lagunitas, and their own boozed up root beer float.we do love all the sandwiches we've ever gotten, but there's a commitment of knowing we could be there 2x longer than somewhere else simply because of the service.

Service was perfect and all suggestions were appreciated.half priced wines on tuesdays?  any bottle?  including brunellos, amarones, and barolos?17 stars.my favorites include the chicken liver crostini, the scallops, the gnocchi in brown butter sage, veal milanese chop, and the ribeye.these were absolutely delicious.the food was just phenomenal! we split the seasonal risotto (leek and asparagus) and it was light and delicious! i had scallops and my husband had duck both of which we agreed were some of the best dishes we've ever had.i'm giving you 5 stars, wanted to give you 4.we started with a champagne and grapefruit cocktail that was great! the wine we ordered was awesome too and our waitress knew a ton about it.it's a bit awkwardly high (or i am short) but the servers did not make me feel odd for sitting there.wine list was great, food was spectacular.we had some of everything and loved every last bite.

Plain and simple food was amazing red velvet french toast.it wasn't as good as i expected.also, there is parking available at meters all around the surrounding blocks in case you are driving.great brunch spot! came when they were pretty busy but still got seated quickly, only waited like 5 mins.so good.these guys can definitely handle their huevos (eggs)! i brought my friend who was visiting on a whim and yolk did not disappoint.skillet was above par as well.

It's very homemade tasting.had the italian beef piazola.word to the wise*cash only*get the fries, well they're more homemade chips but just get them.i'm really looking forward to trying their cottage fries, which are basically deep fried potato slices.great homemade, old school, italian food, but can't be in a hurry as the service is slow.

The duck was served whole and attractively cut, and cooked to utter perfection..a little too sweet for my, but overall i enjoyed the cocktails zak made me based on me telling him my likes and dislikes.i understand this is not 'fine" dining but really.thanks yelp!  the spot prawns with uni risotto was excellent.the skin was crisp and the meat juicy and tender.best bacon ever!i will go back just for this meal!  and maybe try a mimosa with it.and the duck jus, yum! contrary to other yelpers, the portion was just fine for us because we finished the entire dish!at the end of our meal, when we were too full to even contemplate dessert, the manager came out with a small birthday treat for my boyfriend - a chocolate ice cream cone! it was a very thoughtful gesture that i didn't expect to receive when i made the reservation on opentable.drinks were awesome, but that's about it.the whole time i kept saying that the waiters kept walking around like they were doing things, but nothing was getting done.

Each one was fantastic and as flavorful as it gets.great little place that  provides good authentic tacos and quesadillas.the green and red hot sauces were ok but not especially flavorful, and same goes for the guacamole.make no mistake about it: these guys make the best tacos in all of pilsen.cute little hole in the wall.

The chicken sandwich was the winner.the baked beans were the perfect compliment, and were delicious.had the heath bar ice cream cake, middle layer was mini reese's pieces.the mac and cheese is really good.it comes with lemon which cuts down the richness of the dish.it wasn't the best nor was it the worst bbq.lo and behold we found chicago q along with free parking.

I ordered a 1/2 pound and paid 6..i love goose island but i don't understand why is closed it's supposed to be open till 4 a.i havebeen going to goose for 40 years and tony and the guys are the best.no frills.its located in a scary lonely street at night but there are probably a couple of police officers inside getting a pound of jumbo to go.no seating.where else in chicago can you still get a can of pop for 65 cents? at least around the northside? they were friendly and the food was hot and delish! definitely will be going back! i have read some reviews on here about the place being "ghetto" all in all it is a shrimp and fish shack!!! this is not some 5 star restaurant, it is the same type of shrimp and fish shack you would encounter in the deep south like in new orleans or houston (i know because i have been).shrimp house is right down the road and from all the reviews we decided to give it a try for lunch.cash only.

Service was nice.i ordered the spicy tonkatsu ramen with corn and green onion, and my friend ordered the gold ramen cha shu - the waitress explained that gold has a fuller body and more flavor than the silver option.gold broth is a thicker, richer broth than the silver.delicious ramen.it's not tonkotsu, and it's definitely not light.i got there five minutes before my friend and the restaurant was half empty.fantastic! most authentic ramen in chicago.not to mention, i'm abnormally critical about my ramen.really really spot on..

Cool place for cheep drinks and good burgers.low points: borgers are bland.exactly what we were hoping it would be! hole in the wall with vintage neon, relics of yesteryear and delicious, cheap food.on vacation/work tripapparently old classic since 1932wasn't what we were expecting-- very diner like and food is ok.cheeseburgers are nothing special but i am sure taste better after a late night out.when i read the title, i thought it was gonna be one of those classic looking rustic pub/inn type place, but it's really just a dive burger place with a bar.live it.beers are well priced.i made the right choice.

The family/owners are simply lovely lovely people and they always have great tacos and imported coca-cola.tacos and burritos are tasty, quick service, really friendly employees behind the counter all the time.the tacos are vey good and the rice and beans perfect.super nice people and they even know my order.solid tacos and tortas with delicious meats or avocado fillings, though i've especially enjoyed the chorizo.

Lovely dinner in hidden gem restaurant.the ambiance was your usual for a brunch spot; cool, hip, laidback..the result is components of superior quality, fresh and delectable cuisine.offer a brunch package that rolls drinking and dining in to one promo that works for your clientele.

It's delicious.the place has a cozy atmosphere for dinner and a good wine selection, i'll give them that but i wasn't terribly blown away by the food.my friend and i really wanted a good bloody mary for brunch and this place was amazing! so delicious.the other people in my party enjoyed their meals but i can't remember what hey had.our waitress was attentive and kept our glasses full the entire time we were there.went to dunlays for brunch and wasn't disappointed.it's not very often that i walk out of a place thinking "which was better, the food or the service?" they are both very well done, top notch crew here.

Good food, big portions, reasonable prices - why don't more people go here?? the rigatoni alla rigo is excellent.a fun but classy cartoon, something about bellville, was playing on their flatscreen.i asked her if she could make a shrimp and mussel fra diavolo dish for the dinner, and she did, with no problems even though it is not on their regular menu.but i really loved the food here.a few odd things about the experience: the cook often has to run through the dining area to bring in more food and to take out garbage.i guess those people don't yelp.there are regular dining tables, couch seating, hi-tops and a fireplace along with the bar.it wouldn't hurt for them to go fresh.it is a small place but very warm and friendly.

Citrus.we also ordered the warm cookies for desert which was a great call! this place is definitely worth checking out.the tomato salad was also good.the waitress was very attentive and helpful, but the cocktails were very mediocre.my wife and i stepped into bernie's early saturday afternoon for lunch at out daughters suggestion.have been there on several occasions hoping we'd had a one-off experience, but i'm afraid this spot just isn't that hot.so maybe they will add heat lamps upstairs so we can continue eating up there until november / december!.he told her to try it and attempted to get her to keep it, but finally said that he would get her the correct drink order and took the original drink away.i understand that we weren't the only table he was taking care of, but it was a bit unnecessary to have to wait as long as we did.the food was actually very good though.

, but i do like  the pictures of germany.the salads were of good size and they enjoyed them, i very much enjoyed my sandwich and chips.look for chicago's first post-prohibition liquor license, number 1, in one of the glass cabinets in the bar.the food is good if a touch pricey for what is essentially upscale pub-grub.i was probably 7-8 when i first came here.i ordered the gyro, which comes on toasted white flatbread.the service can be slow on a crowded night, but it's expert and attentive, with old-school professional waiters.with a strong bite :)altogether, we had a great meal for a very decent price!.you can't go wrong with a pretzel and pierogis! their beer leaves something to be desired, but they have a decent bottle list.however, i found myself in the downstairs cafe recently with a friend and the pear salad was fantastic (champagne dressing, pears, a little blue cheese, dried cherries).

Had the lentil burger again, with the coleslaw on top again (because it's that amazing!).crazy! now you know where the "butcher" part of the name comes from/sold sold sold.burger+fries+diet coke for $18.i got a regular burger well done and it was.the burger was fairly small and thin patty, but the house blend was quite delicious and seasoned well.definitely check this place out if you're in chicago!.i personally was skeptical about trying a shrimp burger but it could not have been better.burger was too rare for my liking at medium request.all in all, great burger.i think my expectations were too high.

Everyone enjoyed everything.this place is beyond expectations the couple that work here are very kind.the fried chicken itself, is everything you want from fried chicken being tender and juicy with a nice crispy exterior.

Chili quinoa chili was ok, however thinking about the ingredients and nutritional values, is a good side/ soup option.i've seen other reviewers rave about the reuben, so i might go back, but i just wasn't wow'ed.i had to check twice to make sure everything i ordered was indeed vegan.never been disappointed with either the menu or the service.my burger came topped with jack cheese (teese was an option too) and vegannaise (?) and possibly some other sauces.you're perfect; never change.knowledgeable staff and beyond amazing 'milk'shakes.great place to take non-vegetarians, they're drinks are a little overpriced but all in all great experience.then, when they love it, (they always do) i get super proud that i got to enlighten them ^___^.everything was wonderful! thank you jason for making my first time at the chicago diner truly fantastic!bloody mary was superb.

Definitely go for the ahi tuna bowl with crunchy toppings when you do go here.the ingredients were delicious and fresh and being that i work in food safety, i noticed that the place was clean and looked great! highly recommend :).a lot of take-out as well.it is basically a sushi without the wrapping.however, they still welcomed us in with a smile.delicious , fair priced and fast ! very fresh ingredients and a great option for lunch.best poke in chicago!!! as someone who was born and raised and still lives in hawaii, i can say this place broke da mouth! the closest thing to authentic poke i have ever had on the mainland.i ordered a little bowl with a mix of brown rice and greens with marinated salmon and the aloha add-ins (pineapple, cucumber, scallion, jalapeno, & maui onion sesame vinaigrette).there are some places to sit by the window on stools at a small counter.really cute place with fast service.

They let me make up a table for my party since i got there early.the old fashion was good but we got to a point where we were so uncomfortable we decided to leave.we'd have gone somewhere else, no harm done.however, i am so happy to report that the gage was an amazing choice! the ambiance was so warm and the smiling faces and excellence service was a dream! chicago is really a city for the people.

Nothing but good things to say.we each ordered a different "main course" to split.the hostess was sweet and checked in on us as well.the service was perfect as well." i believe it was pulled pork layered in it.phenomenal small plates and pizza, with fried eggplant and pizzas as the standouts imo.i love ugo's so much!  the entire staff is so friendly, the food is really great, the prices are reasonable, and the wine is fantastic.will be coming back for sure.

This place is a gem.steak, pansa, fish, chicken.the food quality is very good.this place would probably rank as 6 stars on any late night drunk food outing..i get it.this place is awesome.best mexican restaurant in the area, great fish tacos/burritos, tacos/burritos al pastor.very excellent food and quality.ground beef, too watery, though.

I come here all the time alone because it makes me feel like being back home.disclaimer: i am not a foodie at all, so take my opinion with a grain of salt.the thai dessert menu is extensive too.it tasted good, so if you're in dire need of a lumpia fix, this is an option.only thing i wish they included was salt and some chili powder like i'm used to.the mango was very fresh, and the sticky rice was fantastic.the wanton soup was excellent, with large wontons and a delicious, flavorful broth.had the mango chicken and chicken pot stickers.

I remember the food taking a long time to make.super cool joint where you can have a great bite to eat and enjoy some good conversation.my final bit of advise, listen to stephanie and order whatever she says.i really liked this restaurant and the food.the space is beautiful, atmospheric, and reminiscent of when old town had a major stained glass thing going on (in my childhood), where every other bar or restaurant seemed to have victorian stained glass all overthe place.i had salmon, my son had prime rib,& my husband had the cornish hen.outdoor seating? hooray!solid bloody mary? oh hell to the yes.after waiting probably fifteen minutes, (after we had already waited a considerable amount of time to be acknowledged and given menus and had our drink orders taken) the rest of my table got their drinks and when i told the server i was still waiting for my beer he went back to the bar (i thought to get my beer) and continued running drinks to his other tables for several more minutes.very comfortable, great bartenders, good food, beautiful room with many original features - easily the best place to come for a relaxing dinner amidst all the craziness of wells street just a little further north.

Placed an order for two value meals includes chicharon, 1/2lb of carnitas and a drink.no need to pick one, visit both.there is the crunchy crackling skin (chicharrones), which snaps and crackles in your mouth with the slightest sliver of port meat tucked underneath to deliver an extra punch of flavor.there are a few tables for sit-down service, and a very popular take-out counter.i love how they have all the toppings on the table with tortillas.try the chipotle sauce, very good.i wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.best carnitas,  new favorite place in 18th street!good is quick and delicious,  customer service is very good with even better attitude.the deep fried tacos, menudo, carnitas, and chicharron was absolutely delicious!  of course, everything was washed down with a glass bottled coca cola and topped off with a caramel lollipop on the way out!  we went for lunch but we might just have to go back for dinner! lol   thanks carnitas uruapan restaurant!.

The service was also sub-par, but it was a busy saturday night, so understandable.i would deff recommend this for those travelling to chicago!.i came here for lunch with a few friends.great cosmopolitans, too!.but,service is not attentive at all.been here before.we noticed the first day that the waiters shirt was noticeably filthy and frayed.my regular latte was not really good though.food and service were excellent.we sat in the room with the beautiful windows overlooking michigan ave.

The sandwich was large enough to split into 2 meals.the service is mediocre, but the food definitely compensates.we had party of 9 and one meal took super long so the rest of us started.friend had scallops, i had shrimp sandwich.served with a side of honey butter they biscuits are great.overall, well done.in chicago for a conference and stopped here for dinner with friends.we were greeted by a nice guy who took us to our seat and gave us some insight on the menu.nothing wonderful.we had a few mixed drinks, the biscuits and calamari fries for starters.

If i could give this place 6 stars i would.the arancini was one of the better dishes we had.the big pasta station in the center is pretty cool!  service was on par with this type of restaurant, although i could tell for a friday night, they were busy and trying to move tables.the tables are also incredibly close together.the cookie chunks, aside from being too hard and too big to comfortably take bites of with a spoon of ice cream, were pretty bland flavor-wise, as was the milk and honey ice cream that i wouldn't have known wasn't plain vanilla if it hadn't been written.and the desserts! a beautiful, creative cannoli with candied orange rind that didn't bore my pants off and the butterscotch budino that almost made me melt right into my chair.there isn't an actual mountain anywhere nearby, but you will think you've hit the summit when you dine at monteverde!.we split two appetizers, two pastas, and a dessert.i left feeling very satisfied.i am always excited when a new restaurant opens in chicago.

How can you go wrong eating in a cathedral surrounded by crosses and the sweet voice of selena.definitely a cozy atmosphere.i came on a thursday morning and it was packed.i usually know if i'm going to like a place based on their hot chocolate and eggs.definitely one of my top choices for breakfast!.great place for breakfast or lunch.yikes! extremely slow service.

Cocktails, food, service, atmosphere.ohhhhh how do i love ada street.pretzel bread pudding and panacotta - both were very good for dessert.very intimate.i'll definitely be going back and maybe dressing up a little bit more next time!.i would recommend this place for a date night or a group dinner.the place is pretty small and tables don't move quickly so prepare to wait.i ate here while i was on vacation.dinner was interesting, for sure.it couldn't have been any better.

After using my yelp app to narrow down some of the top choices, el faro definitely stood out for its vegetarian menu and positive reviews.they also have the most authentic tasting trees leches cake i've ever tried!!!!.if you haven't had a home cooked meal in weeks, or months, this place will hit the spot.add the "chicken" soy tacos with grilled cactus (nopal) to your "to try" list from el faro.it's very hard to find an authentic mexican restaurant with vegetarian options.great customer service and the food was outstanding.marveloso!.ive ordered the veggie burger and wow, it is amazing.my father went here for breakfast one morning and showed me this fruit salad bowl that looked so good.the menu seems very vegetarian friendly which is nice.

Anyway, dinner: my friend and i ordered the hummus for an appetizer, and it was excellent.however: awesome house-made juices and baked goods.we made reservations for 1:45pm on a sunday to try out their brunch menu.not to mention the excellent table service.great for breakfast too, btw..the light and fluffy blackberry lemon pancakes were the most amazing thing to hit my mouth.

:-d.gave one star cause it wouldn't let me do zero stars.for dinner i had the pad thai noodle dish.delicious!! pricing is cheap for the quality & quantity!.the food and service merits a much bigger place.so we are in the restaurant ordering to go.she explained some of the dishes to help guide our choices.the chicken and beef were especially poorly made (the tofu was good), and the pad thai was the worst i ever had.i plan on going back and getting take out since it's not far from my work.love this place.

Community dont sleep on this place.the lighting is something that your eyes do not have to work hard to adjust to and the music is an eclectic collection of latin, jazz, and blues.there appeared to be some sort of confusion in the kitchen.

The first two drinks that i ordered were "no longer available.the ambiance of the promontory is really nice.i will say the drinks are pricey but hey, it's chi.we decided to have our dinner inside because it was still 90 degrees at 10, but the deck area was beautiful.we went here for the halloween party.the food is excellent, and the place has a good vibe to it.what a sexy spot! okay admittedly its a convenient location, however, i was lost for about 15mins.so we just got our own chair and reset the table to fit our group.if that is not happening it removes the foundation for anything else to fall into place.do it!the music venue space upstairs is an awesome bonus; wonderful things are happening up heir throughout the year, from jazz sets, hip hop performances, farmers markets, and yoga, to name a few.
