We opted not to get goat since we weren't feeling for it.i look forward to come back againcabinets city.the bread it came with is very good.young 30 somethings and up.the bill ended up being about $20 per person + tip, so not terrible but we only ordered 4 dishes so the more you order, the more expensive it'll be.please note reservations are highly recommended in advance because the seats go fast!!!so let's get into the good stuff the much awaited entrees:i started the evening with cornbread which came with cherry relish and honey mustard butter the bread was a melt in your mouth kind of bread.
The guisados they make are also very delicious.highly recommend this place!.you can buy fresh totillas,masa,chips from the store just west of the restaurant.their tortillas are so good.

A few chicken slices,not a whole chicken breast as the menu stated.the menu is extensive with many choices.asked for more chips 3 times and didn't get any.nice portion sizes.i like my bread pudding to have ice cream on the side rather than whipped cream.

I can't wait to see them extend their hours to the weekends.if they dropped the price by weight a little bit i might consider coming back but why when you could get a comparable salad at a grocery store salad bar for far less.five stars!.i found the morning staff on weekdays to be very pleasant and friendly to buy your coffee and bagels from.however, the burgers are fantastic.

After 3, when brunch closed up we danced upstairs under the open rooftop for about an hour..we went to fremont for my sisters bachelorette weekend.i definitely recommend the honey pear or pineapple orange.it's a little pricey but well worth the charge.all were delicious, especially the brussel sprouts! the restaurant is large and spacious.dinner on a friday during ncaa was meh- basically bar food, nothing that stood out.the food is fresh, the drinks are on point.wow fremont- not only are you an awesome club at night, you're an awesome brunch club as well! the boozy brunch culture is at its peak at this spot on the weekends, with every breakfast item you can imagine, endless and plentiful drinks, and great music.

First draft is a great alternative to madison street bars before games at the uc.really enjoy this neighborhood hangout.we like our meat on the medium-rare to rare side and it's hard to find places that actually cook it like that, and first draft certainly did!i would definitely recommend this place! it was the first place we went to eat at in chicago and it definitely started the trip off right!.there are also great selections of spirits to choose from.the mac n' cheese side was not bad but not a reason to go back.caesar dressing could use a little more lemon to cut the mayo base.the servers and staff were sipping from starbucks cups, standing around.the fried pickles are pickle spears which is the worst.

Wow! we rented out the space for my brother's bachelor party.the atmosphere was really casual and, best of all, not pretentious at all.i've taken sandwiches to go and have had such unpleasant experiences at the register its made me not wanna return for them tasty grubs..it feels like an every weekend option, compared to the publican which is more of a special occasion brunch imo.they said it was so buttery and yet nutty (the whole grain flours i'm assuming) while the chocolate bits were large irregular and had a true dark chocolate flavour.i want to marry the baker and live forever eating carbs and being fat.i came here for an event/honey summit (for work) and they had arranged a private meal.a couple of things: a) literally every west loop patio has dogs in it, many much larger than mine b) we have eaten at publicans patio within the past couple weeks with our dog and it was a no-issue.long queues for the eat-in tables.

The steak was absolutely amazing.i had ordered the scallops but they were out of them :( instead, i ordered the salmon which was one of the best salmon dishes i have seriously ever had! the best salmon in the city still might be guilt bar's, but this was a very close second! we finished with dessert (banana cream pie and this chocolate moose thing--- delicious!overall i think this is a great restaurant for entertaining out of town guests and has amazing food.basically, because we had paid our bill and wasn't ordering more drinks to increase his tip, we were being asked to leave.the server was very knowledgeable, professional and polite, but interestingly insisted the most expensive items on the menu were the "must-try's.the ambiance is definitely just for show.my friend got the ropa vieja and that had me regretting my entree choice after i tried a bite..the breakfast cocktails were well worth their prices and the food was great! i had a coupon that i received in the mail and it knocked down the price significantly.side note: valet parking is $7 + tip but if you aren't late like us, i'm sure you could find a parking spot with a little hunting.the snacks didn't come out quite right, but they did comp us some guacamole (the mystery item that appeared).

Pork belly bao is their best dish.and then some.good noodles & broth really liked everything i tried!the owner chef takashi yakahashi is a fantastic japanese chef.best ramen spot in chicago ! their spicy garlic ramen will leave you speechless and drooling for more.but they changed it.i went on a sunday night and there was a bouncer standing outside the door.otherservice was decent - i had little interaction with them, but they were friendly enough and checked in on me a couple times.the chashu pork was tough instead of meltingly tender, and the broth didn't have much dimension to it.luckily, the outdoor patio sitting with river north vibes gave us a good ramen experience in downtown chicago.we should have just ordered the chicken.

+high ceilings+palm trees :d+nice venue space.let me return to my reference of this place as a hidden gen - it truly is obscure and you wouldn't find it unless you're searching for it.never eaten here, but as a happy hour location it is fun, and insanely simple if you already work in 311.highly recommended for anyone looking for a venue downtown that isn't a hotel ballroom.menu - a good menu size, with options for soups, salads, pastas and entrees.she really helped to coordinate all of the various vendors and made sure everything was in order leading up to the wedding.the calamari was nice and hot without too much breading.

When looking for a new place you should always wonder, "how's the food?" and, "well, what about the service?".he checked on us regularly and timed my second beer perfectly.i would totally come back here and explore the huge menu more!  be aware that the new hours are 4-9 pm only now.really yummy, really freakin' spicy.went perfectly with the rice, and we drank every last drop..omg! dined in on a saturday around 5:30.

The flavor of the broth was pretty strong/tasty, and slightly spicy, but i'm finding it hard to describe what the flavor actually was.i ordered the duck and pho spice dumplings, the urbanbelly ramen, and the peanut butter and jelly soft serve for dessert.i guess it's comparable for the area, but when thinking of getting a ramen and a rice dish, maybe a bit much?  regardless good food.the decor was nice but honestly the food was mediocre at best.pass on them.the phat rice was larger compared to the pad thai.have only had the vegetarian food, but the pea shoot and sweet potato dumplings are something that i consistently crave.i'll likely come back to try some other choices on the menu.got the pork and cilantro dumplings which were good.

Upon review of my credit card, i was over charged.so goooooood! if you love seafood and tired of paying for so much money for so little in the huge restaurants downtown this place is worth a visit.damn.definitely a great spot to frequent and introduce to people visiting the city.dipped everything in it!byob is nice.good, attentive service.i definitely should have asked how much it was going to be before i ordered.we got seated quickly, and the ordering process was very fast and painless.we also got some horchata to wash it all down which was fantastic.however, they did give me lots of shrimp.

Great place! even caught a football game on thursday evening.would not recommend.unprofessional, disrespectful staff and treatment.goat cheese infused bison with jalapenos wrapped in bacon!.wings remind me of birds nest, which is a huge compliment.we were looking for somewhere to grab dinner while staying in the area and this was right around the corner from our hotel and had good yelp reviews so we thought we would try it.

Cool spot with pretty solid food.then we got some sausages, which were all great and served on pretzel buns.we asked to move and we were accommodated and moved to a different table, which turned out to be a disaster..it was so damn delicious that i bumped it up to my #1 favorite on biscuits and gravy list.she did not get to eat until our entire table was half way done with their meal.after plans to take my dad on a beer and bacon tour were thwarted when the company cancelled, i called up kaiser tiger because i'd heard they did beer/bacon pairings.the event space was great! we had this huge upstairs space all to ourselves that included a private bar with about 15 different beers on tap.the food and beer was okay.the have a curling ice game that i tried for the first time, i loved it.

2.unfortunately g&o missed the mark.just don't "deep throat" it! get dat did.the aforementioned patio is cozy and secluded, despite abutting ogden, and the drinks are killer - my fellow bourbon boozers will love the dangerously drinkable bourbon root beer, capped off with an ole bird, a sophisticated riff on the estimable manhattan.i like the fact that the patio is kinda private and blocks the view from the street.last time i was here, the owner told the bartender to change the channel from the blackhawks game  to a lop-sided nfl game, a non-local nfl game.the food i have had here has been amazing! try the meatballs, burger and smoked mac & cheese! the vibe here is definitely cozy and relaxing and worth checking out!.a little overpriced for the product.when i used to live on the northside, i would drive past this place all the time on my way home so i was excited to finally check it out.

I had the cha cha spicy ramen with the garlic broth.the toppings, in particular the chasu pork and seasoned egg, are perfect.i like the use of thin noodles which lets the broth infiltrate them with more flavor.also, it was blazing hot in there.excited to have this new addition to the neighborhood.the atmosphere and interior decorating was nice and seating was comfortable.the place has good atmosphere and food, they played the good kaskade that i like while i slurped on that ramen.the flavors balanced so well and the spicyness hit the spot.my boyfriend ordered the spicy umami miso ramen.i was a big fan of the fried truffle brussel sprouts, but not enough to make me come back.

I also am not sure why i paid an extra quarter for flavoring on my fries to taste like nothing.the same issue occurred where they put pickles on my sandwich, so that was a bit frustrating; and after two bites of the sandwich it all fell apart and was difficult to eat.the burgers are gooey and wonderful, only reason i'm giving it 4 stars is because they have a little too much onions on them for my taste.let me tell ya'.plus how can you go wrong with twice fried fries dusted in flavors.best new logan square restaurant, by far! i went there on a thursday night and there was a steady stream of locals filing through.come in often and order 2 burgers and the poutine.the spicy chicken sandwhich was smothered in really solid habanero sauce.the staff was friendly but forgot some of our order, but i just chalk that up to being new.hoping it was open late night on the 3rd, i feel they should be open like many other places on our street.

There was no update on what was happening or why we were not moving at all.nice big squeaky melty battered curds, in a bath of spicy chili, topped with a crema and some fried tortilla strips.i always get the potato tacos and they are delicious, crunchy bites of spud heaven.god.i got the short ribs taco, shrimp taco, and the famous chilli cheese curd.we were huge fans of the fish tacos and the pork carnitas.pros:- lots of selection.guilt and self loathing to follow!.i'll have to write about drinks ate a later date because i am doing the sober thing this month :(i loved staff interactions.my god, when we finished eating, we still had beer.

Only reason i'm giving it 4 stars is because of the service.the d'nuez crepes are amazing! i've gotten my whole family addicted! first restaurant to ever offer lechera and cajeta! the d'nuez coffee is also my favorite..

These tacos are saucy and juicy, so be prepared with napkins.yummy gluten free taco options.i feel like you cannot go wrong with it! only downside is the portion is a bit smallthe service is a bit slow, that is the reason for some of the lower rated reviews here, but if you dine in and don't mind sit around, i think the food is totally worth it.went here yesterday with the husband.employees like her will keep people coming back.they were all so fresh and delicious, great flavors that pack a punch.thanks omar for always hooking it up.nooo!!!.that fried scrimp po boy is bomb! get it! next time i want the soft shell crab too.

The lasagna was excellent but the fried chicken is mostly fried skin and barely any chicken.while there were several four-tops, we were put at one nearest the bar/kitchen and maitre d' stand.i felt that the service was less than average and there really wasn't any dish that stood out for me.now in all fairness at the time it seemed like the kitchen was dealing with an issue (i believe a customer who was being a real prick) but i couldnt discern what was going on.until then, i will, in the poignant words of senor dos xx , stay thirsty.i would highly recommend the restaurant for the food, but the prep kitchen experience for a little something extra.moreover, it was way too much food for a tasting menu.don't turn your nose up at it.i didn't really understand that dish although it was quite tasty.it was perfect.

I had the chocolate cake for dessert, and it was just fine.stopped by for sunday brunch because of the great reviews on yelp.yum yum! the catfish is fried to perfection and juicy! all the sides just scrumptious! southern comfort done cute!  and i dig a lil byob joint er'now and again! hits the spot!.the greens are amazing and grown in the patchwork gardens to the west of this little urban country gem.it's a must!.we love coming here for the wonderful flavorful chicken which is seasoned well and really moist.the "down -on-the-farm" feeling made the experience memorable and complimented the tasty lunch.the chicken is off the hook ! laid back place that is family friendly.some of the sides we tasted were just ok or slightly above average (mac-and-cheese and the mash/gravy), but overall a great experience.the mac n cheese was disappointing, definitely not cheesy enough.

A very reasonable priced place in a rather expensive district.salmon, yellow tail, and tuna.price was decent and food was good.probably my favorite sushi place so far in the city, i guess it helps that it's only about a 10 minute walk from my apartment, it's crazy awesome cheap, and the sushi is actually pretty good, too.will have to come again to try the smoothies.i live right around the corner from this place and it is my go-to place for great sushi and cheap! its like a fast food sushi restaurant.in the loop there's really nothing better than this place where i can get a light dinner rather than heavy food in the rest of the area.good portions, affordable and fresh.i love ordering the spicy salmon hand rolls.surprisingly,  the prices were reasonable considering how outrageously priced beers are in this area.

One star for the club-volume music at 6pm on a saturday.i like taking myself on dates to furious spoon and sitting at the bar.:( might try again during peak hours, though.as to the sake, i need to find out what local markets sell it.the perfect combo of 90s era hip hop and succulent ramen will hit you like a sock'em bopper to the jaw and take you back to your childhood.the more you dig into the noodle, the spicier it gets.the portion size was appropriate for the price and their noodles are amazing.great neighborhood stop..

Well sort of.ive noticed it's pretty standard to tell them "well done" and "easy on the sausage" (trust me!) but great nonetheless.the pepperoni and onion thin is to die for.best pizza..best pizza, we order at least 3x a week from here either to my store or home.co-workers and i always order it, and i think that it is highly underated.i have to say that this is probably the best thin crust pizza i've had in my area, when it comes to greasy and tasty it doesn't get much better than their sausage & pepperoni, i've ordered from other places in my neighborhood (south loop) and really it comes down to phil's unless you want deep dish.tried to order delivery.i usually get the sausage with garlic.

That's true.they were out of the key lime cappuccino so i got a vanilla one instead.wow guys.prices are about average for the quality of the grub & service was quick! also saw some amazing looking baked goods in a glass display by the register.evan and i look forward to coming back.if you truly love food and you possess an appreciation for chefs that put equal effort into a mission, innovative flavors and presentation, you'll dig arbor.

This place is good for late night or for something quick., mecca of tacos, and l.love the new mango drink !.raymond's, i don't know how to quit you.their burritos are narsty too.the tacos are the best in the world, but the customer service is poor i called to place a large order for our office and when i asked for a total the employee said i'm too busy for that.i don't know, i'm just always in a burger mood when i walk in.lol.best taco and burrito place in chicago.

Definitely we will be coming back!.everything we tried had intense flavors that went so well together.very unique menu.also a little zippy but ugh, i want it in my belly right now!--two sauces are available to enhance your fusion experience: a red sauce and a green sauce.plan on waiting a long time for your food..i tried the burrito with bulgogi (korean beef), rice, cabbage and cheese, and sriracha sauce.i was very pleased with how nice and helpful the employees were.second time around totally different story, ordered over the phone for pick up, get there no line, parking space available.let me tell you.

Clean establishment and a super friendly staff.) that said, coleslaw needs bell peppers like a fish needs a bicycle, so consider this a 4.as expected.if this is your first time trying southern food, i would recommend fried chicken.and the sides are phenomenal.while the food was good, i would probably try something other than the shrimp po boy.

I've tried their chana and their paneer wraps.i like the spicy chutney and onions.i really hope they adjust their portions and pricing accordingly, because other than that the food is really good!'til next time!.neither was the chana.loved it to every bit :).it was flaky and the chicken was cooked just right and went well with the sauces.this location is nicer than the one in the loop.it would be better if the wrap had some lettuce and veggies.i didn't know how well indian could be prepared in this fast casual model, but i have to say that i was pleasantly surprised.the wraps are made from really thick bread which makes this meal a little more filling but everything was a bit too greasy.

Salsita is a good option for cheap eats and i'll be back!.tortas and tacos.how ever their food minus dibris 3 stars.i'm here all the time!.dairy free? they have daiya! and unlike many establishments, veganizing your meal doesn't cost extra!convenient location right on halsted a bit north of whole foods.i have not stopped going back since! staff is super friendly and the food is fresh and made to order! you can't go wrong here! eat in or carry out the food tastes the same!who cares where the owner parks, i'm there to eat, not police! ;).lots of volume, flavor and high quality ingredients.we were thinking it would be more like a chipotle type place where you watch you make the food etc..note that you do need a $10 minimum in order to charge credit.

Just got home from my first visit with a friend.the food was decent but not amazing; we would have expected significantly better from the $53 total.but in all seriousness, went there on a date and had the steak chimichurri and my date had the island burger.but it kinda seemed like the spice in ever dish was the same.the chimichurri steak for my entree was out of this world.the decor is an odd mix of eastern european dance club and dungeon.i ordered a turkey burger version of the catalonian through ubereats.i would come back here in a second.also - the brunch menu also includes a little heat in the recipes.
Also, the price, very reasonable not only for a food truck but for a brick and mortar restaurant.

Was kind of saddened to see greek coffee blacked out on the menu.i would suggest this place as it always surprises me with really good stuff every time if visit it.delicious greek food: one of the bests i had so far.in terms of the location and setting, it is very comfortable and i enjoyed it !.the food is fresh and delicious and the coffee is amazing!.such a cute restaurant/bakery!!all i can say is: mango mousse cake.where do i start? just get one.if i ever go back to greek village and have to choose a place for desserts, this will be my place.for the dessert lovers, you can't go wrong with what i've had.also had the mocha, the whipped cream on top was sky high and i loved that.

(wah) oh well, it still doesn't take away from the fabulous-ness of our meal.tastes like cock and sauce.they were so good i had to order extras to take home with me! i may even make another trip before we go back to la.onion rings were greasy, and it was obvious the oil they fried them i hadn't been changed in a while.wonderful ribs.last night the wait was over, as i endured the 1.

They have eight different meats and falvored burgers.nice place to come on a weekend, if you want to avoid the ridiculous wait time at river north bars.i came here with a few friends for a early lunch, and was pleasantly surprised by the uniqueness of their burger & topping choices.they have rotating beers on tap and great addition to the neighborhood.definitely will eat here again.the regular fries were good, the truffle fries were soaked in truffle oil.brrrrr! the seat was dirty, and the menus had food stuck to them inside.definitely recommended.the sweet potato fries were also good.no one to blam but myself.

We'll definitely be back!.not supper spicy but full of salvor.we ordered from this location before it was renamed and had the same experience.thumbs up on the boat noodles and other thai street food, too.i love being able to get the authentic taste of sticky rice closer to home.

Best sandwiches! you can tell they put so much work into bringing fresh, quality, beautiful ingredients to the streets of chicago where the norm is grease and not-so-healthy.when the line of people who've paid for food and are waiting to be served is 20 deep, is that really the best use of your time?  the lady who finally did present me with a sandwich mentioned that it was an "abnormal day," but i'm not sure what she meant by that - it's a summer friday in the city, and the crowd looked pretty normal-sized to me in light of that.i got the magic mushroom which was yummy and fresh..corner farmacy is one of a kind!! the sandwiches are top notch which makes it impossible to choose a favorite.i absolutely loved the asparagus panini - amazing lemon aoli! i appreciate that you can get any sandwich on a bed of lettuce or quinoa, too.definitely worth a visit.

We ordered four first courses to start: the grilled octopus, terrine, jamon serrano and chorizo stuffed quail.this place should be a lot harder to get a reservation at than it is, but they are apparently going to be on check please soon so maybe that will change.the décor is dark, warm and somewhat rustic.same with the sweetbreads.each course was full of beautifully prepared proteins (very well portioned) and memorable flavors.seriously?? i'm sure the dessert was good but we had enough of the service and just wanted to leave.job well done!!!.the menu is refreshingly different than other spanish places.this is my go to restaurant in the west loop.

I got the turkey burger w/cheese & fries, 2 corn breads, and my roomie got the 9 wing combo, all for $15!burger was huge , moist and delicious.i also had a side of mac and cheese and collards: the collards were overly-salty for my taste, and while the mac and cheese had too much cheese (it was kind of like a cheese pudding with some noodles), i'd rather my mac and cheese have too much cheese than too little.sorry but i won't be back.rice and beans..the fried lobster is fresh, battered and fried to perfection.

If you're a vegan like me, you'll have trouble deciding what to order! there are so many options, i went two days in a row.we stopped in for lunch the day they arrived and the wraps were very good.unfortunately, unlike the greektown location, the "homemade" jams don't appear homemade and seem to be limited to strawberry and strawberry.all in all, a good breakfast.i do not recommend dearborn.prices are higher than the average diner but you get what you pay for in terms of quality and generous portion size.our total bill was $25 which is amazing enough in itself for chicago.i have nothing but positive things to say about this cafe.my family came here for breakfast and we were pleasantly surprised.service was great, food was delicious, decor was beautiful, absolutely loved our time here!.

I had originally given this establishment 5 stars due to the wonderful service i received the first time i dined here.we will be back for sure.our server (19) was not attentive, and i had to fish out others for service..if you like garlic, vacio.wait staff was excellent, food came out in the right amount of time for a medium rare steak, and the ambience was suitable for a romantic / intimate ocassion.keep up the good work guys, i wouldn't change a thing.our food did get cold pretty quickly given the low heat of the grill, but if you consume it when it's fresh, it is amazing.the atmosphere: candle lit, romantic, ambient! tables are close together, but the atmosphere is fun, you can talk to the table next to you and see what they ordered while still feeling cozy, and intimate.and if you think this is good meat boy you have to get out more.

Popped in for some lunch last week.i'm so stoked i found this gem, i can once again be reminded of the oddly comforting moment of not knowing what to eat and having the ability to go to a "safe go-to..best bar food in chicago.a def chill spot where the food is good, the drinks are flowing, and the crowd is tame.

Why would you offer a check-in offer if don't want people to use it?horrible customer service!!the food is also nothing special.we shared szechuan green beans (delicious and garlicky), 9 story pagoda chicken, pork fried noodles, szechuan beef, and some pork dumplings in a spicy chili sauce.excuse me???? i'm glad that i understand chinese so i know she tried to charge me more for rice??? that lady i know her, short her, very rude all the time..the food is really good, but the service can be hit or miss.by the end of it, we could take home the plate of chili seasoning and made a  new sauté with all the magnificent flavors from this dish.i lived in chengdu, sichuan for years.may give you an instant heart attack but the food sure taste good :)lots of people have commented on the americanized 'chinese' dishes here.so in essence you order about 75% dough to 25% chicken.

When i first started eating here it was 4 stars.the portion was pretty good and was large enough to make me super full.after a long wait of perhaps more than an hour, the food arrived.flavor on point! and college discount was a bigger bonus!.nothing fancy but clean.the food is amazing.a great experience with flavors and presentation that blew us away! if i could give it 10 stars i would, it is that good!.it is worthwhile as they provided us with generous amounts.amazing food! we ordered delivery and expected it in about an hour, but it came about half hour late.it's the kind of dish that grows on you while you're eating it.

The guacamole and chips are interesting as they give you a mix of chips that include plantains.came sunday evening around 8pm and we were seated promptly, although place was still quite busy.pretty dark and small inside.the pineapple-blood orange fruit margarita was recommended by our server and was quite refreshing.the drinks are awesome not too strong but far from weak.the mango cheesecake looked pretty but tasted not so pretty so no, this is not a dessert joint.both very good! the queso comes with tortillas yumm.i usually struggle to endorse tacos bc ya know, that's something my mom could make so why go out for them but these are not just any tacos.love this place!.

The tonkatsu ramen was divine, its broth was probably the best broth i've ever had honestly..we would be totally okay with the staff if they said we need to pay some fee for it, but basically calling us liars with this underhanded ploy was the last straw for me.ordered the seafood miso soup,  great taste however the key is seafood.omg!! it was so delicious!!!! creamy crab with rice is the best way to describe this!.loved it and located right in the heart of chinatown!.taste good but it was a little too salty.ramen is having a moment, and  strings is one of the best places around!  strings is a pretty small restaurant, but the vibe is great.slow af.the food is decent but overpriced.

I am absolutely charmed by this restaurant!  very inviting atmosphere and gracious service.very nice.you can sit there and have a meal for ever - the way meals were designed to be enjoyed compared to the quick-turn service you get at most places these days.i have dined here twice, once on their lovely patio in the summer with my partner and another time inside with a large group of friends.both delicious.i'm not talking about a few ants here and there, i understand we are sitting outside and there will be bugs, but an army of ants.the patio is also now split with cotton duck and our chairs/table were clearly less fancy and unbalanced compared to theirs.definitely not ordering gnocci again but everything else was delicious.we were kindly greeted, seated, and our byob wine was poured.nevertheless, i enjoyed it and finished it with ease.

And again, it's cheap.the environment is like walking back in time.thats all.i couldn't substitute the hash browns for bacon or anything really till i talked her into it.i heard about it from a show on the food network, but since i live in chicago, i'm sure i can find much better hidden gems around the city.solid and filling moderately priced diner food! biscuits and gravy are tasty.this is a nice and cozy place it has got that classic american diner feel.there are several parking garages nearby that are way too expensive and white palace does not validate for them, so you'll have to patronize a local retailer if you want validated garage parking.it was five of us she got everyone's order wrong and then had an excuse for every mistake she made.the gf and i came here on a wednesday evening after driving around for 20 mins debating on what to have for dinner.
The fried rice has a combination of flavors both typical of fried rice and some added fresh vegetables and some pineapple chucks..

Fun atmosphere, great selection of beer, nice size patio what more could you ask for.::beer::the beer selection is ample, and you can get pitchers of everything on tap.last night was my first time.smores, gluten-free pizza options, amazing staff and thumbs-up drinks! best patio ever.

The info about closing at midnight is nit always trie.very friendly hostess and very attentive servants.i can't speak for the main restaurant but the meals passing by looked good.the burrata was divine.the small village engraved in the brick wall is a great touch.there were no windows nor exhaust and this explained the damp odor that was lingering.we will be back and we hope to see you there.mostly small dishes to share.staying @jwmarriott easy walk upstairs and excellent meal at the bar staff was great and food very good i had the prawns and the fall butternut ravioli and it was excellent pair it with a super tuscan and rock and roll.

The food was very good, the steak medallions were melt-in-your-mouth good.i can't wait to go back!!!.it sets the stage for great bbq.we try to check out a different restaurant each visit.we had 3 kids with us.our server, paolo (i think that's his name! again, i'm sorry because i can't focus and catch his name right due to 3 cranky kids), he is the nicest human being ever.(they would not provide us with another seating option) -- the server was friendly -- but rarely checked in with us --- drinks were slowwww - appetizers and food were even slower.one meal was good.won't be back again.i do wish they had something with a garlic hit on their fries instead of the gross parmigiano fries.

Me and my friend were so impressed.pizza flavors are absolutely insane.compass has amazing craft pizza, great drinks and an amazing atmosphere.i liked the indoor decor and vibe.definitely the best bar in lakeview.

So good! we are here yesterday and i must say the hype is valid.fries came with as well, not as plentiful.most of the plates here are served alongside with either rice or fries, so you've got your carb option taken care of as well.better gyro and fries than mr.it came with a salad as well.they also only have rc products, so i got pink lemonade.this review is only for the dipped italian roast beef sandwich.let me say that i was quite hangry (hungry + angry) as it was taking a really long time for the food to be done the first time i came here.fries are delicious and the hotdog was your usual tasty chicago style dog, won't hear me complaining.ordered the chicken plate.

Nice that there's free street parking and our wait wasn't long either.:-) !i can't wait to return to try their other dishes!..service was slow but not rude.easy street parking + no wait on a saturday + kid friendly + shady patio = all wins.great decor, duper clean, friendly waite staff and great food.and if there was even a slight wait, i'd hit some other place.what a concept.i can choose my fav dishes and have it delivered in less than 30 mins.

Coffee was very smooth as she uses top quality products.we sat outside in their lovely outdoor area and shared pan de bono (which they only have on weekends and i highly recommend!) arepa blanca con queso, a chicken empanada and a beef empanada.we are visiting from vancouver washington.the columbian dogs are a sensational.another disappointment was that the chips were soggy and taste kind of stale.
Overall, a fabulous new addition to well deserved south loop.
These tacos are legit.

We came in thinking that we will not be full, but it was very fulfilling.curtis duffy has an unbelievable attention to detail whether it be the amuses, breads and bread accompaniments or the savory courses and desserts..all of the dishes were beautifully presented with many elements on each dish.all of us selected the "fauna" option but thinking back the flora would've been just as spectacular.watch the movie and then enjoy a memorable evening at grace.each dish at grace is similarly subtle and elegant and each has dozens of different unique textures.for instance, we were enamored by all of the different decanters they used for the wine pouring and they told us about the different names of the decanters and why they worked with each respective wine.they also offer cocktails menu in which i didn't see the bar, but it was exquisite.had a wonderful food experience here.

The staff is super friendly and the manager jalisa was super helpful with suggestions on what to have.this one is less crowded than the one in the loop so it feels much more relaxed.this is a great location, although the i accidentally went into the burger bar next door because construction makes the entrance a little confusing.get the seasonal sangria (peach) and thank me later.the food itself was as amazing as ever! the chicken is always so moist (i know.

I will say, like so many other ramen restaurants, you get two measly pieces of pork in each bowl; the pork belly add-on here is all but necessary if you're an adult with carnivorous tendencies.50 extra for the shio.loved it 700%..their broth as is was especially salty.one of the best authentic ramen places in chicago.the garlic ramen is great too, it has a really thick broth.but other than that, the flavor, quality and service here is good.she still prefers wasabi's veggie ramen though.i'd recommend this if you're in the wicker park area :).
The menu has very nice veg options.good cocktails too.it's one of those places where i totally don't regret having gone but wouldn't go back.service not so much.

Everyone took the opportunity to shine and they did.3 stars.everything was wonderful from the presentation, to the service, to the inventive food items.i would definitely recommend the stracciatella and the octopus, both were outstanding! for dessert, the deconstructed baklava which had a perfect amount of honey/syrup.the former was quite sweet, the later fairly tart, but combined they were heaven.in addition to the three items we had ordered, i did order a beer and a cocktail for my lady and after taxes we were looking at a +$70 bill.for a holiday on hummus, i can't stop shaking my head at the ridiculousness of a few bites of protein for $17.yummy.a small plate is really too much for two--it is just the right amount for three.the only thing we didn't try that we wanted, because it was sold out, was the stracciatella.

Manager was apologetic with the small quality glitch that i encountered (see below).quaint.the biscuits and gravy wasn't even gravy, just greasy meat on top." when we pointed out all the many tables who had come in after us had almost finished their meals she flat-out denied it in such a bratty, childish way it made my skin crawl.the menu is awesome, and i had a hard time deciding what to order.grandma j's and its diners are a bit too hipster for my taste, which is why i just can't give a full five-star review.food does take a while to come, but they make it fresh so i'm not complaining.i'd go back.this place is brilliant.i really,really wanted to like grandma j's.

Good pizza but i don't think "big" is the word i'd use to describe the chocolate layer cake.the pizza is so fulling and great! our server adriana was so nice.they have a good system to handle so many people.probably best pizza i ever had.best pizza in the world.grab a seat outside for some people watching and cute, tiny birds hopping around waiting for you to drop a crumb.excellent choice for chicago pizza..took us (a party of 4) a while to order then over an hour to be seated.more like some kind of cheese and tomato casserole**all that being said, i was thoroughly underwhelmed by giordano's.

They have couches set up which makes eating a large sandwich extremely awkward, since the table is so much lower.when we went to pick up our coffees, the barista said they had run out and asked if we wanted to have americanos instead..but go and discover what floats your boat!.the seating was comfortable and noise level was moderate which made conversation easy even during the busy lunch hour.we could be back!.great breakfast menu!! i had the green eggs and ham which is a massive portion!! the mix of ham, eggs, spinach and a light pesto make it a great option, just make sure you are hungry.we had breakfast here before visting the chicago art institute, by our michigan standards it's a very cool place.the food is fresh.

It had a good amount of flavor and was not dry.it was my second time coming here and for those two times i've came the staff is always so nice and the food is always great! the atmosphere is welcoming and it's a nice place to come with friends.the bad burger is incredible- two beef patties cooked medium ooze with deliciousness.my boyfriend got the wolf burger and it was insanely huge but he loved it.still, who i assume is the manager, came over and spoke to us to let us know that the chips were on the house because they arrived after the entree and kept his word even after we made sure he understood it was on us for ordering them late.don't think i would come back on that basis alone.i love this place!  everything i have had here from the craft cocktails to the burger, tacos, buns and mussels are outstanding.they don't take reservations so be prepared to wait on a weekend as we went at 7pm on a saturday.bartender was skilled and attentive.

The best part: drinks! they have an amazing drink menu, i couldn't decide which one to get.the service was attentive.at first glance, it doesn't look like much; an ubiquitous entrance with a couple of tables and chairs for outdoor seating, and you'd easily walk past it on chicago avenue.they were so accommodating! we had six people and my boss didn't make a reservation.cheese curds, season veggie dish, and burger were all fantastic.3 stars because of the service.

Their mission is admirable too! the menu is exciting and executed really well!!! so bummed they are closed on tues, since that is the day i am in the city mostly.arrived@10am when the doors opened & quite naturally we were seated immediately.i love the shrimp and grits, the duck skillet, the red velvet pancakes and the shrimp po-boy i had there.good service, good food, and the best red velvet cake on chicago i guarantee!i had the biscuits and chicken and it was delicious, biscuits soft and tasty and a good spicy chicken.the shrimp and grits were amazing!  not your tradition version but oh so good.some of the best food i've tasted in chicago.everything.5 rating; the lobster balls  and lime  meringue dessert were great but the main cajun shrimp entree was overcooked.

Bopngrill's burger blowed my mind!! i didn't have too high exception coming in since the store doesn't look fancy from outside.it's obviously a restaurant for privileged kids and yuppies that think kimchi is really hip.umami burger is pretty sweet! the burger melts in your mouth, kind of like a big white castle slider but bigger and way more flavor.kimchi fries were good.next time i'll have to try one of their burgers, which are supposedly really good.it was very very delicious and the portions gave me leftovers.the amount of food that you get is on the lighter side, but it's worth the extra if you just want to try a new concept in lakeview.this review is making me hungry, i think i'm headed there now.the burger was really good; the jalopenos added a great level of spicy to the well cooked patty and fresh bun.my mom only ate a couple bites of her bibimbap and my dad kept burping afterwards bc of indigestion .

They should consider adding them in.any kind of desserts will never dissapoint you! i look forward to go back everyday.really made for a great evening.went to an anniversary dinner here -  it was the perfect place! romantic ambiance and delicious food.each dish is almost like a hand crafted piece of art that is as delicious as it looks.second, the food was delicious (of course) and well-presented (especially, the plated desserts).they had quite the collection of assorted sweets to pick from.we will absolutely return because the food was so good but just plan for sitting there a long time.it ruins the whole experience.next we had the sweet corn agnolotti and the papperdelle - even better than the first course.

Now, that's how i like it!!!!.i would highly suggest it.he was very impressed and said they truly tasted like 'southern' biscuits and gravy.overall, a great little place in the neighborhood.i generally don't say anything on yelp unless i've had an especially bad experience, but this is probably my favorite restaurant in chicago right now.

I'm not the best yelper at pictures, but there weren't a lot of photos of the sandwich itself, so take a look."my knowledge of "city of brotherly love" is still at an acquaintance level, but will "philly bros," near the northeast corner of pulaski and chicago, help establish friendship between us two?first of all, let's start with the food.

For my main i had the crusted red snapper.we started the meal off on a weak note being seated in the back room of the restaurant, which ordinarily would have been just fine with us but our table was super wobbly and when we asked to move to one of the other empty tables in that room, we were told we couldn't.i can see why this place is very popular with people.and finally, their martinis are a miss only for one reason: they don't use traditional martini glasses.to finish it off, i ordered their greek yogurt cheesecake and it was huge and was honestly one of the best cheesecake i've ever had.the menu is extensive: the flat breads are fresh and delicious as appetizers.i love jean-george's restaurants, and am very familiar with abc kitchen's menu in nyc.decor is really nice and upscale.first off, the waiter recommended the ginger margarita, but we thought it was okay.wow.
Courtney and mark are the best and the food is awesome.

We both enjoyed it so much that we agreed not to finish it because we still have our burgers coming out.finally to try one of their famous burgers.but the burgers are king and they still deliver the goods.love their burgers! they were perfectly cooked, perfectly flavored, and juicy.i would say that the burger is good and huge!!! the all portion is just huge!i am not sure though i understand all the hype around this place.this place is worth the hype!  i ordered the traditional kuma burger and got a large side of macaroni and cheese to share.yes there's a wait.she was very accommodating, filled our waters constantly, made trips to our table to be sure we were taken care of and had the most beautiful tattoo portrait on her forearm.i know that most people who come to kumas are getting a giant, beef, medium-rare patty of deliciousness.i loved the menu and the burger creation.
Watch out for the creepy trucker guys during the day.i can't wait to come back to try their breakfast items as well.it's good cheap diner food, and the people are nice.

The chianti classico red wine was tarty, full bodied, fresh and grippy! sausage and peppers was a great appetizer for sausage, onions and red green peppers.the staff and owners are extremely friendly and helpful.hoping for the best.2 owners moving around filling up your water glasses.the food was great, too!.heaven.if you have not been here, you need to go.we never felt rushed and our waiter was very attentive and courteous.and he tells us - no, they don't make anything from scratch there! except for the gnochi.

Have been looking for a tasty mediterranean place and this place definitely fits the bill.nice atmosphere with front open windows and sidewalk tables.what a treat!we experienced nothing but friendly and warm customer service.very homey restaurant with comfy coaches.

We really enjoyed the free chips before when they were always fresh.the restaurant is currently closed and undergoing renovation.i'm a fan.great tacos for a good price.good, solid mexican food.still think mary's is good, but down a step from my first visit.excellent all around.it's nothing fancy but the food is great.the chips with salsa and avocado sauce is good.the green salsa is delicious and not like anything i have had before.

The meat is fresh, not salty and perfectly tender.the soup had a giant soft matzo ball and was amazing too.:)great matso ball soup, pastrami, corned beef, and..the rice pudding is not the thin greek style you get everywhere,  it's the eastern european style with cardamon and vanilla infused and thick.i have had the pastrami, corned beef, roast beef and tongue sandwich and they are all great.this place is expensive for a cafeteria and merely ok.it hit the spot.awesome new take out section.

As you can image i was super excited to hear that rodelio aglibot "food buddha" was opening is own poké shop, firefin poké a hawaiian-inspired fast-casual spot in the loop.this was a hard one for me.i've never had purple rice with poke before, but they were great together.oh mannn! came here during lunch and the line was out the door and around the corner! it took about 20 minutes to get to the front, so i was hungryyyy to say the least! i ordered the large "tree" fish bowl ($14.i think this place is a rip-off for the money you pay, the amount of food you get and the taste (wasn't that great).the staff is nice and helpful..if you are looking to mix things for lunch and try something different try poke, it's no joke.not nearly as good as aloha (in the french market) but no where near as busy.

Can i eat here every day? this meal was delicious, every part of it..the menu has changed a bit to be more sharing friendly recently and thogh i haven't treid that menu, hopeefully it takes a bit of the stiker shock you were left with after a meal.it legit took 15 minutes to get our drinks each time we ordered them.my favorite drink i tried was the "black dragon" with ginger vodka , it was very gingery and not sweet.so was trying to go to urbanbelly, the address are exactly the same.anyways, the silk shirt and dress pants were ruined and the manager told us basically to get out and that she wouldn't try to rectify the situation.very nice dining experience.everything here is enjoyable, but also nothing is really memorable.wwcd.

Just an awesome restaurant.nanadict was as good as they promised.thus, you have to make it a point when you order.eggs were on point! lovely space and very cool staff.-despite it being a small space, it was decorated very well.this place is delicious! it never disappoints.we also got the chick pea frits which had a nice creamy texture and were also a good portion size, i'm sure the other appetizers would be just as good.just say'n.the potatoes are simple, not over-seasoned..

I will try breakfast.it was my introduction to pakistani food and when ever i go to restaurants, i would compare the food to the home cooking.hidden gem, definitely go to get the most authentic food possible.do not get fooled by how it looks, just order and enjoy the food.huge portions? check.in other words, my understanding was that it's $10 no matter what.yes, there were five taxicabs parked out front when we walked in.staff is really nice and courteous.that one detail was enough to send me running but my buddy persisted that we try.not all the dishes offered were on the menu.

I'd recommend going there for a drink, to catch up with a friend, or even work on a laptop.monkey's paw is truly a neighborhood gem.solid beer selection, good food, outdoor seating.we both ordered gazpacho as a starter.

Love the guacamole and chips.i'm also a firm believer that the only reason it showed up at all was because my boyfriend called after 2 hours to see what was going on.its been 30 min since i left there this sunday 3/13 at 7pm, with my order and no one has  answered the establishment  phone.i one day hope to actually eat in the restaurant, but until i decide to change out of my pajamas, i'll just continue order delivery.good food, nice atmosphere, the staff and owners are pretty cool.every time i go, i'm never disappointed.better quality and more selection than chipotle.all i have to say is fried green tomatoes..note: the owners honor the sabbath, so they close at sundown on friday until sundown saturday (but they are open pretty late on saturday)#supportsmallbusinesses.
Solid ramen joint, that could compete with the nyc ramen, la ramen, and dc ramen that i've gorged on.

Sometimes things don't go perfectly.just like buttered noodles, but probably the least "special" even though they are know for it because of the simpleness- mussels and frites:bomb.had a fab birthday dinner with a great friend last night! we decided to venture out of the downtown area and head to logan square.great italian option in chicago, i recommend checking it out.plin - to.excellent and friendly service from anthony, our waiter.we ordered two simple dishes, and an appetizer.the steak was cooked just as we ordered and the reduction and fondue accompaniments were fantastic.other favorites include the crespella (vegetarian crepes), the cauliflower appetizer, and the halibut.except for the hard chairs made only for skinny asses.

We sent back both the squash (flavorless and soggy) as well as the brussels sprouts (too vinegary) and just gave up after trying both of those.i had to stop eating and my food got cold becouse it never came.i cannot wait to come back again soon and try some of their seafood!.even though it's a steakhouse their amazing chef made me a full vegan menu, including appetizer, entree and dessert! my fiance loved his steak, and we had a beautiful a bottle of the 1980 red they offer as part of the birthday deal (not really a "deal" it was very expensive - but worth it!), where you have a bottle of wine from the year you were born! very cool, and delicious!will definitely be back again!.i think it needed to be cooked slightly more to really melt that fat.had a great meal.while the front bars are hustling and bustling, there are three dining room areas, each with a different vibe.

The belly dog was interesting and i definitely enjoyed it, but i probably will never crave it.i crave the wheat berry bowl and the roasted chicken..it's simple, quick, fantastic service, and the belly dog is the best hot dog ever.the food was absolutely delicious and unlike anything i've ever had.very disappointed.only bright point is the soft serve with caramel and vietnamese cinnamon.they sell beer here too which is always a plus for small joints like this.not a fan of the sauce that came with it but the dog makes up for it.the pinned beer ipa was great, never had one, oh yah, before you go, have an order of freshly made donuts, covered in dark chocolate and 1 in caramel, and get a vanilla soft serve ice cream covered with vietnamese caramel.

Gyro platter - can feed like 2-3 people.family has been coming here for years! always great service and awesome food..i had to repeat myself twice as the man didn't believe anyone would order 7up.real good!.

The kids ate all their bbq wings and said the cheese sticks were good.the bartenders are friendly, although the beers kind of expensive for a dive bar.the irish spring rolls are to die for.it certainly didn't hurt that the gentleman i was with was a certain sock-deal-loving, $4-dollar-beer-or-less afficianado bargain hunter of the night.i've been going here for ahwile now, and you cannot go wrong coming here for a drink after work, meeting up with a group of friends for some food, or hanging outside on their patio.this place is so much fun, the bartender kristen made us feel at home the whole time we were here the food is excellent the drinks are good the bartenders are good.outdoor seating, (dog friendly), a grade a dive bar!.very good burger & cider.i was in the neighborhood for a work event and found myself searching for nearby eateries to spend my lunch break.but the service is awesome and i definitely recommend the wings and chicken fingers.

Delicious, not too greasy and quick.best in chicago.ordering from a window is as real as it gets.quick greasy food.for the record i love express too.stop by and give this place a try.i went here a few years ago and recalled the food being pretty decent, but we didn't enjoy it during this trip.

The seaweed salad came in a small container - it was cute and funny at the same time.- bold and spicy ramen: don't get me wrong, we ate the whole thing.really friendly staff and good service.great ramen and good atmosphere.this place is a bit small but the traffic flows so it doesn't look like the waits are too bad.server/bartender were very attentive and provided great service..i'd recommend getting either extra noodles or try some of the appetizers.was very happily surprised by this place!!came in for an early dinner around 5:45 on a friday.

Came late at night with family for dessert and they were still open and the service was speedy! the desserts were amazing.i had a croissant sandwich with sausage, egg & provolone.the mediterranean feast is always my go to with a great cup of coffee on fridays after a long work week.a real gem.just got a simple vanilla milkshake and let me tell you it is the best shake i have had in a long time.
Our waiter was awesome, too.nothing i would expect a gelato to be.they have about 8-10 filler options: salted caramel, pb&j, maple, fudge, cream, etc.will definitely be back.

Is this place real?  and can i play wow here?.makes me want to re-watch my transformers and jem episodes.if it wasn't and i'm totally off, they should make scones like that.skip bongo room and just go here!.this coffee shop is so cool !!they have random stuff from 90s and 80s.in between the damen and division blue line stations near all the wicker park actionneutral:-unique music selection (ranging from indie rock, to 80s pop, to 90s rap): it used to be pretty flawless and i'd always have my phone out to identify the songs.it's pretty obvious that if you don't fit the "hipster" criteria, they don't really want you to hang around.

The omelet tasted like any ordinary egg nothing special.i've visited this breakfast spot twice so far and have been satisfied each visit.i stopped in with very little time on my hands so i stuck with a safe order: bacon egg and cheese on sourdough and coffee.we usually have jerome as our waiter and he is one of the friendliest, professional waiters i've had.the food was good and tasty! i had the duck bacon bowl and it was amazing.always crowdy place (i prefer to eat at home) but still good service and delicious food..2) our waitress was phenomenal.decided to have breakfast there just to see how the food was.very tasty! the food was average.

We love coming to the ogden after work! every time we pop in, we are welcomed no matter how big or small the party.the portions are really big so you can definitely split most appetizers and entrees with multiple people.my review is based on last nights (september 17th) for the canelo vs smith fight.we've got winners, we've got losers (but not this year- official hawks viewing bar!!)...ijs.b.i think it's perfect to watch a sports game, there are plenty tvs and lots of space.

There are a lot of awesome places to eat in the wicker park/bucktown area (like hot chocolate, which is literally right next door!), so i'm not immediately inclined to return.we saw a sofa grouping of 4 next to a couple, and the couple looked like they were not comfortable with that arrangement, so be aware of that aspect.there were also girls in yoga pants with their mats, and someone on a computer.the thai shrimp and grits hit it out of the park.i had the stirred byrd, with pineapple infused rum, bitters and lime, and my boyfriend got the artful roger, with tequila, cinnamon and coconut.the scene is a bit older compared to other nearby establishments (estimate  greater than 40 years on average).it is not surprise that the place is always almost empty except on a weekend night, the customer service really is not great and they don't try to establish a good customer base like the prior business.rachel was fantastic and i really enjoyed the attention she payed to creating and her passion for mixing a great drink.but with other options, (more food options and more affordable prices)  i probably won't be back soon.the would walk back and forth in front of us, stand around at either end of the bar, and it was only when we started to laugh at the absurdity of what was happening did someone finally come over to get our drink order.
This time i ordered a tostada de ceviche de camaron and had never had one that grossed me out like this one.server was great.

Elotes and horchata were tasty.overall the foods are delicious.i've also had their stelote burrito which was excellent especially for someone who doesn't care much for steak..not a fanfood 3.it made my nose run.by thursday night, i was hospitalized with intense stomache cramps and constant bloody diarrhea.steak burrito bowl.

Unless you're a stuffy bad sport.they were all so funny, and when they explained the dishes it was the epitome of informal, swearing, saying how f'ing awesome the piece of fish is, etc.our thanks to chef foss and his crew for allowing our group of foodies to convince him to open up on a night he is normally off so that we could try to emulate a spectacular dinner we had with him the last time we met in chicago.great and tasty food prepared, processed and presented in a creative way, chef philip showed us his craziness and braveness on the food and the dinning environment (imagine french fries in ice cream frozen by liquid nitrogen; and use a loud speaker to amusingly introduce each course to all the eaters).beverage/food:byob is the beverage policy here, thus saving the diner a whole lot of money.the only dish i think they did not butcher the amazingness of the ingredient was the abalone.thank you!.i mean, where else can you freely wander through the kitchen, chat with the chef, bring your own wine, eat carbonated foie gras, and end the night listening to the life of brian's "always look on the bright side of life?".60 day dry aged steak.location is in creepy junkyard dog-ville.

On a recent trip there i was disappointed to have it served cold..great food, great service, and great fruit water drinks.recently came with my friend for lunch.the new menu removed many if our favorites and the quality of anything with meat is much lower than before.this place is horrible 1st time i ordered they messed up my order even after repeat it to her multiple times; i decided to give them a second chance & they mess it up yet again!! woman on the phone has horrible customer service skills & claims to be the manager.delicious salsa.i have been coming to this restaurant for a very long time.great find for authentic mexican food.
This was one of the best restaurants.
Don't let the name put you off, and don't confuse it with the nice (but lackluster) place that was in this space before.

Each tortilla is handmade to order.don't hesitate to try this great spot out.cash only.since it was our first time and we honestly wanted to try everything on the menu..the cheviche verde as an appetizer was also lovely.really love the tacos, guacamole, ceviche and the sandwiches.the watermelon, mint, lime water and their house red salsa were both outstanding, too.the chips were also a little on the salty side.

Awesome service and awesome food every time!!! i live close so i have tried everything, and can say that everything is good.we had gyros w onion rings, a cheeseburger w fries and cheese on the side, and a skirt steak dinner w rice pilaf.old school grill: clean, cheap and delicious.i especially love the chicken dinners.

The tomatoes!!! they get exclamation points from me because they're big wedges of fresh tomatoes.yelped this place from the corner and boogied on in once we saw it was 4.quick delivery and solid combo/shwarma plates.plus they have tv's so i was able to watch the bulls game which was nice.gyros are good and the greek fries are yummy as well.the place itself was incredibly clean and everything was modern.i didn't expect a $9 meal to taste this awful.always friendly, good food dished up quick, and a much needed upgrade compared to the previous place which was making for a rather dilapidated corner.this place is amazing! and this from someone who grew up on home cooked greek food! i've had mediocre food at other places that cost much more.

What more could you want?.however, chicken was dry and the kofta kabob was seasoned incredibly potent with some weird taste.the falafel sandwich was huge.walking back home i came across this place and at the time a shawarma reminded me of the doener kebabs in germany after the bars.the kafta was full of flavor & juicy.love this place.not my favourite mediterranean place.great service,good food, large potions and inexpensive.i know it's cheesy but i like fries.this place is awesome.

If you come anytime between five and 8 o'clock you'll need to stand in line for anywhere from 30 to 45 minutes and then wait 15 to 30 minutes for your order to come out.off a spit.we did take out a few weekends ago, the burrito al pastor was great! just wished is was more family friendly.the green and red salsas are so delicious.why?! i mean, why???obviously, i wasn't happy to discover this menu change upon visiting the new digs..but good tacos.i was intrigued by this restaurant because one day i drove past and there was a line outside the door.great service too.just as good as the old location only better with outdoor space.
The small burger is amazing.the burgers are huge, delicious and packed with fresh ingredients.

The best part about this place is the prices, which are really reasonable.the volcano drink was great to share & you definitely get your bang for your buck!.if mo's can get its act together when it comes to service, especially in the competitive chicago restaurant scene, it can easily become very successful.everything is the menu looks great.very good restaurant overall.shame on you, mo!!!!!!.told friends and everyone had same response " you got food poisoning at a sushi restaurant named mo's? go figure".the star of my feast were the smelts.

Mistakes happen so i called the restaurant to find out if the fish could be delivered (it's a short distance away but i don't have time to go back).i showed up at 8:06pm.however, rating it under 3 stars would be a bit harsh considering everything was still good..i have been to this establishment several times.i finally had the opportunity to eat at chicago's home of chicken & waffles and i was pleased.my friend got the catfish sandwich, which was also pretty good.why do white folks always f*ck with us.first time here and was not impressed.there's some complaints about the wait time, but we came entirely off-peak and had no issues with service or wait.

-okinomoyaki - wasn't on the menu.i ordered the kira miso ramen and it was actually spicy which i loved! the broth is delicious and the portion size is great.the ambiance is nice.i find it hard to believe reviewers would hate the food here simply because we ate with our friend who's a professional chef and cooks for a billionaire family and loved the food--but to each their own.i will be going back to try the udon next time.the prices here are fairly high.i'll definitely order here again.very good maguro (imported from the real tsukiji fish market in tokyo!) and kaki oyster.this is just so so.quality sushi.

Really enjoyed the seville skillet, but have also been back for dinner and drinks.thankfully the bus boy seemed to know what he was doing, unlike anyone else in the front of the house.the draft system was clearly not set at the right temperature or was experiencing a problem their bottle selection was definitely lacking as well..she acted as if we weren't there and became super cold.the sauce is light and has a mild tangy flavor that is balanced well & not strong or overpowering with acidity.there is a new owner, new managers, bartenders, and servers.the sauce was good and that's about it.we ordered a few things but the standouts were the friend pickles (seriously get them) and the pulled pork sandwich which was a recommendation from out lovely waitress, sabrina.they say it's open at 11am but the doors where still close at 11.

Really? an email, from an individual gmail user to another individual gmail user, with a legible body paragraph, got spammed..i will continue to come and eat.i've driven by a few times and had my eye on them.well worth your time and price paid.it is seriously like purple-crack sauce.i ordered the grilled chicken shawarma platter, which is what i always get at the other location.the grilled zucchini, tomato and mushroom kebab was delicious.

Combine that with the fact that you have to speak at least a little spanish to get by in this place (and that you are literally in this lady's ktichen) it feels authentic.the best mexican breakfast i've ever had.i have to give them props to their amazing prices.

3rd star(4 stars) for service which is the only thing they got right.this is a great casual place for friends to catch up or for families or just somewhere to grab a bite.it has a fabulous dining hipster vibe type of atmosphere.we came by on tuesday, but were too early.it took a while for the food to come, but likely due to opening weekend kinks.the music was a little too loud and it was hard to hear the young lady on the cashier.i got  the potato poblano tacos, which were really good--- i am not a vegetarian and didnt miss the meat and the guac was really good too, next time i know to ask for extra pickled radishes.too slow.get the super crunchy!.very excited they're open for lunch now too!  with alcohol things get real pricey quick, but the rosemary margarita might just be worth it.

I'm taking off "half" a star because their bread pudding was just okay.i have been eating at francesca's on taylor for about 15 years, and have always left extremely pleased and satisfied.the food is always fresh and flavorful.great bread, antipasto, dishes.i had the chicken and it was good though the rest of the food on the table looked even better.everyone else heartily enjoyed their meal.as a new yorker i am very fussy at my italian food and this restaurant was excellent.came to eat during the taylor street feast toward the end of the evening.the wine wasn't great.

I kept it simple with 1/2 of a chicken, mashed potatoes and corn on the cob.they were out of corn which i really wanted to try.oh, and this is part of what i've been calling the "walk western" path - starting down at challengers comics (or coming off of the 606), hitting margie's/quesadilla/the art of chicken/paladar for food, grabbing something sweet at gbd, hunting to get a piece of your childhood back at toy de jour, looking for oddities at sideshow gallery, and ending up at logan arcade.i would love to see other options for veggies.

We also tried a veggie flat bread that was outstanding.came here last night and must say that this place is a must try restaurant if you're looking for variation/small plate items.we also got the seasonal veggie flat bread.with bougatsa for dessert it was a complete meal.the food here was mediocre, and we had several different dishes (grilled octopus, chistoras, lamb meatballs, patatas bravas, skirt steak, and chicken thighs).but the cheese itself was quite tasty so with a better bread option i think that dish would have been much improved..first and foremost i would like to thank our server, matthew, for top notch service.

The bill will set you back a bit, but it's good to treat yourself to a relaxed, intimate evening with a great drink in hand once in a while.i am not sure if that is exactly what it was called but if you reserve a spot beforehand on the internet you will see the option for the food/beverage combo.i'm not sure if this should technically be a separate business as it is actually the hidden and more exclusive bar inside the aviary but it is definitely worth checking out.awkward low tables and mismatched furniture.his wife told the waitress to give something that reminded her of campfires and the fall.the result was complete and utter deliciousness.the office is intimate without being overcrowded, upscale without being pretentious.i had the pleasure of being invited to the office after being done with the kitchen drink tasting menu at the aviary back on march 7, 2015.) to experiment with by placing small drops on top of the oysters.in our case (we sat at the bar and conversed with the staff and other patrons a great deal, so i can't vouch for how common this is), we ordered two rounds but in actuality saw more than those two drinks come our way (a sample of a tequila i mentioned i enjoyed in my drink, a taste of a drink a bartender was working on, and a shot's worth of fernet before heading on to next), so in my eyes our roughly $100 bill was more than reasonable.

(unfortunately, i can't remember the name of this drink).i was a huge fan of the appetizer and entree though and am still planning to come here for brunch.we arranged for a mini-group brunch on new years day.all the way to the end when the impeccable hotel staff gets your car.had a lovely breakfast here, sat for 2 hours enjoying the company of long friends.thank you chef tim & chef jason for a beautiful dining experience, the meal was decadent.i can't say anything bad about this place.wholly it's my new favorite restaurant yelpers!!!!!!located on the second floor of the new langham hotel, you would not think (or maybe it is just me) that a hotel restaurant and lounge would be the destination that this place is!!!start with the service, because that's where they start; unless otherwise occupied one of the hostesses walks out to greet you if you take the "travelle" turn off the elevators (the other direction is the hotel check in), offers to take your coat and check your reservation.the bartender was super friendly and provided us with this amazing fried pasta to munch on.found it on yelp and i'm glad i did.

Had the beef brisket sandwich with memphis sauce, pickles, side of mac and cheese and sweet tea.you have never been here!?!?omgosh, you don't know what you have been missing.like chipotle, blackwood's got it down.i like their take on coleslaw since i dont like heavy mayonnaise-y versions..food is great!!! you get either beef pork or chicken and choose your sauce and side.i'd definitely go back.

My co worker and i were drivin around trying to find somewhere new to eat, when she looked on yelp and this place came up! it had 4 1/2 stars so we figured why not? the inside is a very relaxed vibe, not your typical italian restaurant.as last time, i asked for garlic, but not a hint today.we had vegans, vegetarians, and gluten free folks who were all happily catered to.the first time my boyfriend and i came here, we got a full plate of calamari and now we barely got 10 pieces on the damn plate!!!!! probably saw because we placed 2 orders so they decided to split one order between 2 plates lol.i definitely recommend this to anyone looking for some really great pasta at the most reasonable prices in the neighborhood.great service.i got the pesto pasta and it was okay but i tried my partner's dish and it was so much better! we can't remember what it was called but it was just an angle hair with red sauce.i've continued to visit this location, both for sit in and for take out.the menu itself seems to be the same, and the pasta is just as delicious! the portions are large and the pasta comes with a dinner roll, so don't worry about leaving hungry.next time i'll probably try another pasta place or the lincoln park location instead.

I ordered the little hotties and they were delicious! perhaps i'm a bit jaded but their spicy wings are barely spicy.i bought 3 boxes each of them had about 8 chicken pieces and it was about 8 bucks a meal.new to the neighborhood and decided to stop by, i was recommended by the young lady in the counter to try the little hotties with purple rice.if you're ever in the area, feel free to check this place out!.i thought there was a lot of food for the price - my boyfriend is a big eater and we did not finish.their "little hotties" are so good!!! money well spent for sure.the taste is good for the price, but i wouldn't say it's extraordinary that it worth a trip to it just for their wings, but it is definitely a good stop if you are in the area and looking for something quick and tasty.just sayin').and while i did really enjoy those little hottie's, it broke my heart when i couldn't get what i wanted.
Highly recommend.great coffee..order a coffee with milk and one sugar.

The steak is really good.but definitely enjoy the chips and salsa.prices are completely reasonable.their salsa is just *killing* it.big fish chunks.more hipsters are getting put on to this spot but don't let that fool you! this is my favorite spot for birria anything and pozole.actually 3 tries within 1 week :) each time i got the 3 taco dinner.literally,  everything was delicious.very good tacos.

The only negative comment i have is that the waiter but the food and atmosphere were both very nice.the atmosphere is better though, love the outdoor seating too.our table was in the middle of the floor, and waiters would bump into our chairs, balance trays over our heads.all stated that their dishes were spot on.my daughters favorite is the  conchiglie alla sarda.i hope to go back to check out their dinner selection.will be back here again the next time i'm visiting chicago!.

Managers were attentive and helpful though.all the staffs are friendly, and it's inexpensive compare to other popular, pricy restaurants with worse sushi.the only disappointment i have is that living just blocks away, i didn't try this spot sooner!  we started off with some tuna truffle thing.the fish was delicious and fresh in each dish, which is arguably most important, but the other components of each dish didn't add much--maybe even detracted from the full flavor experience.i absolutely loved the cilantro in the sushi.hopefully waitress will be a tad more attentive.service was great, toned down but attentive.

Not having to worry about the balls helped too.looking for a sports bar, found a bonus with a bar full of ping pong tables, tvs, great bar and staff!the 1/2 lb bounce burger was awesome!  prepared perfectly.super fun place for a date (especially if your competitive like my boyfriend and i ) i'm the undefeated foozeball champ btw ) :)  or to hang out with friends for a fun night on the town.didn't know a ping pong place can be so fun! tons of ping pong tables and 1 rio 2016 official table.acebounce was much cooler than i expected.plenty of ping pong tables available.

Food was great.i would say its on par as the boiling crab that's in la, and the angry crab that's farther up north.now the shrimp were large, tender and excellent.it's quite mild cajun.within the city and the suburbs, i have tried angry crab, the boiling crab in skokie, lowcountry, and the crazy crab in streamwood..they even provide salt, limes/lemons, and pepper.tried the shrimp basket with fries and the seafood pad see ew; both were solid and the noodle bowl was freakin' huge for $12..i've been to the mother ship in las vegas, the restaurant, now chain,  that started this seafood in a bag movement.
