It looked like only 1 server for about 6/8 tables ( server was nice but seemed a little off) the food was good drinks were nice and strong! the only thing i would complain about is service lacked!.12/10 recommend!.don't waste your time here.the only reason this doesn't get 5 stars, is the ice tea tasted a bit off, like it was made with tap water.the chimichanga's, mojito's, ceviche and rollins manchegos are delicious.we brought family here on our last visit, and i was a little embarrassed.great mojitos and pisco sours.the overall atmosphere was very welcoming and i hear on fridays after 10 they move the tables creating a dance floor for live latin music.for dinner we got the enchiladas which were your standard enchiladas.i would come for the food again though.

Plus, people here are smoking, regardless of the "no smoking" sign on the wall.i think i'll have to order this same bowl again next time and maybe even try a different noodle.everything was delicious, and it was also very inexpensive..best chinese beef noodle soup i've had in chicago.

Delicious and filling.since this place is so close to my apartment, i'll sure i'll come back here soon for more indonesian food.i love it when it's easy!the restaurant itself is small but has a lot of character.we'll be coming back and recommending!.as an indonesian who's been living in chicago for the past 7 years, i *dream* about authentic indo food.holy delicious.if you're thinking of eating someplace new, i recommend giving rickshaw republic a try.most of the dishes have a slight sweet taste but super fresh and flavorful.

This would be a great place to bring family and friends.the wife had boasted chicken that was awesome.great job..the fish fry is the best i've ever had!  we also enjoyed the reel of old hamms commercials.

The food is very good ,but i don't understand why it take 1hour half to delivery to my house when i'm only 5,10 minutes a way.will return & bring some friends just for that amazing jibarito!.the service was impressive and they always made sure we had everything we needed.the ordering process and the time the food came out was pretty quick.a previous time i called in an order for pick up, the girl who i spoke to kept talking to other people while i was ordering and my order ended up being wrong."great puerto rican flavors"..the mofongo de camarones criollos very good.it all went away when we got our dishes.i will not be ordering from here again!!!.

The main course was lobster stuffed ravioli.the texture became a little overwhelming after awhile.the husband got a seafood dish, and that was great too.not sure why it has less stars.i'd definitely go back.one note - this place is a firm believer in garlic.kind of pricey.it's a very intimate environment and the food is amazing, my husband who is a picky eater nearly licked the plate lol.service could be better.they also had an impressive list of bourbon drinks, which we also loved.

I had one of the currys and it was so good that i took the extra sauce home to have on my own rice and chicken..love this place! awesome decor, very clean and great prices.the food was just really disappointing.i'm always skeptical to try asian restaurants since i'm asian myself so i have super high standards for asian cuisines.com.i live so close and want to like it so badly! service is atrocious and everything i've ordered had been borderline flavorless and a total let down.i'm not a huge fan of basil but the flavor was good.trendy while staying true to traditional asian cooking, this is a place i will be sure to visit again!.it was so good.

Amazing food, great innovative mixed drinks.the cheese for the quesadillas was clearly very high quality and the pancakes had a perfect consistency.food: the guac trio was great, you could tell the guac was made fresh.these tapas are also too small, they are literally bites.they have indoor and outdoor seating.

While focused a bit more on its cocktail, beer and wine offerings (as the long bar would indicate) they offer a lovely menu of sharing plates that we enjoyed immensely: the highlights being the brussels sprouts, farm green salad and hangar steak.great atmosphere for small groups and perfect pastries (best i have had in the city yet).beautiful outdoor patio.

The mac & cheese was bomb.the waiter recommended the mac and cheese but to be honest i was disappointed.two of us split the fried chicken, the man n cheese, and the fried pickles.the cool chicago breeze kept us comfy all evening.the waitstaff is very friendly and they have a really good beer list too.dark lit room for sure.we will be back to try their signature burger.i had the garter girl for my drink which basically tasted like a strawberry smoothie.and their prices are very reasonable.

(i.go there.i absolutely love rosal's.we eat early at 5:00 on a saturday and not surprisingly there were only a few people dining.i did not expect fawning service (i don't like that anyway) but it was only after we had been waiting 20+ minutes for our entrees that she strolled by to say that the delay was because of the steaks we ordered (note: the restaurant was only 2/3 full, and it doesn't take 20 minutes to cook a steak).no foo foo here, just lots of good food.this was one of my favorite restaurants during my week of vacation in chicago.i ordered the fried spaghetti and was shocked to see that it didn't have a thicker sauce to it.wish we'd gone somewhere else for a bday dinner.

Chinese restaurants in midwest have a great potential, this little sheep in chicago is a great example.great food selection.seriously, this is the worst hotpot i ever had in my entire life.the lamb, beef,  beef pancake, beef tendons, and housemade shrimp balls all really stood out.the owner thoroughly explained everything and was very helpful!i will definitely return!.this is one of the most famous hot pot chain restaurants in china, and by far the most delicious i ever had in the states, especially the hand-made shrimp balls.

So sweet yet not overwhelming.i also really liked their lechon meat! i got a platter and it the lechon was flavorful and juicy.just grab 2 sandwiches amongst your group and take a few bites as a mid-afternoon snack.also tried the jalapeno hummus and the portion was very generous and came with bread but wasn't super spicy, tasted more like plain hummus than jalapeno but still tasty.perfection! seems that most yelpers come here for lunch and dinner.at the suggestion of one of the employees i had the cubano sandwich.there's a bunch of disinterested workers who look like they don't want to be there.it should be thick and creamy.their cafe con leche was good, but a bit too sweet for my taste.bathroom: unknownstaff: the cashier was friendly, the food was prepared rather quickly, and they even had a guy taking orders from the semi-sizable line that had formed so that, before you paid, your food was already in the works.

Was here during a very busy weekday lunch.i liked it here but i messed up my selection.surprisingly, the flavors really blend well together.the portion of the turkey was generous and the combination of ingredients was just right.unique sandwich choices.

I had been really excited to go to this place as i lived in argentina a few years back.the deal was a very good bargain! if they had it, i would do it again!!!the second time we had the parrillada para dos and nothing else.can't think of a reason not to love this place.couldn't think of one issue here.gorgeous, warm, inviting, a tad dark in the evening as each table is lit by candlelight and the overhead lighting is minimal.the overall pricing is execellent considering the portion size, we will be back soon!.some of the best steak i've ever had (el filet medium rare).not to mention a generous price on these steaks.

I'll definitely be back from some more lobsta!ps please bring back the 1/2 roll and cup o soup combo! thanks for honoring it since it's on your online menu!.it was moist and toasted perfectly.loved it.i couldn't even eat the roll.this was a great tasting, very fresh, tender lobster roll and i thought priced right.taste of maine is a good sampler.

The beef was lackluster and i didn't taste any coconut in the "coconut" rice.delicious asian-latin fusion.great prices, cool menu, very unique offerings, not a chain for lunch in loop, thats always nice!was checked in on twice while eating making sure everything was good, always appreciate great service.great fries! still yet to try few other dishes.the staff was friendly and very helpful as we decided between our options.

The berry and brie burger, bbq burger, and the cheesy beer sausage fries were delicious.and their onion rings are on point too.tip: if you have your heart set on au cheval but the hours-long line doesn't appeal to you, this place is located just down the block!.great start! he was super sweet and was the perfect balance of attentive without being hovery.great brown butter ice cream.great burgers, small  beer selection, and fast and friendly service.

I tried the carne guisada with arroz con gandules and it was good.pile on the love for the jibarito.so far this place wins.after reviewing several photos and reviews online i was drooling for a fish jibarito - a classic of chicago.had a great lunch here.our food came quickly and our waitress was sweet, she even helped give us tips during our heads up game!they're byob so we made ourselves some rum and cokes to go along with our delicious meal.the best place to eat puerto rican food in the midwest, including chicago.the tostones and garlic oil are like grabbing clouds from the sky and eating them, simply bliss.

Excellent tapas, hand-cut jamon iberico de bellota and a bodega full of rioja and priorat.i'm sure you won't be disappointed.please please please try estrella galicia, spanish "blonde" beer.went here on friday with a group of friends.i stopped in here for lunch yesterday and was pleasantly surprised by the decor which took me back to barcelona! the tapas was delicious and the service was great.

:).to die for.crunchy tortilla chips mixed with fluffy scrambled eggs and topped with salsa, crema ranchera and queso fresco.this is the perfect neighborhood joint - it's sunny and full of plants and nice people, the service is friendly and efficient, it's inexpensive and tasty.not a big menu but food is good.

They actually provide two separate menus when dining.both were incredible.-chicken cuban sandwich: it was delicious, i'm not a big pork eater so this alternative was amazing, right amount of mustard, pickles and the cheese melted, the bread was hot and toasty.this place makes me feel happy.the waitress is rude and complacent, and using my groupon was an absolute nightmare.the order did take about 1.i come for the food not for that guy to be rude.we ordered it for pickup and the service was good.the food was delicious! the service was extremely friendly.

The place was very loud and we could barely hear each other unless we yelled.alas, we missed the lobster roll, which could have been made 2 ways, your choice.jimmy butler and thomas rhett were having a dinner party while we were there.it isn't very chicago-y but that's what makes it special.there's no beach sadly.let us start with how great the venue is.bread was slightly too thick and not toasted enough so it started to fall apart.look--if you can come here for a work happy hour and not pay any of your own money, do it, but even then, i would recommend eating elsewhere after milking your firm for free drinks.good lord the food was so good!cocktails were just summer in a glass.

Everyone seemed adept and able to jump from polish to english, as required.when we put down the deposit the owner agreed to let us have the ceremony at the restaurant in the event of rain, she was true to her word and saved our day when our yard became a mud pit.i absolutely love this restaurant.i'm more than satisfied !highly recommend this place!.had some polish beer and a macallan 12 yr for dessert.excellent food.portion sizes are great.i will say you must try the potato pancakes-- so good!.i really loved this place.our special for two people: 3.

I really wanted to rate it higher, i really did.the chorizo was slightly tastier than the lamb sausage in the other dish.here's some bulletin points:-terrible communication between employees-lack of ingredients for their special cocktails-uneducated about their own menus-half chicken was undercooked.please consider all reviews past may 2016 as invalid.the fries were crisp, every last one! and the best part was that they were still crisp the next day?!overall, a great bite to eat and would love to go back and check out brunch.it's more like 2.rick's team is pumping out incredible dishes like the "bbq brisket hash"  which i honestly feel bad for anyone who hasn't experienced it yet.had a fantastic meet and greet on opening night, great addition to the neighborhood.there were a total of 8 tables and 3 servers.having been one time before, we thought of this place to take an out of town friend for dinner to kick-off our last hoorah saturday night.

Additionally some pieces of chicken weren't as crispy as as others, though that might also be partly because we did takeout and waited a bit for the sauce to soften things up.worth making the trip out of the city.there is simply too much rice and not enough vegetables in these bowls that makes them not enjoyable to eat.souel sassy is excellent.actually walked passed it and had to backtrack a block.the seoul sassy sauce lived up to the hype.if you've got a big appetite, you'll be able to eat more than 5.

I have had good experiences and decent ones.great burgers, great breakfast.i'd definitely come back and try the david's special.10am on a saturday for 3 and the wait was at least 30 minutes if not more.nom:-huevos rancheros-chilaquiles-snickers french toast-brisket hashyay:-who doesn't love a restaurant decorated with paintings of ron swanson? parks & rec fans, rejoice.i was one of those people :) i had been meaning to try this place for a while now.we can legit close our eyes and point on the menu and it will be great.

The kale and grits taco is fabulous! i have been craving it ever since i tried it for the first time last week..sketchy math.5 stars for the drinks and beers1 star for tacosgranted i was here on $2 taco night, but from what i was told they are the same tacos that are on the menu every other night.this place rules.yes - that is right - a grits and kale taco.very good food.great corner spot.fun and casual.

Had the pleasure of having yet another fantastic meal at goosefoot!there isn't much to add about the food.seasoning, temperature and textures were balanced.the meal.as others have mentioned, the only fault of the meal was the pace.i honestly have never had a better meal in my life.thank you chris and nina!.just expect a long evening.

Nothing here is put on tap without scrutiny.i ordered the chicken wings extra crispy really loved that too.what every neighborhood bar should be.repeat food is not good.just saw this joke of a response.i fell into a few new old fashioned's (their spin on the old fashioned, if you're brain dead) and really enjoyed them.i was not the one who was asked to move my chair twice, i was asked once in a rude manner to move it 3 inches and i offered you the option to move the chair where you feel comfortable and that is when you cursed at me.a nice break from the crazy wrigley bars.5pm on a beautiful summer sunday.
55, we will be back and likely sooner than later!!.

Awesome food and the portions are huge! 15 bucks will buy you and a friend a lunch you won't be able to finish.awesome customer service.i've always appreciated the quality of food and friendly customer service that chop suey brings to the table.their orange chicken and crab rangoon are delicious staples if you aren't up to trying something new, too! the portions are huge and they also offer tasty fruit smoothies..

I've had my fair amount of pizzerias here in chicago and this one was definitely up there.lastly, i highly recommend that they restaurant takes down those tacky holidays lights that are hanging outside the restaurant.great food, great atmosphere!!! very authentic.food is great! waiter esteban has a great personality.stopped in for a quick drink.

Both times i visited i had stellar drinks that my server picked out for me.these bartenders are some of the best i have ever seen: friendly, knowledgeable, and  knew the "moves" of making a mean drink.located on the 18th floor of one of the northwestern hospital buildings, green river serves delectable fare with a great view of the city.be careful, there are many garages around the hospital.take union square hospitality group restauranteur danny meyer and the folks that created new york's award winning bar dead rabbit (one of my top favorite bars in the country) and you have an amazing combination with a great foot into chicago's restaurant scene.she asked, are you feeling safe or adventurous?!  i said lets go for adventure today!  the drink she mixed was great.the dishes were well prepared and well garnished.if you know what i mean.

This place was everything! we spent the morning at half acre for a brewery tour and needed a place to help us get over the boozy feeling we had.:(.the chicken and grits come with buffalo honey sauce and a fried egg on top.omg! we finally got to check out hbfc and it was nothing less than amazing.the food is good, but be prepared to pay a bit more than you might expect for fried chicken.delicious food! billed as soul food it's decadently delicious and it's sure not to disappoint.this is the type of place where you come back multiple times to try the full menu.can i eat here everyday?! this was my very first visit to hbfc and it won't be my last.a little pricey for the amount of food that you get, and the sides are a tad small too.

What's not to love about tortas? they have a unique selection and while they are a little expensive they are definitely worth it.enhanced with pineapple, avocado, grilled onions, cheese, fried egg.we got a chicharito and a bomba, both were really different from anything that i have had at other torta places.5 stars? really? what did you get?i got bread.the actual restaurant is very simple and inviting.we had lunch & dinner at dona torta chilanga today  huge mexican sandwiches.huge in flavor.

Can't wait to come back!.the place is not as fancy but they obviously put all their pride and excellence in their magnificent dishes.i haven't been obsessed with sushi since ever.i hate uni) but if you love it, i'm sure theirs is the best you can get.to be able to try the greatest number of dishes we did one of the market omakase ($110) and one of the original omakase ($65).you get what you pay for and its not cheap.

Had a mango freeze to drink!! was so delicious and very authentic!!.our waiter also failed to mention that unshelled shrimp is $3 more than shelled or that they charge per person for rice.i'll also be posting pictures and videos..food was in small portion and under standard.i had sample their beef chow fun a couple of days ago and it was so freaking good.everything was delicious from the fried rice to the soft shell crab to pork tenderloin to sesame chicken all really yummy and highly recommend.the service was very friendly and quick.but we came back last week and the food was not so good.

Very light and refreshing.i can't imagine what it would feel like to be any of my neighbors; lower income people of color that have lived here for years.i cannot say enough about this place.nice place.everything we ordered from the dinner menu we did not regret! started with some olives (unassuming appearance but interesting cure/pickling flavor that made them stand out more than normal), shared the romaine and bacon salad, which despite it having bacon still felt pretty light and really nice.we could not finish it all and brought home the leftovers.it is always a treat for us to discover a restaurant that has focus.3.then try the avocado toast with a kiwi and shallot relish and add poached eggs.our order started with coffee and a blueberry croissant.

Additionally, i felt that they did not care about my condition by hanging up on me.the spicy, or the winter ramen with the poached egg.the good: the servers are friendly / the service is good.the udon was too perfect and loved the mush soup but i felt it was a tad bit too salty.it's just that good!!! we got the lychee martini which was soooo smooth.ordered delivery to my office since i was working on a project.ate here with a friend, as i recently moved in down the street.shrimp tempura in dragon roll was very dry.it was like eating spinach spaghetti.we ordered the highly recommended spicy roasted garlic pork ramen, a half chicago roll, a spicy scallop hand roll, and hamachi nigiri.

If they continue to negligently retain incompetent employees who drink on the job and are incapable of performing their assigned duties, then they are eventually going to fail.this place needs higher reviews.the best wild game restaurant ever.we ordered the frog legs for an appetizer-frog legs aren't flavorful by nature and the corn/watermelon relish that came with them only emphasized their soggy lack of flavor.had the wings and sausage.if you put a burger on the dinner menu it should meet a certain standard.i love this place for atmosphere and menu, but if you're looking for new orleans style shrimp and grits this isn't the place.seriously takes pride in his craft.i went one sunday for a brunch day party which was kept on the second floor as a private event.of course i had to try it here & compare it to the way my grandparents used to prepare it.

We loved everything about this place.fire cake for dessert was well worth the indulgence.i believe it's call "al asador.the gnocchi was too small a portion sizes for the  $22 price and the beef short ribs only were 3 pieces for $32.the support staff were like ninjas, our tables was cleared and reset in no time! the room was energetic.

I would rather pay less for a smaller portion.it was exactly what three stars means, a-ok; not bad, but will probably look elsewhere for sushi.the food was amazing and very delicious.the sushi are out of this world and the service is always very nice.from the server who remembered us after only one previous visit to the fresher than fresh sushi and perfectly-prepared succulent ramen, this is a little slice of japan heaven right here in lincoln park.the fish is so fresh, the sashimi sliced perfectly, and the broths in every ramyun have just the right amount of seasoning.there were a lot of noodles..

This is not the case here.this place has a chain restaurant feel to it and the wait staff made it seem like it was a burden that they were there.but seriously., and the corn fritters had an odd flavor.fantastic place for bbq..ribs were amazing, and mac and cheese was one of a kind, i loved them.but not the best bbq i've had.with poutine, chicken and waffles (sundays only), and po boys on the menu, it's no wonder that you can easily become the fat kid at the table and order several items.overall a really great dining experience.

I love the fact the the owner roger walks around and greets every table.it was a light sauce, not a typical "american" italian restaurant, it tasted very authentic.chicago has so many well established italian restaurants all over different neighborhoods, there's so reason to go to any chains or somewhere downtown.try the calamari! only place i've had it in the city that does it just right.overall we had a good meal and our server, lisa, was very nice.pork chops were off the hook! o_o.he makes you feel at home and always makes sure that your dinner or event is nothing short of perfect.shout out to the chef! had the chicken parmesan and gnocchi.just a small place in the middle of a block with a almost hidden entrance.we had lasagna, it was so salty we couldn't get through more than a bite each and we had a spicy seafood pasta that tasted like bland tomato sauce with a lot of crushed red pepper in it.
Atmosphere is clean and simple.the location is awesome.menu is super simple, which is great.there is a nice outdoor patio too.

In addition, the fries with garlic aioli on the side were yummy.the reason was a little weak for the small glass.don't call it something it isn't and try to charge $14 for your misnomer.this very well might be the best burger in chi.it was the worst times.highly recommend! also our waiter was wonderful, helpful, and friendly!.wine selection was good!.while the address is wabash, it's entrance is on the rush side of the building.this place is upscale and delicious! fresh menu daily.i would've liked to taste more robust garlic.

I also had their grilled calamari.thank you for a tasty dinner!!.super tasty.we sat outside and it was marvelous with the market lighting.but after devouring his dish, he started helping me with mine!i bought a groupon ($20 for a $40 voucher) which they had no problem with accepting!!! we all know that doesn't happen everywhere.i regret i waited so long to give it a try.as we walked past dining patrons we noticed a small cozy room that reminded me of a 19th century a study.even though we had reservations, a couple more people tagged along and we ended up having a bigger party the last minute.they also have not only sent a coupon for our birthday, but even our half-birthdays with a note on the envelope.

We had the zucchini, uni, pici, carrots, potatoes and bavette, and finished with the blueberries.good service.the fact that someone has to physically move the table into the middle of the restaurant so i can get up to even go to the bathroom is unacceptable.we had the crab, broccoli, eggplant (must get), tortellini, and ribs.atmosphere is really nice too - cozy and crowded but you can hear the other person across from you.
My favorite the classic #6 double cheeseburgers  fries and a drink  for 8.loved this place since i've discovered it.this place is great, lincoln park hotdog shop feel in humboldt.

The total for my party of four less gratuity was $126.the manager was just as pleasant.it's worth it! the only reason earl's is losing is a star is because of their staff.starter: sushi, with bits of mango and avocado.i sampled the dynamite shrimp roll with avocado, shrimp, and mango which was light and flavorful.luckily the royale with cheese was truly heavenly.their hvac unit, actually the whole building had an issue, therefore there was no heat and it was 55 so we had to eat with our coats on.my girlfriends and i had lunch at earls around 1pm on a friday.we stopped in for a drink and appetizer during the afternoon and wanted to just sit outside and enjoy the great weather.i originally game them 1 star for service since we waited for about 20mins when their is no one in the restaurant is unacceptable! but once we got our service it was great!  avie was our server and he was amazing!  he apologized for the confusion and service and automatically tried very hard to rectify the situation by offering a free meal on them for the horrible service and confusion on their part!the food - everything is in house made, which we really liked!  i loved the fact they make in-house soda's they are yummy!!!! definitely try their in house soda's!!!   i don't drink soda's at all and its rare that i drink any kind of sodas because it has mostly garbage stuff- high fructose corn syrup, potassium benzoate, and etc.
Each bite would be heavier than the previous which i knew i could have been good after just 3 on my own.overall, it's a bit pricey, but good.

Food is average.it's in pilsen and thankfully we went on a day with ample nearby street parking.the chicken had good flavor but was overcooked and dry.beans are so-so.really nice staff also.$8 a head is pretty sweet!.also the staff is super friendly.

Naturally, i had to stop to taste the cannoli.i ate the cannoli about 25 minutes later.i finally stopped in for lunch and it was quite good! the place was packed at noon.this bakery is very close to my work and have had some catering orders for meetings and such.cool little bakery and plenty of lemon head variants as well! a little bit of a hike but a nice stop.the service just leaves you wanting a little more.so, come here for lunch but get your sweet treat fix elsewhere.when this place goes out of business, i have no doubt they'll blame it on "the changing times/neighborhood, e-commerce, costco, etc.maybe next time.it wasn't the worst carrot cake i've ever had, but it was close.

I came here with my mom and sister since we have heard some great things about their burgers.heard a lot about the burgers, so i decided to get a carry-out meal.awesome burger i must say, i got the garlic parmesan fries with black bettysmoked bacon, bleu cheese, homemade fried onion straws, buffalo bleu sauce..for all the hullabaloo when this opened i was hoping for a lot better.just as their array of burgers greatly varies, so does there craft selection.the buns were yum and the fries were delicious.don't let some of these wide shots fool you.mang.why not give it a try.

Its good stuff, and worth the price.i'll vouch for the cuban sandwich, if you're lucky you'll get a few sweet potato tater tots in your side selection :).it was fine.it's a wonderful place for happy hour and a the food is very solid.it's relaxed, professional, and tasty.the patio here is money; food is average, but there's no incentive to be great when you are in the loop and serving $12-$14 cheeseburgers anyway!  i will say, a bit of a surprise--my colleagues enjoyed their ahi tuna salad and the veggie version of the santa fe wrap, so i'm sure we'll be back since our new office opened just a 10-minute walk from here.try rivers in the cme building across the street, they typically seat  you within 5 minutes and food is great, sans the attitude!.the food is great as well, stop in, you won't be mad you did.great upscale sports bar/restaurant to stop by afterwork or on a work meeting.came with tater tots as well, which is always a favorite.

It was an unusually late hour for dinner so most of us were starving.bartenders know the menu and where all the ingredients come from.i would definitely head back to o&e.great aftertaste!black ink squid linguini: this was an overall great dish! everything tasted fresh and flavorful.the burger comes with a large patty and caramelized onions.tasted perfect.oysters are hard to fuck up, admittedly, but nonetheless very very good.

Also, it's appropriate for older kids (over 10 or so, only because it's a fairly long evening) and especially kids who like musical theater and live performances.food was good but i wouldn't be handing out any michelin stars to them.great time all around.the very intimidating bouncer helped me out of my  taxi and escorted me into the "garage" and gave my boyfriend a hard time  :'p  once inside (after being escorted arm-in-arm by one of the actors) our host, vito, kept coming over to chat.the staff wear prohibition era duds which adds to the ambiance of the place.

Let me preface this review by stating that i have been dying for a vacation in the tuscan countryside for a while now (and i'm hoping to go next year!).diego, our server, was attentive, friendly and very good at his job.as a vegetarian, i would just advise that you be prepared for a limited selection and do not use the online menu to get an idea what is served at a tavola.i highly recommend this hidden gem!.white-cloth tables that seat four, in a room that's full but not crammed.so after all that waiting, we only take a few bites of our food and then sit for 25 minutes with our plates in front of us waiting for our waiter to return.very intimate place for a sweet date with your s.our waiter was great, too - and we were lucky to have him.mind you, i went on v-day but it does seem like more of a place for couples or maybe a double date.

I tried the spicy tofu and.also i've never had the korean options (japchae, bibimbap, etc) but they're definitely ordered less frequently by other patrons.the huge bowl of soup and all the fixin's set me back just under $10 and i feel very satisfied.3..good day..if you're desperate for pho, this isn't bad, but there are better places in the word - just not many in chicago.on warm days the best option is bibimbap, which makes up for the lack of a hot stone bowl with a huge variety of vegetables.

My favorite dish is lengua (tongue) taco and fish taco.gracias!.i also believe it is family owned/operated which gives it a nice friendly feel.staff was courteous and kind.i ordered takeout from here a couple of days ago.simple authentic, yet deductible.credit cards accepted with an $8 minimum purchase.talk about lazy! regardless of how the meat is prepared and what toppings are included you still end up with a tough chewy tire that there is no excuse for.i would try to come here for work when i had time to, and i haven't been disappointed yet!.be patient with the young ladies on the phone.

No problem, there was plenty of good options on the menu so we picked something else.he received two and a bunch of brussels sprouts to fill up the plate.the bad: the menu is great, but somewhat limited.byob! no corkage fee.very impressed with the flavor of the food and the establishment itself.service was also extremely friendly and stopped and chatted with us for a while about the byob laws in chicago (hb is byob).made a same-day reservation for 8.we will 100% be back here and i highly recommend checking this place out!.the ambiance was intimate and the service was great.two of my friends got lamb burgers and seemed to enjoy them enough.

Thank you.my family (and kids) also enjoyed the mutter paneer and sag paneer.oh, and their samosa was among the best i've had, with a perfect breading to filling ratio.this is easily the best place to eat in hyde park.i've been coming for almost 3 years now since i've been in hyde park.is this the greatest indian food i've ever had?  no.however, the price seems to be expensive given that it's a fast food setting with mediocre setup.the food was very good for a 'fast food' indian restaurant.the renovated they're space it looks a lot more bright and fresh, much more appealing that the old place.

Wont regret it.my mouth and lips stung mildly after eating this, and i felt no need to make it much hotter.pretty good hot pot for chicago.the 烧饼 (sesame bun) was not freshly made or authentic.anyways, the ribs are crispy and well seasoned in the familiar cumin spices a la lamb skewers.maybe because we ate all anyways.first off.the shrimp dumplings had no flavor or texture and i had to ask the server what they were.the sauces were unique and there is a nice variety.

Another one of the famous chicago thin-crust pizza places, newly available in the southport corridor near my house.nice setting in a neighborhood that's safe to walk in.instead of pizza, coalfire should say they serve "lightly cooked dough with a light glaze of bland tomato sauce, a sprinkling of cheese and haphazardly administered toppings you will need to balance atop each slice.the real let-down though were the toppings.i see why everyone was raving about it.we came away thinking this was one of the better pies we had.the pepperoni and ricotta is definitely a favorite, but you really can't go wrong with any pizza.cozy place, great pizza.we are vegetarian so loved that they had two vegan pizzas, a missed opportunity though as they did not serve any of the vegan 'meat', just vegetables.i felt like i was eating a crepe more than a pizza.
When in chicago midway this is usually our stop..wasn't the freshest tasting either.what a steal for airport food!definitely worth the stop if you have time before a flight.

The food: 4/5.we actually had two waitresses, as our first went on break.especially at night!!!.they were wilted and charred so the texture was new and with all the yogurt and pesto they were delightfully creamy.it was the best kind of girls date you could have! we both raved about the food (the best salmon on toast i've ever had!) and the beauty of the entire house.the concept of turning part of a hardware store into a cafe is such a unique and amazing creation.i have to say this is probably one of the most beautiful places i've ever brunched at.i attended several private events here before it fell into decay and closed.
Definitely will come again.do not go there and do not use their wifi.we definitely noticed how great the service was for a casual restaurant..

This place is awesome! they have raw and cooked food.very yummy food, and great smoothies.i ordered a sweet serena that has lemon apple ginger kale and cucumber in it can't wait to taste it!i am new to the vegan world, it did not taste good to me.it tastes just like the mango one from mcdonalds.couldn't even drink a quarter of it before throwing it away.also, be aware that prices for everything lean to the more expensive side, even compared to other health food stores in the hp area.they immediately could tell i had not been there before and was extremely helpful when it came down to picking the right choice off the menu.she's incredibly knowledgable and kind enough to share her knowledge.

Just stopped in for the first time and it was a feeding frenzy.wow.wouldnt recommend.i've always ordered for pickup food is outstanding, fresh, and flavorful.doner kebab plate was big, doner nice and moist, flavorful, not too gamey, pilaf and couscous aplenty.

It's kinda pricey.threes good sized tacos each with a large piece of battered fish with slaw and two sauces: avocado and chipotle mayo.the service was great both times we went.no lie.it was a bit spicy which was nice.the dinner was delicious.i definitely like the vera mango over the mescal mule.also somewhat limited food/beverage/condiments available.this place is a hidden gem! located north of fullerton on clybourn.

I had a carry out from this place a few weeks ago.a new hole-in-the-wall favorite! the restaurant is located on the outskirts of chinatown, and like my fellow yelpers said, it's pretty sketchy on the outside.they offer whatever they're able to buy that day from the market, so the menu is different all the time.
We are new to the neighborhood and we're looking for a new tai place and came across this place.chef was able to accommodate vegan requests.it's authentic and fresh.
Once again, they did not disappoint!highly recommended!.

While starting out our night by uncorking our two bottles of red wine and requesting multiple bowls of olive oil/parm for our bread, the server enthusiastically suggested we order the mussels special for our app (not on the menu).when we finally got our table, 30 minutes went by without anyone coming to bring us water, utensils, bread, or take our order.there was something a bit off about this place but others seemed to be enjoying it.and don't forget to try the tiramisu.exemplary service.there is a package store right across the street where you can get wine/beer/alcohol that is very convenient.i love that it's byob.i recently went to ciao amore once more and they really need to hire more staff.the notion of homemade pasta and chocolate sauce writing is ample ammunition to entice a date to join you at ciao amore but then it's just not that impressive after that.there was so much sauce i couldn't even see the pasta - but it had good flavor.

We were happy with our choice to eat here.however maybe the other tables were all reserved.they looked delicious.we were so addicted to both locations; at some point that we used to go all weekends.i had the branzino and shared the short rib.this review is only for the coffee shop since that's what we did on out first visit.i like that the menu has lots of options from healthy (lots of hearty salads) to indulgent.we both ordered a specialty juice that were also great.

I highly recommend the calabrese.delicious wood fired pizza and friendly service! they claim to get all of their ingredients straight out of italy.my favorite - the truffle burrata from the pizze bianche and the due carne from pizze rosse sections.very spacious interior with a variety of brick patterns give it a cozy yet vast feel (sounds strange, but it's awesome!).i then, very frustrated at this point, took my first bite into this soggy mess.some of the best crust i've ever tasted.love the food, the decor and the staff is amazing.i will definitely be back.

Mmmmmm!.highly recommend the sandwich! the indoor seating was a bit noisy so we decided to stay outside.we shared some of the apps and main entrees.went here with a friend who thinks meat should be in every entree, the kind that says crap like, "if you're not going to eat meat than just have a salad.we sat outside since it was a nice night (and there were no available tables indoors) and were immediately served water and told some staff favorites by our server.they did a great job accommodating the larger group i was with.it wasn't too crowded on a saturday evening.the place is in logan square but it's kinda off in its own direction away from the bullshit social life you run into elsewhere around the neighborhood, another thing i found comforting about the experience.seemed extra busy for a wednesday, so we knew that it would likely be a bit longer than their typical service, but stayed and sat outside.awesome place with great food! we loooove their sandwiches / burgers.

Food was so delicious.food is amazing and for someone who enjoys a good steak or burger, their vegetarian options are always yummy.it's one of those things that organic-minded people really avoid so i was surprised they still use it considering they market to organic-minded people.i really like range!  why is this place never busy?!?!?  the french fries are so yummy! they are my favorite part of dining here.we had the watermelon and feta cheese flatbread with arugula, black pepper, and  balsamic vinaigrette.the food and service was excellent.-very limited salad dressing selection.i am sure i will be back to range very soon and can't wait to try out their new and ever changing menu options.i rave about range! i've been here for brunch multiple times on sundays and a few times during the afternoon for lunch and always find something new to admire on the menu or in the ambience of the restaurant (i love the huge open windows when it's warm outside)!i can't speak highly enough of their brunch menu and service.pretty good salad here.

I have to wait for them to get here.nothing complex here fellow yelpers, just an up and coming burger joint with friendly staff and a pretty good cook (i had to go over and shake his hand).catalina took 15 min to even approach us to take our order, we were about to leave when she finally came.only thing i wish would've been better was the time it took for the burger to come out.i would definitely recommend it.my diez y ocho burger was perfect, amazingly tasty and all around satisfying.oh.i was stuffed after esting this meal bc the burger is massive.i don't know about you but i like crispy bacon.the burgers at this place are awesome! fresh, well seasoned, and loaded with options.

We both enjoyed the coleslaw which was less creamy than it was vinegary - just right in my opinion.the coffee counter in the far corner by clark street looks interesting.awesome!  yes the lines were long and annoying, but that's what friends are for.the sandwich came with two sides of more cole slaw and beans.if i do try it again it'll be in about six months when it's quieted down.
Say hi to jessica when you go in.they were delicious, fresh and exactly what we needed during a long day of moving.

So if you come her just be spontaneous with ordering you cant go wrong..i went with my best friends and we share cold and hot tapas.i actually came here about a year and a half ago for my 30th birthday with my family.he did not disappoint.other than that, the food is still top notch and wednesdays are half-price bottle nights for wine - any bottle that lists for $50.i am so impressed with their food and service.best value for brunch.

Nothing like a trusty classic.this is one of the many hole in the walls in wrigley.spicy but deliciously tasty!highly recommend it! we went to au cheval the previous day and i prefer this place!.as a meetup organizer, i truly appreciate such good customer service! i've been to rice'n bread a number of times, and my favorite item so far has been the dolsot bibimbap.the bad: they close at 3 on sundays.we also got the chicken skillet (aka bagolgi).the owner is so kind and funny.will definitely come again!.noms! after finish my meal, i did make a trip to the restroom.
And the cheese you guys - it was melted!!!!which, yeah, not super traditional.must try are their huaraches and coctel de camaron.a great find for us when we were nearby at working bikes.
The ingredients are fresh, the menu is creative and unique, and the service is always attentive.

Their beans were creamy and excellent but really were a side order to that chicken, we found out after we ordered that they have a special during the week that when you order a chicken dinner you get a half a chicken for free.

Not going back.check out "prince's" in nashville.neither of us were impressed with any of them so maybe try the collard greens next time? but let me be clear, there will be a next time because that fried chicken.i went medium to keep my tongue alive, i would maybe try hot next time and see what that does.soo good! will definitely be back.a paste caked around chicken.excellent touch to add some hot flavor to broadway.wow! my girlfriend and i has their classic style chicken with two sides...

I wish it was more of a sauce than a collection of tomatoes, but it was very tasty.the pizza was amazing.food:i ordered the personal classic, which came with lean sausage, cheese, and tomato sauce on a "buttercrust.my friend and i walked across the city to come here and i would say it was quite worth the walk! we had to try their famous deep dish pizza so we opted for a small sized cheese deep dish and split it.

The rice was unremarkable.and over priced.their chicken is on the dry side but it's packing a lot of chicken flavor, whereas other places serve chicken that's essentially just texture and spice and you don't taste.the inside of the restaurant is rather small but it does have a few areas where you can dine in.thank you for your great customer service and quality food!.i would give it a go just to knock out the list of neighborhood joints that are around office area.very friendly owner.authentic and fresh.the smell was incredibly good and the taste was great for the first few bites but once i got past the hot sauce part it was a little bland for me.my chicken shawerma was tasty but cold, maybe due to the hummus.

Billed as an urban american tavern, the dearborn was founded by clodagh and amy lawless, whose kin is known for the gage and the dawson.friendly staff, great food, good prices.what a wonderful and amazing loop restaurant.overall, we were really happy with our meal at the dearborn.we ordered some drinks and the mezze appetizer platter as well as the shrimp and octopus ceviche.would go back, but will stick to beer.the bar has great cocktails.all the above factors make this a five-star experience but there is more! amy and clodaugh lawless, the owners, are always welcoming as is the management team -- ryan, zac and joey.the food, sadly, is not memorable.
Plus they offer gluten free items that actually taste good!..

Omg! so good! magnificently flavorful sauces, tender chicken, festive ambience with great south african music.they were very friendly and helpful.dumb concept for seating and serving patrons - especially in a busy downtown location.as we went inside, a hostess pointed us to either the to-go line or the dine-in line.i'm giving this place a solid, positive three stars.liver can easily be over or undercooked.we certainly could have got a hotter sauce, because the medium really had no kick to it at all.the chicken was juicy and the sauces made it even better.i like everything about this.
Server anna was fast and helpful.16).

The service is not all that grand though.somebody in there has to be from south carolina or georgia or something.so thumbs up for the meal and thumbs down for the pudding.although it may look like your doing the walk of shame, strut ya stuff & smile @ the people staring..the service is great, you can see that they take pride in the restaurant and their food.i really wanted to like this place but that didn't happen.flavor was all good and the side portion of potatoes was yummy, too.

We also ordered a small tray of garden salad (serves 10) which was also very fresh, had plenty of veggies, and came with several different containers of dressing.went there today..i still think it's almost more pasta than pizza, but whatever, if they want to call it pizza - it's pizza.but i like lou malnati's.the crust, the sauce, the cheese, the pepperoni, omg is it awsome! parking is hard to find, if you go on a friday around 4:30-6pm, so bring a friend to drive around while you run in to get the pie.other than that great pizza here too!.this location was staffed with super friendly people and made my experience even more enjoyable.true, the neighborhood isn't much to look at but the pizza here is fantastic.i look forward to returning!.

Valet and cash only-.i felt a little disoriented since i'd never been there before, so i quickly took a seat on the nearest bar-stool.i grew up coming to this place.lemon chicken, plates of pasta swimming in sauce, and meatballs, and all the usual suspects you'would find at an old school  red sauce joint.i can make it at home ( i don't cook ).downside was cash n check only.yummy calamari!tufano's is always busy with great cause.i really recommend this place for a relaxing dinner after a stressful day.oh and it's cash only, which they don't bother to tell you until the check comes.and omg the tiramisu.

Totally worth it!.literally all of them but especially the mac.so keep that in mind.taste is alright but it misses the mark.the chili was light and packed with flavor.that was the first time i had that scrumptious and tender and juicy brisket.poofy, squishy looking bread, piles and piles of brisket.afterall, it's a huge pain to get to.they gave two kind of sauces so i guess it's up to you to decide which one you want and just dig in.my favorite is their hot sauce, i can put that thing on everything.

Avoid the server named alfredo.she didn't go above and beyond (not that there was even an opportunity to do so) but she also was there when we needed her.i personally wouldn't come here for just the food quality but not bad when considering the drinks deals.your entire glass is filled with liquor and your choice of sprite, ginger, etc.maybe two if you can handle itprepare to have to take a few sips (shots?) before you can put your mixer into your glass filled high with liquour.not bad for a strong drink during the week.no knocks...

The guys are all smiling and you can tell their hearts are in the right place.definately will be back again.i'll eat here again!orderchicken shawarma entree with rice and sidessmall order baba ghanoushorder of two kefta kabob (extra).great music, wonderful staff but best of all, food was delicious! the falafels are the best i've had in chicago: small, light, flavorful, crunchy outside! the lamb kabob was delicious, and pita soft and fresh.went here a few weeks ago during my last week in chicago.

Ordered with the breakfast potatoes because yolk has the best potatoes and a side of hollandaise because vacation! sweet, salty, delicious and fatty.nothing was stand out.yolk is a great place to get brunch, a must for hangover, great flavors and not that expensive.overall, tigah says yolk is pricier than wildberry and not as good.

The wait is worth it! great options whether you are in the mood for something savory or something sweet.we ordered two dishes to split and were stuffed and both took home leftovers! can't wait to go back!.the sauce is not too sweet so i always end up licking the plate clean towards the end of it..lots of interesting offerings for breakfast grub, sandwiches, and salads.if you like sweet options for breakfast, this place has stuff that is on a different level than you'll experience anywhere else.we were diverted to the bar but managed to get a table after 10 minutes, so there is hope! started out with roasted almond teas, which were quite delicious.in closing, if you are used to traditional pancakes then this isn't the spot for you..

My only "complaint" would be it would be awesome if they would be willing to panini press these!the cheese selection looked fantastic too.the only things to note is that they do not serve cups of water and they do not do half salads with half a sandwich.pastoral definitely gets five stars from me!i've been to pastoral a bunch of times, each time i've gotten a sandwich, several times i've picked up cheese and other munchies.on lazy winter nights, i'll order a sandwich from pastoral and pick up a cup of soup next door.my boyfriend and i came here after a movie last night upon discovering that the peasantry had closed early for some reason.when i called pastoral, the manager spoke to me directly about assembling the perfect gift box for my girlfriend based on her taste in cheese.it was deliciously savory with hints of sweet and tangy, and the baguette was fresh and delicious.i would call ahead of time to check on the wait before you go there to put your name in.i went in today and tried to piece together my favorite sandwich only to be utterly disappointed when two out of the six ingredients were no longer available.

When we arrived, we were told we'd have to sit at a high top because we were late and the other tables were going to be needed to accommodate other reservations.four of us went to the restaurant yesterday.i'm not even a fan of duck meat!  for our main entree i ordered the pan roasted idaho trout and my husband had the pan seared duck breast.who leaves lobster on the plate unless it was not eatable?.i am very impressed with the food, cocktail list and the service.dined at aquitaine during restaurant week 2016.they all thought that their dishes were good for the most part with the exception of the lamb which a few thought was overcooked and salty.great staff! amazing food! the mussels were great, highly recommended! extensive wine list from all over the world! try the charcuterie plate as well, it's a must with a good wine.the service was wonderful, and the ambience was intimate and elegant.three stars is a stretch.

The fluffy egg and meaty bacon were fantastic.little to no vegetarian options and very little options for pasta to have pasta in the name.quality food here guys!!!!!!! a nice mom and pop place with home made patties and fresh ingredients.

They were out of the beer i ordered so our waiter brought me a similar beer -- which was nice -- but weird because he didn't ask me first.02.wood looks great but doesn't absorb any sound.this place hit the spot! i searched yelp for 45 minutes to find the best pizza for the price in logan square; and i was not disappointed! fabulous pizza.i might be back if other nearby places are busy.highly recommended!.great service and totally kid friendly..it's not that it's bad pizza, it's just not paulie gee's.

We both had crazy amounts of leftovers and left the place uncomfortably full.i was not happy with their food and would never order from them again.if you haven't tried already what are you waiting for?.i'm going to have to try it out next time.two in hand and they were heavy!  in a drunken state, the burritos were pretty good.will be a long time before i try again if ever.here are the highlights:amazing carne asada tacos.i absolutely hate shredded chicken with bell peppers as an entree, meal just becomes soggy with broth.i ordered a chocolate shake but the restaurant put cinnamon on top.as this is my go-to neighborhood lunch/dinner/late-night/whatever joint for tasty mexican food.

Could not have been a nicer guy, genuinely super cool guy.i had an issue with my order and they promptly corrected it and gave me a full refund.some of tables were set up too close to each other that people were bumping elbows or had to get up from their seats to let others in and out from all around them.wow! first place we went to after we landed and the bar for the weekend is already set high!note for vegetarians: i was able to get w mango chutney taco, normally with pork, with the pinto beans instead.very rude, and gave me the impression i was wasting her time.what i didn't know was this place was byob.i opted for the ahi taco and shrimp po' boy.the bread is thick and doesn't add anything, it's meh.i had to give minus a star because their taco menus are on the pricey side (about$4 for the ahi tuna taco!) for some, it's not a lot of food for what you get.small quick service resto but with seating.

Title: pleasantly surprised in pilsen.they know how to cook things to perfection and their long long beer list makes this all the more enjoyable.the brunch punch was awesome, definitely my favorite.the food is heavy in a great way, and the staff has always been super friendly to me.a little too refreshing for my taste.aren't we all searching for such a meal?).it was stuck between fine dining appeal and creature comforts.here for dinner, having potato confit with a slime mushroom and zucchini and celery root.the restaurant is beer-focused, and they have a tremendous draft list.had i gotten it first, then the mythical prophecy of increasingly-better plates would have been fulfilled.

I ordered ahead of time - the meat was juicy, the mac and cheese is to die for!.never order through groupon for delivery or period.99 jerk dinner with dirty rice and mashed potatoes(some of the peel is in it).the fried shrimp was also delicious.

This is one of the best pizza i have ever tasted !!! highly recommended!!! if you are ever in the area this is a must! you will not be disappointed.great value to feed a group.95.oh i enjoy the deep dish pizza here.i ordered the malnati's classic deep-dish pizza and it was delicious! i added pepperoni to it!! it is a must visit!!!!.the pizza and the bites both had very generous servings.see, even a favorite of life long locals.it seems like they're just there to be *there*.'  i would recommend having a meal before you go to lou malnati's because by the time you actually get your food, you'll be famished.

Very delicious and included a pickle, olives and lemon.seems like this place is more known for huge portions rather than quality food.the food came out super fast and i feel like we were there less than an hour.nice presentation of the food when it is served.service was excellent, portions were large and there's a nice patio area.solid.seriously the best french toast i've ever had in my life.all around love this place and wouldn't change a thing.so come hungry!!! i always order the quesadilla, but this time with chorizo.99 for breakfast?!" but when they bring out you're food, you'll understand and think it's a deal because the plate is easily two or three meals.

Perhaps we were oversold on this restaurant, but we found a lot of the food (although quite good), to not be as amazing as expected.mom and pop shops with their 9 to 12$ dish do a much better job.seven out the nine items we ordered were delightful, but two were very very bad.go here.there is also an extensive menu for the bar, and the noise level is pretty high since the restaurant is really small and crowded for dinner.it was super weird being seated (squeezed?) in between two parties, one on either side of us and this took some getting used to at first (probably also because i like my personal space and freak out with randoes too close to me).we literally ordered everything else on the menu.absolutely wonderful array of spice! this was my second favorite dish of the night.we decided to try it out for our anniversary dinner.we had the pickle/kim chi/eggplant appetizer.

I ate from the apps and charcuterie options because nothing on the main menu appealed to me.my friend then ordered as second drink which was also underwhelming.the service and food was impeccable and i will surely make a trip here again the next time i stop into chicago.dinner: we ordered their seafood tower and that was delicious.(let no wine go to waste, my friends.beef capriccio to start was probably my favorite part of the meal.also ordered the pig ears which at first we were skeptical about ordering them but once we tried them we were glad we did!! tried both the regular fries and garlic fries as well as a goat cheese appetizer that were all phenomenal.and while a little on the loud side, once the after work crowd abated, the noise volume dropped to a better level.

Overall, this place still my favorite!.i am a vegetarian and they delivered very yummy food.the only thing is that the place got so loud and there isn't enough space between the diners so you're probably gonna end up joining that date next you and end up with an impromptu group date!.delectable! go for panang escargot! sushi rolls are ginormous and oh so good!.the first few spoonfuls were one of those moments where your eyes cross and roll back as you fall back into the chair; it was that good.i wouldn't consider it the most creative sushi or thai food in chicago, but if you are craving pot stickers and rolls it's worth a try.i cannot speak for the sushi, but i can speak for the egg rolls and the cashew chicken.the food was tasty; we had a selection of appetizers, crab rangoon, edamame, shumai and gyoza.priced fairly.the maguro was perfect - giant, super tender pieces.

It took 20 minutes to get drinks and from the time that we sat down until we were served our dinner, it was 35 minutes.put swiss cheese on your burger!.we'll be back.i've eaten at mighty nice several times and the food, ambience, and service are consistently good.we were hungry enough for just a little food but did not want to wait in line or have the long list of decisions that comes with the food court.it's rich and mushroomy and delicious.natural.the man that seated us was just rude!  also, they were out of many of the choices.the dish was good but not the best for the price.

You can't go wrong except when you see the amount of (decently healthy) food and wonder how are you going to finish it all.pretty good but felt rushed to place my order because it was so busy.i paid and took my sandwich to the window to watch the passersby on van buren whilst i ate.fresh, healthy and delicious!.the spicy falafel is truly spicy, as is the hot sauce, so look out!.i wouldn't get it with the merkts cheddar again, because it was somehow grainy and not what i'm looking for in a cheese dip.not quite like being back in tel-aviv, but it pleases the craving for isreali type food if you have it.

The service wasn't the greatest as the staff seemed to have a conflict over who would be responsible for our table.overall, the ramen was delicious and the atmosphere is lively! i will go back just to try another broth.the food is fresh and well prepared.service was great! this is like a like a japanese tapas restaurant with reasonable priced delicious samplings - so as someone who loves to share food, this was a great find.i thought it was only ok yet my friends seemed to like it.they have a huge list of sake, japanese beer (no, not just kirin/asahi).amazing sake.not sure if even thing paired up well but it was a solid effort.i went with my boyfriend at the time, small plates were decent and lots of variety for both carnivores and vegetarians.

We decided to check it out, but unfortunately it was one of the worst brunch buffets i've ever had.they were loaded with chorizo  (maybe a tad bit too much)the service was wonderful too! i highly recommend fork if you are a savory breakfast fan.i'll definitely be back.i had a house bloody mary and the tomato basil omelet with a side of hollandaise, toast and potatoes.it had a sweet sauce underneath the potatoes and tomatoes (tomatoes i asked to add).there is a lot of good stuff on the menu and choosing what to order was difficult! but i guess that is a good problem to have :).i called saying we may be late 5 or 10 mins for my party of 4 at 13:15.not too friendly, not unfriendly, just professional.this dish made it pretty high up on my list of solid mac and cheeses.this joint was selected as a girl's night out venue, and it did not disappoint!they have a lovely outdoor patio, so get there early and park your butt at one of those tables to enjoy the food, vino, and people watching.

Lovely beer list.great place for a beer and burger.a wonderful neighborhood bar.only about 3 tables were filled, and that includes my party of 4.in the past, i've enjoyed their fried chicken sandwich a lot.it's a pack of airline nuts.not at northdown!!  i absolutely adore this place!!!  awesome bartenders with extensive knowledge of their products, vegan bar food!!  thats right, vegan bar food.located on lincoln ave, come for the beer stay for the burgers!.pork fries were delicious, burger was way too salty and the service was spotty.the large bar size to room size ratio is a big plus in my book.

Go here and i promise that you won't regret it!.we followed this up with the shanghai and szechuan xlb, beef brisket noodles, and hot garlic chicken and all were wonderful.love this place! the food and drinks were amazing and the service was warm and friendly.off the bat, there's a strange mix of weird pan-asian decor, no asian staff or cooks visible, and strange sparse chinese characters on the menu that wouldn't actually be helpful for people who read chinese.it was impressive to watch them make and tasted impressive too! my bf ordered the beef brisket in broth with the hand pulled noodles he loved how tender the beef was and over all would order again, however the beef was a bit fatty.egg tarts - bite size, flaky dough, custard part was good, but flavor hidden by the dough.the beef soup noodle was the perfect way to end a cold day.i would go back for the delicious shanghai soup dumplings but nothing else.

Definitely don't want to come back again.what sets alinea apart is its service and flare.so my expectations were exactly that: to taste and eat amazing food.magical.but these guys were great.i was expecting a lot.service was impeccable.but it's a "once in a lifetime" for me.and now my bar is fucking high!my favourite dishes at the pop-up were the corn soup, the wagyu beef, the truffle ravioli (explodes in your mouth) and the frequently youtube'd dessert, presented to us by grant himself.tickets to alinea are coveted and he's to come by.
She let me have my 6 tamales anyway, because she knew i'd be back (they are that good)..25/each, $14/dozencash only.best tamales i've ever had.

What a great spot on the northwest side.also a nice mix of flavors.the beef empanada was great.the experience was not great at all,  outside was colder then it was inside and it was like 90 outside.we will be going back again and again.pastor taco was spicy and great, fish taco good, steak taco great, short rib taco sooo good!we'll def be back!.i got al pastor and it was so disappointing.cochinita = a hidden gem in chicagoi went to have dinner to cochinita this past weekend and i was truly impressed by their drinks and tacos.now i'm picky when it comes to pastor, i prefer the style where they pound the pork thin and layer it up on a spit, theirs is not like that but didn't disappoint.service was friendly and the food presentation was also very solid.

They all looked like the typical hipster in the neighborhood.i'm sorry, but a pizza, a pitcher and a salad shouldn't cost $80.fyi this place is owned by home slice, the gluten free pizza tastes the same.just adorable.

I noticed they had a brunch menu online and definitely plan to return!.very friendly staff! the space is incredible.the pork mac and cheese is also very good but extremely heavy.and i can't forget the lobster roll - it was amazing flavor.attention all burger and beer lovers!! tuesday's are $10 burger and 1 draft beer.it is a single biscuit appetizer but it was extremely filling.

You wouldn't be sorry.the cashew macaroni and cheese tastes more like "buttered" noodles than cheeze noodles, but it's still very good.moroccan bowl, greek gyro, sesame kale macro6.i also had the seitan burger, which again, was okay, but i have had better.love the food.i learned that it is a meat substitute primarily made from beans, and i just didn't care for the taste.simple unassuming local(?) chain that serves a wide array of vegan and gluten free dishes from around the world.bonus: it's a lot of fun getting your more carnivorously-inclined friends to come and reluctantly admit that vegetarian food can be so damn tasty.seriously, seriously good.

The food has tons of flavor and they pack it with a lot of seasonings.the food here was decent, i've definitely had better.however they have a new lady at the register in the evenings who is rude and loud..the chorizo taco was absolutely drenched in oil but that just might be the nature of the sausage.delicious al pastor tacos, and great friendly service.delicious!the total tab for 7 hungry people served generous and freshly prepared meals came to $65.the kicker is the pickled jalapenos, cauliflower and carrots on the table, they compliment the meal nicely.i'm mexican myself and it's just amazing and brings me back to the homeland.

Love how p & p gets the outside of the steaks a little crispy and crunchy, while keeping it a perfect medium rare inside.this place picked itself up by its bootstraps and got back on track for this guy.the oysters were fresh.the decor, lighting, and tidiness were well appreciated.for the main course, i had a perfectly cooked tender petite filet which they served with roasted garlic.also tried the french onion soup (delicious) and we all had steaks.good, not great.this ended up being just a check mark of the famous chicago restaurants to go to.randomly picked this place out of a list of new restaurants in the city to try, and so happy we chose p&p.this was our first time and our experience for lunch was pretty good.

Delicious tapas and sangria! a couple of my favorite tapas here: datiles con jamon, patatas ali-oli, patatas bravas, pincho de solomillo, queso de cabra, and pulpo a la plancha.i ate my whole portion and was stuffed while my fiancé only ate about half of her plate.is it supposed to be so oily?i don't think the quality of the ingredients is very high.it wasn't bad.we were originally interested in ordering and sharing multiple tapas, but this isn't really the place for that unless you have a large party.ive been to spain and this is far from authentic..went here on a sunday evening at around 5:30 with a friend and my husband.
The service could also be a little faster, but no biggie if you're not in a hurry.i'm not much of a bike aficionado, but this is the place for those kinds of people.

It's great knowing that my food restrictions did not get in the way of the evening! i got exactly what i wanted, the asparagus roll (tempura, special request), sweet potato tempura roll, and a double order of the robata tofu! they've got a great menu with so many choices, they have something for everyone! and if you need to tweak something, don't hesitate to ask, yuzu is very accommodating!!!everyone at the table was pretty amazed at the rate our orders were being brought out.desserts are tasty, as well.the sushi itself wasn't anything amazing though.the rice is made well though.their sushi platters are decorated with sauces drawn like dragons or flowers.glad to have finally found this place too! :).food was good (i am not a foodie), we ordered their avocado mango salad, fried pork belly salad, and pork katsu? we ordered 5 rolls .

I work down the block and been coming here for almost six years now.go for the triple burger!.i've read and heard reviews were talking about stand not greek islands drake and palmer house food nor their prices though jo and sons and  crew are quality good people and would be missed by many if they weren't around.i could do a better job with frozen fries for oreida.highly recommended for hotdogs!.he invited us back for breakfast or lunch the next day and we are all so glad that we took him up on that offer.johnny o's!!!this place rules.my advice is to order the fries well done.

Service was top notch!.we decided to check out seven lions since we were in the area and they happily seated us at the request of having a window seat.we went there on a saturday early evening.in short, its a convenient spot before going to the symphony when you're just looking for somewhere close to eat, but the gage is better.the place is huge inside and was able to accommodate myself and my dozen or so friends who were all in town for a wedding.the service was friendly, polite, and prompt, and the art institute view, and spacious and elegant interior of the restaurant was lovely.our server was very friendly and well informed about the menu items.lesson learned.i don't know if this is common in the midwest but on the west coast you would likely get a 'sorry' and be sent on your way.i finally went to this place after having pass by so many time.

Two words: food poisoning.this place was great! very tasty, clean, and the owner was extremely friendly.a palpable cheerfulness of the staff is endearing.may you eat at asada grill.considering that there is a chipotle and a costa vida around the corner, i thought it would just be some of the same fare.and that is the best burrito i have ever had, hands down.these are as close as u can get to mexico city street vendor food.my first bite into my cheese quesadilla was a disappointment.the enchiladas turned out a bit dry, but still had the necessary seasoning.

Yes, it's a hole in the wall and in the semi-hood, but the warmth, love & care of the owner is present in every dish.great.great food and customer service.real good food, great atmosphere and so personal.do yourself a favor and eat here.

Food was good but not worth being rushed through dinner.the "ravioli" are really large, thin slices of red and yellow beets with goat cheese in the middle.he deserves a promotion or something.with the waiter's help, i chose the shell crab with baby kale salad, caper raisin agrodolce and spicy aioli.harvest apple salad was excellent.all said, i will certainly be back.there is definitely better italian in the city.

Would not recommend.so you definitely get your money's worth.i'll be back because i like a good breaded steak but hopefully they will have improved their quality control by then.also for good friday they have a fish dinner for the local catholics out there.i obviously wasn't expecting gourmet fare, but i was full and satisfied by meal's end.i'll post a pic of the pepper and egg sandwich!  wish i could give 6 stars!.did they change the italian beef recipe? the meat was thinly sliced not like i remember it and the meat was so full of fat i couldn't enjoy it! the au jus was blah.if you are just picking up, you can park on the side street near the entrance and leave the flashers on.sadly, their prices have done up.corporate deliveries should take priority.

Gomobo.the line here does get pretty long at lunch, but that's to be expected from a place as good as this.i've had a love/hate relationship with this place since it opened.my one complaint about this location is how crowded it gets at lunch.wait.definitely agree with katie b that this is the medditerreanian chipotle, but it's actually good unlike its mexican counterpart.i work in downtown and it is really tough to find a fast/healthy place besides subways or chipotle.until i tried naf naf (less than ten-minute walk away!)i've been here two times - both times i ordered the rice plate with chicken roti, tomato & cucumber, red cabbage slaw, and fresh vegetables.the fact that there are so many great options in the area certainly keeps great ones fro being 5 stars.it's a popular downtown lunch spot but don't fret, the line moves rather quickly.

I also love the amount of vegetarian options.this place is amazing! it is huge and has tons of space to accommodate a large group or if you're looking for a table for 2.the melon salad i really enjoyed the serranos and the smoked vinaigrette they used.the restaurant is great for both options - huge space, but has more intimate seating as well.but the highlight of the meal came in the form of the bacon wrapped dates (under the label chicken & pork, for some reason).

They make great coffee and the building they are located in is different.the food is delicious and prices are reasonable.i couldn't even take my coat off because it's so cold.it's sort of similar to "kopi" for people who've had singaporean coffee before.this places defines what i believe all coffee shops should look like in the city."people at the front counter aren't bad, but starting to shop around.their panini sandwiches are also pretty delicious (i like the jupiter sans turkey).girls like me go to jupiter to get yummy egg sammiches! which by the way are better than candy bars, especially when accompanied by awesome art and a turtle straight out of  the neverending story.these are cold, served on a french roll, with chicken or tofu or fish cakes, garnished with raw jalepenos, radish, carrots, and other stuff.the space is instantly comfortable, and the high ceilings somehow just feel spacious and open instead of making the space feel at all cold.

Worth the stop.a bottle of beer was $3.we got our order in 2 minutes, everything was fresh and just cooked! i think it's a great place when you need to eat something good, kinda homemade and cheap.flatscreem tvs everywhere.can't wait to go again.the food was basic but good and cheap.it seemed small but actually filled me up.plus, you can't beat the full bar.the rundown: cheap eats, cheap drinks, & lots of tables and tvs in a very casual environment.yes this place is snl famous so i had to go.

The veggies on top were also scarce and had no pickled flavor whatsoever." it's mostly noodle, but the shredded romaine, sautéed onion, and sliced jalapeños give it salad cred.that being said, this place hits all the core ingredients including a lighter baguette, pickled daikon + carrots, a meat, liver pate and mayo.!!the prices are a bit high for a banh mi but they're worth it to me.always delicious every.so, just know that you're coming for the food not the ambiance and if it's a busy time of day, you might have to just get your food to go.the next time i drive through chicago i'll definitely be stopping by.i can see why this place rates highly with vegans and vegetarians- the best thing i got (classic banh mi & mushroom lemongrass banh mi, pork noodle salad, garden spring roll) was the mushroom sandwich.will be making this a regular jaunt.

Delicious!!  i love the sidewalk patios on division street from may-october.just the right amount of spice and flavor.delicious and great service! relaxing environment.went to this place during the "do division" street fair.we tried kao soi and the pad thai as the mains.
