The chicken pad thai did not impress my dining partner or myself.i don't get it, why is this place jammed every night.such a great spot.i always recommend this place to everyone i know.for most of the dishes, you can choose your spicy level, we did medium and it is finewe heard this place is one of the few places that serves northern thai food, so we did a few specialty items from the northern thai page, really liked the sausage and the one with pig intestine in it, it is all chopped up, so you won't really notice what it is :pthe mango sticky rice is awesome! the mango is very ripe, sweet and super soft, the sticky rice is warm and nicely done.pad thai beef, tom-kha chicken, ka-prow chicken, and a beef pad seew..my thai panang curry was ordinary.best red curry i've had in the city.this is one of my top 2 thai restaurants in chicago (also one of the cheapest).

Just the right size too for hungry but don't stuff me.try the little italy on a pretzel bun- yum!.always really solid.this is not anywhere near a 4.great food, great value..prices were really reasonable for a substantial sandwichthumbs up.both were great and they give you this sauce on the side.his friendly demeanor is infectious.

The menús aré nice adn creative and the horchata is always so delicious!.really great food and super fast delivery.boy are they generous with the serving sizes too, we had leftovers for a full meal the next day!depending on which direction your headed on ashland it may be difficult to recognize the sign, but if you make the extra effort you will definitely be rewarded at this gem.first time and last time going to this place.

Unbelievable service.definitely will be ordering delivery during the glorious winter months of chicago.- margherita "pizza" - if that's pizza, i must be eating something different at all other places.you can choose anything from the menu and you can't go wrong.love this spot! tried this restaurant to get some good mediterranean food.as it turns out, pi-hi cafe is across the street from my friend's partner's high school.let me first begin by saying the service receivesthe owner was very personable and the employees were very helpful for a first timer!the food was real good.all in all a really solid choice for weekend lunch after a long night.i almost lowered a star because i'm being forced to eat at this place twice a week because of the parents loving it.their paninis are super good too.

The staff is always great, too.i would ask to sit in the back or somewhere that's not near the door because it got chilly and i had to wear my coat!we collectively ordered the poutine which we devoured immediately.a very happy surprise that this was so good.one thing that did "wow" me, was the service, it was  outstanding! every employee there made some sort of connection with me (without seeming forced or overbearing) and were incredibly friendly, genuine, warm, accommodating and attentive.solid burger, goat cheese was a little over powering, but tasty none the less.i had the hot and smokey.bottom line: if you are looking for a burger joint that "wows", this probably isn't it, but if you are looking for a solid burger that won't disappoint, this is a great choice.i liked it, but i think it was more the familiarity of of panko than the actual fried pickle itself.also when i left those booths were still empty and only on high top table had customers.

The thing is the dogs were authentic and good especially the sausage chicago dog but the person at the cash register is the most  friendly guy.i also made the dog a combo and ordered a side of fries and drink, saving $1 or so.they could definitely over price their food (like other hot dog places around here) but they don't.the cashier very politely oriented this weary traveller to the menu and ordering system.anyway, their deal for less than $10 included two dogs, a drink and a bag of fries and that was all it took for me!!i live a long ways from chicago, but i'm pretty sure the locals would agree, this place is the bomb for hot dogs and burgers! come getcha some!.the best i ever have.one dog, fries was only $6 - really can't beat a price like that.

I wish we has stayed in town long enough to eat here again, but plan to return when we return to chicago.the first floor is more formal and stuffy, yet still contemporary.however, the food is mediocre and overpriced.bill, our waiter, was really awesome.it was nice to see a smiling bartender for a change.all that "lobster" for $20+.i'm a business owner and being one, i realize people have bad days, i try not to judge based on one encounter but i did not appreciate being pushed.there wasn't enough thousand island to make these tasty.great service, food, and drinks!.

Don't remember the last time i had duck but i would order this again in a heartbeat.the nasi goreng, javanese chicken sate, black pepper gouda dumplings and baked cauliflower cream were the flavor of the evening and each one was fantastic.it does not taste bad, but it does not leave a lasting impression either..the place is small, not too crowded and intimate..(honestly the best mussels i've ever had).now, i might not stay for the winter, but i would definitely be spending evenings at this delightful lincoln park neighborhood gem.poor quality food, over priced with micro sized portions.the nasi goreng was flavorful, fluffy, and moist all at the same time.

It seemed a little loud near the bar area but we were outside so it didn't bother us..we also ordered margaritas, which was pretty good.can't understand the fascination and recreation of tacos.i've definitely had better (at l'patron!!) i tried the taco de chorizo cordero which has spicy lamb and pork chorizo, spring onion crema, radish, and cilantro.ridiculously good.the restaurant is located in wicker park so there's lots of great shops within walking distance.cheap tacos, nice freshly made corn chips and fast service.not tacos, but definitely has mexican influence.it was gourmet elevated meets authentic tacos.

Other than that the pizza was fabulous definitely feeling and i got the small it is plenty for two people.i wouldn't say this is a must stop, but it was convenient because it was right next to the parking structure i parked at.bartender was pleasant and attentive - took great care of us.this was my first time to chicago and i had high hopes of trying an authentic deep dish pie.we were seated immediately but the pizza took 45 minutes to be prepared.however, it was a little tougher this time for me and my other friend that was with me the first time around.very good service here.meh.the pizza was loaded with sauce and cheese, but they skimped on the meat.

2) decor - very nice, smart, little place with a patio.our group ordered a selection of appetizers, entrees, and desserts and were very pleased..you go further down the street for that.perfect place for date night or any occasion to celebrate.we went for drinks after the nutcracker and after first being at the oh-so-crowded (but fabulous) cindy's.

The rice bowl quantity is less but taste is so good !.for the longest time chicago had  a void of these delicious rolls, till a couple years ago.i can't wait to go back to check out the kati roll because my sister said it was really good (it looked like it !).also, they don't even tell us that our order might take a while and we can be seated.and i love that they also have vegetarian options, i hope they deliver soon!.with some work they can be a serious 4.unless the red spicy chili one was pretending to be tikka, but it wasn't.would recommend everyone to try this place, you will not be disappointed.the lamb was moist and juicy while the cilantro mayo was quite a surprise.here i go again! the food was pretty good, the service was eh.

Fast, friendly, made-to-order pizza with a wealth of toppings at a reasonable price.ingredients are good quality, especially in this proce bracket..highly recommend you make a stop here if you're in the city..tasted great and the service was unbelievable, every single team member there was extremely friendly and hospitable - my friends and i all felt the service was like eating at a high end restaurant.i thought it would be impossible for me to finish the 11-inch, but it turns out i could not stop it, and finished it in several minutes! the only thing that i would do differently is that i would dine in instead of taking out.

I highly recommend eva's!.the staff and regulars are all very friendly, sociable, and respectful of other clients and the space, which is incredibly comfortable and homey, especially on cold winter days.this is my favorite neighborhood coffee place.the sandwiches are not bad if you're hungry and they're rather inexpensive.good coffee.so to keep on with my coffee fix, i stopped in here before i went shopping..i come here all the time.
They have special menus for vegans and those gluten free.thank you it is well noted and appreciated! i will be back, i still love lyfe !.

I have ordered a number of items on their menu and have not been disappointed.please improve.as a very loyal consumer of a neighborhood thai place that always performs, it was hard to step out of my comfort zone to try mad love.talk about fantastic service.they visit my work thru fooda the lemongrass curry chicken is amazing!! all the ingredients are super fresh.everything was so good that i rushed back in line to get the chap chae to eat for lunch the next day.

I wouldn't drop another $7 for a glass of wine there.we arrived a little early for dinner on a lazy sunday, and therefore we were only among a few other patrons.the flavors in both were delicious.great gem that you should check out.animale is their second italian concept and more casual.i'd call it upscale fast casual and the food is well worth the cost.honestly, the highlight of our order was the broccolini, which was the veggie of the day.

Nothing fancy but not standard bar fare either.#2  the desserts are not made there.we received the wrong version of ordered fries but after asking they removed the extra charge.it was served on a pretzel bun.love it!.had lagunitas sumpin sumpin sooooo good.first, the trivia guys are totally fun, cool, super cute and really fun.if possible, ask if miles is working while you're there for a very entertaining night!5 stars for this place!.also, the environment is much more classy than you'd expect to find at sports bars, especially one in this area!if you're ever in uptown, head here - you won't be disappointed.

We started with the grilled octopus and farro salad and both were tasty.my mouth is watering again just thinking about it!- civil obedience (drink): light, fruity (but not too fruity) and sweet (but not too sweet) - it was really good.i probably enjoyed the cavatelli the most.pasta isn't worth eating unless it's made from scratch.

That said, you're getting good good for good value, so if you're a fan of fast middle eastern food, you'll be a fan of this spot.some stringy meat bits but loaded pita without skimping and it's a quick walking snack.enjoyed a delicious and cheap lunch here! ordered the chicken salad with hummus, veggies and two of their very tasty sauces, one of which was quite spicy.that sauce is really tasty.great food! great service! really liked it! can't go wrong with anything on the menu.this place was right on the way from our hotel to millennium park.and still stay healthy.

Everyone was super friendly and the quality of costumer service amazed me.the homemade tortillas are spot on and the molcajete is spicy! can't go wrong here.right there and then my nightmare began.homemade tortillas! seeing those warm and fluffy tortillas pressed by hand made them taste that much better.come early, or you might have to wait in line outside the door.plus the service was perfect and the place was a perfect neighborhood establishment.omg!!!!! i just found out that they're byob!!!! best ever birria in chicago!!! period!!!!!!!!!!!! hands down!!!!!! read my previous review..

The crowd raved about the lamb dumplings, the cauliflower was delicately spiced, the salad was awesome, the mussels were tasty (not a home run but worth a try).the samosas though were more than worth at only $4.

41.it's a cafeteria in the basement of the chicago board of trade, and they serve all kinds of food.lots of spinach and lots of fixings these to-go salads are terrific!and why dont you help yourself to a shoe shine while youre down here.i love their turkey club sandwich!  it's stacked with juicy turkey, bacon, lettuce, tomato on white or wheat toast.came for the "famous" fish sandwich - meh.opened the container only to find a live roach crawling around in it.their omelettes and pancakes are amazing for breakfast.

We were quickly served water and warm garlic bread after we were seated.unfortunately, i really don't know why i went back here.can't wait to go back.a really great neighborhood byob joint.we decided to drive a few minutes out of the way to try habana libre.will go back in a heart beat!!.really solid cuban food but the portions could've been larger for the price.full disclaimer: i may be biased, since i'm of latin decent, toward this menu.amazing and unique combo and because of this, i am willing to go back again.since i've been back they raised the prices of the food with a sharpie on the menu, also raised the card limit to $15.

The monkfish was not great and a i thought the dumplings and brussel sprouts were pretty generic.all these cool things, but you're not fooling me.the drinks are pricey, but tasty and each was very unique in their own respects.only glitch was they forgot one dish but were accommodating about it.the food was satisfactory.oyster mushrooms - also delicious, interesting sauce.with so many other choices, we recommend you go elsewhere.but at the same time i feel like mott st.

I tried the pulled pork sammie with mac and cheese and was not disappointed! michael was awesome and delivered exceptional customer service, and i appreciate the recommendation he gave me for my delicious food choice! i can't wait to try this place again, what a refreshing option with the ever-changing food scene in chicago.in addition to the daily specials, they have grab and go sandwiches and salads.i work in the area and regularly visit big delicious because of its convenient location...

Then they were the worst combination of old and overcooked.the restaurant was very clean, and has a great vibe to it.solid barbecue fare at a reasonable price.i ordered the beef brisket & it tasted great but was fatty, which brisket can be.my friend and i split the pulled pork and dinner sized mac and cheese, more than enough food!.food was good, not the best bbq i've ever had, but the sauces were really good.i wish we waited an eternity.i've lived in chicago for a good chunk of my life and i've never been to this place and i was sitting at the bar for 20 mins and the bartender kept looking at me and not taking my order.the 2 other tables by the kitchen were being used by the staff to prep silverware, chat, and for the chefs to take occasional breaks.we started with some apps.
Can't remember which.amazing, fresh churros!  if only i lived a little closer.almost positive this is the best churro place in town.and he created xocoatl.
The family has worked hard to make their dream a reality:dnainfo.
Great job.so far, i've only ordered el meson sandwich which is worth the visit, and an orange frappe.my sister and i were there for about 3 hours.they have wifi avl.perfect for a break.

It seems that many of the employees aren't excited to be there and take care of the customers.four stars! please stock old style/.we started off with a turkey chili which was delicious.my fiance got the black tiger shrimp salad (might be off a bit on the name) and she said it was good but not amazing.totally would recommend trying any if the wok bowls.we a couple of different burgers from the menu and both were delicious.even spelling it out for them..lost 1 star for limited beer selection but they had two hearted so i was still happy.either way good for happy hour or lunch time to talk, chill and have a great time.

Our waiter was fantastic, kind and on point.fettuccine was also great.i ordered a salad with chickpeas and it was good.while we waited for our party to arrive at the bar, the female bartender wasn't friendly or very accommodating.if you're coming in from the suburbs and going to a sports game at united center, they will get you fed, filled and out in time to make the game but don't expect the authenticity and flavor that comes with slow preparation and quality ingredients.anyhow, the parpadelle and chicken with gnocchi special were delicious! can't wait to come back in the summer and enjoy their outdoor space.easy.the service was prompt and friendly, the bill less than $100.probably the best chicken dish i have ever had.

We were hoping for a typical chicago-style pizza, but what we got didn't disappoint.go on tuesdays, they are 50% off.the staff there is always so friendly and welcoming.get them dough sticks playa.the buffalo wings were absolutely delicious! best appetizers! service was great, the waitress was alone and was doing an awesome job tending to at least 6 tables by herself.delicious grilled cheese sammiches and truffles fries.so the bread sticks with cheese was great.very disappointed.this place will be a rare gem.we ended up splitting the dough sticks (the bar cheese sort of threw me, but if you like horseradish i think you'll like it), the giardinara pizza rolls (like an egg roll with pizza filling), shrimp po'boy (him) and brie and apple sandwich (me).

Can't go wrong with what else you mix with those.they charge extra for bread, which seemed strange at a mediterranean place, considering you usually need bread or at least something like pita chips to eat with hummus.the warm tapas were all served piping hot, and everything was super fresh and full of flavor.as a vegetarian, i skipped the bacon wrapped dates, but my dining partners raved about them.the fig was a little sweet, but delicious.it's a small space but it was used efficiently, yet not uncomfortably.dishes are made using fresh ingredients and well sourced.the sangria was quite tasty.food was so delicious - highly recommend the kabobs.they were a little harder than i would have liked.

All of my ratings are based on vegan options only.i'm here from atlanta for the 4th of july weekend.i bought their signature sampler ($13) to bring back to my hotel for lunch: raw ravioli, spaghetti with meatball, and garden burger plus little dessert.literally we bought everything!.they were rich with flavor and extremely light.the mock tuna sandwich is really tasty and the crispy onions are addicting! i also love the raw truffle.i now have diarrhea, and the last food i ate was at this restaurant, last evening.there is no vegan or raw place i've tried in ny that has all of these qualities; raw food here is normally very expensive, with extremely small portions.i also had their dinosaur kale chips which have amazing flavor and crunch.spirulina grapefruit smoothie is awesome.
